description: I've been here a few times for company happy hours and they never disappoint. I love how I don't have to make reservations here for larger groups. The pub is very lowkey which is great for impromptu gatherings. Prices are decent so if you have a large group and a small budget, this is the place for you. They also have great buffalo chicken fingers which are a great snack when enjoying a few drinks.
author: Lushi Z.

description:
This place is quite amazing! They have a ground floor and a basement with the ground floor mainly playing pop music! The dance floor is quite nice with people dancing but doesn't get overly crowded which is good for a night out with friends 
We had a great time there. Would come back!
author: Jin Y.

description: I've been coming here for the past 3 years. I like the atmosphere and the bar staff. It's nice during the week but beware of Saturday nights. The filth of the Marina stumbles in and all chaos breaks lose. The food here is good. I've had the steak salad, calamari and garlic fries. I've had other food here when I was drunk and can't remember what it was but I know it was good. The bartender made me a nice cocktail with mescal last night and I appreciate it and I thought I'd just share that with you...
author: Johny B.

description: A great spot for an afternoon beer!  Kells is a super authentic Irish pub perched in one of my favorite neighborhoods between FiDi and North Beach.  Great atmosphere with original wood floors and the overall look and feel of this spot is amazing!
author: Tom G.

description: we thought it was great.  bartender was welcoming and helpful, we were not treated as one time tourists.  we ordered chicken quesadillas - excellent choice.  we would go back again.
author: Maureen C.

description:
Not sure how this place is an Irish pub, but I enjoyed the place. The ambience felt more like a scene at a high school dance with old throwback music like "DJ got us falling in love tonight." Being back on the dance floor again was such a nice feeling, and the small dance space allowed us to interact with strangers, which greatly enhanced the experience! (LOL one guy stuck out his butt while his friend told us to "smack that a**")

My friend and I drank some cosmopolitans, and they were nothing out of the ordinary.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Kells has always been one of my favorite bars in SF for a very long time, therefore, I feel bad in leaving a bad review of one of your employees. Lately I've noticed they've hired a very rude and violent bouncer/security on Friday nights. Just few weeks ago, I noticed him body slam an innocent guy on his way out at closing hour. Even one of the bar employee was not happy at the sight. 

Last night, my friend and I got in a bit early and had some drinks and got stamps on our way out at 11:30pm so that we could come back in after some food. When we got back, he plainly refused to let us in at 12:30am even though we had our wrist stamps. I have spent so many nights and so much of my money at this establishment, and I refuse to be treated as such. I'm requesting on behalf a lot of people and myself that you remove this bouncer/security person immediately.

Patrons, if you see this guy at the door, make sure to be careful around him. He just might body slam you if you don't agree with him.
author: Tashi L.

description:
Pros:
-Bartenders are really cool and will cater to your needs.
-Upstairs and downstairs give you two different kind of vibes.  
-Just an overall good environment

Con:
-The bouncer! Get rid of him! Will never come back to this place. Does a bad job and has a terrible attitude while doing it. A real f****ng d**k.
author: Chris S.

description: So incredibly sexist. Only allow "females" on the elevated dance floors. I'm sorry but if you're having a good time, you can dance anywhere. To be at a place that so disgustingly caters to the wants of men sucks. They should realize they're in San Francisco where everyone is EQUAL.
author: Annika H.

description:
I decided to go bar hopping with my friend on St. Patrick's day. We were meeting up with another friend at this bar. I think we waited about a half hour to finally get inside. The bouncer told us it was a $10 cover charge. I handed him a $20 to cover the both of us but he wouldn't let us in.

Me: hey I gave you a $20
Bouncer: yeah it's $10 per person
Me: me yeah you took my $20
Bouncer: look can you do the math or not? It's $10 per person

My friend and I just stood there thinking why isn't he letting us inside the pub when we gave him the right amount of cash.

Then the other bouncer finally gave us our stamps and let us in.

That first bouncer was so stupid and rude. He wasn't letting us in which was why I was trying to argue with him.

Finally, we got inside and it was SUPER PACKED AND STUFFY. People inside were so rude too. We were trying to walk through the crowd to find our friend but we couldn't. Some guy pushed my friend when my friend had tapped him to make space for us to maneuver into the crowd. I really hated the pub space. The walls were like probably 5 feet away from the bar itself. So you can imagine trying to squeeze into the crowd with the walls being so close to the bar. The bar was too small, too stuffy (no A/C at all), too dark, too loud, and you literally had no space to move or dance around. They played horrible music. My friend and I looked at each other and started laughing. We couldn't find our other friend so we decided to leave this terrible bar. There were so many bad vibes and it was such a disappointment. I don't see why people like coming here. I'd much rather go to bars in Polk St!
author: Sylvia H.

description: The bouncer is so rude!!  My boyfriend was at Kells, and I was trying to go home, but had forgotten my keys. The bouncer requested a cover charge, and I explained my situation - could I please quickly go inside and grab my apartment keys, I have no cash, and my boyfriend isn't answering his phone.  He blew me off and proceeded to watch me stand outside in the cold for over half an hour until I finally got ahold of my boyfriend.  While waiting, I watched him be incredibly rude to other patrons and even yell at people. Not a nice guy.
author: Maisy P.

description:
We got here before the crowd around 10:30 pm on a Saturday and managed to find a table and grab two rounds of shots at a relatively empty bar. When more people trickled in we decided to hit the dance floor where a strange variety of music was playing and a frisbee was being thrown around. The songs went from an EDM to a hip hop to a pop song and then back around. Very strange but at least they were dance-y.

The major buzz kill was when my friend and I went to the bar to get another round of shots. My friend wasn't being assisted by the bartender at all so I hopped in to help out. We made eye contact multiple times with the one bartender that was working but did not get served despite standing smack dab in the center. After about 15 min of this nonsense, I noticed that people who arrived later at the bar were being served right away. Then I noticed that all these customers being served before me were all white. 

Understaffed? Definitely. Racist? Hm, very probable. I know my friends were able to be served drinks earlier, but maybe there was a different bartender working at that time. All I know is that when other customers showed up, this bearded bartender made his unreasonable priorities pretty apparent. Needless to say we took our business elsewhere.
author: Addy Y.

description:
I went to Kells the day before St. Patrick's Day 2017 and the waitress there was super sweet. We went around 8:30pm and had last call for the kitchen. 

I got a stout beer and fish and chips. The fries and the fish were delicious! It was battered wonderfully and tasted good. I'm pescetarian so you will find me eating only seafood. My company got the chicken wings and they said it was tasty also. Mind you this is all "bar-food" and it is not restaurant style at all but the food is great before a night out. This is the three star rating for the service and the okay bar food.

As for why it does not get 4 or 5 stars,
We came back later when the dance floor started getting popping, there was a $10 cover charge. They music they played was very boring, a lot of pop and not much hip-hop. It was crowded downstairs but the music ended up killing it for all of us so we left. Drinks were ok and a little on the pricier side for a "bar" with that many people that charges cover.

Hopefully they can upgrade their DJ!

If you ever need to ask me any questions feel free to contact / PM me and I will be happy to answer and questions you have.
author: Jeremy Y.

description: This place is amazing. Bar is great. Food is great. Bartenders are wonderful 10 stars
author: Andrew W.

description: Why are only girls allowed to dance up on the benches? Sexist policy that dude's aren't allowed to. In SF of all places. Everyone or no one. Kells will not be getting any more of my business.
author: Dale D.

description:
The pub is worthy of 4 stars. We stopped in for a few drinks and the bartender was friendly and attentive. 
The only negative was when I walked downstairs I didn't see the small sign there was a comedy show going on and my heels were so loud and probably distracting. Also the bathroom door was open when I was using it... So that was uncomfortable.
author: Nicole G.

description:
My coworker needed an itemized receipt for our drinks and the employee/manager was very rude. She called him a "pain in the ass" in front of several customers. 

Very bad service here, and this is coming from an ex server/bartender. Just walk away when customers are getting snazzy with you, don't sit there, argue and make it worse. 

Also, my coworkers were charged for 8 glasses of wine when they only had 6.  

One bill was for $48 for 4 glasses of SB + 1 glass of PN (PN was $9). And the other was for 4 glasses of SB for $43? Doesn't make sense.
author: Jahmisha C.

description:
On the first time I've been there, the bouncer was completely rude because I had to go outside to talk to my friend who was smoking, and he didn't allow me to go back inside bc it was 1:40am but MY CREDIT CARD was inside and I was trying to explain it to the bouncer and he made me wait until 2am to get it back. He was yelling at me and being extremely rude and cocky with all my girlfriends. 
Also one of my friends had a argument with one of the bartenders bc she was charging her more than she charged my other friend for the same drink.
Although the nightclub environment is amazing, the  staff sucks.
author: Luciana A.

description: It was a little slow even on a Friday night. Other than that it was a great atmosphere and people seemed to have fun. All staff was super friendly and inviting.
author: Melissa A.

description: I have no idea who the security at the front is some young looking " I'm too cool for school" guy but he  as completely rude and unprofessional . I'm 21 , I hand him my ID and he keeps asking me questions like it's a fake !?!? Never had that happen to me before he basically just did not want to let me in ...eft right away . This place obviously hires some real nice people...
author: Lara C.

description:
I'm not sure how to describe this place. It's like a mix of everything you don't want an "Irish pub" to be. It really does give Irish bars a bad name.

I'd be shocked if everyone inside was 18 let alone 21. And quite a few were acting their age. The music was strange. There is nothing Irish about it, at least on a Friday night. 

I stayed because I had friends that were there and I paid a cover because I'm a dude. Girls dont have to pay cover. So out of spite for all this bar stood for, I refused to buy any drinks the whole night although I desperately needed some for myself to deal with this pedicament I found myself in. 

The music was just from  speakers and seems to have been curated from someones itunes list. The sound got loud then soft then loud again from song to song. And in between each song there was a 5 to 10 second pause that effectively killed any dance vibes that had been established. You can expect a mix of 90s rap and r&b and hip hop you kind of remember from 2006. A few karaoke classics at least where you could enjoy belting it out even if you weren't enjoying "dancing". Also the downstairs was small and crowded and I spent more time getting bumped and shoved by people going back and forth from upstairs than I spent actually dancing. 

The drinks (that I was given) were average. Nothing to make up for everything else that was wrong about this place.
author: Mike N.

description:
My friends and I came here during lunch time and it was hella dark. I don't know if that was the theme or if all Irish pubs are supposed to be like this because the other Irish pub I went to is also usually dark, but that's during the evening time.

I ordered a Blue Moon and ordered some calamari.

The calamari cost nearly $10 and the serving was literally like half a serving. I honestly thought there would be more but there were just a couple of pieces.
author: Aj C.

description: Good food, nice environment better to come later at night for parties with usually commercial music .
author: Şansın S.

description: Came here during SantaCon. Fun place to hang out. They had good music too.  One of our many stops that day.
author: Lisa F.

description: Loved this place, minus one star for the cover fee. From what I remember it was $5/pp even for girls. My friend and I got here around 11pm on a Friday night, the line looked pretty long, but moved fairly quickly. Once we got in, the bartenders were very attentive we never waited long for a drink. I also got pretty drunk so I know they were generous with their alcohol servings. Kells is a solid/casual place to come to when you are looking to have a good time and just dance the night away. It was crowded but my friend and I jumped up on the benches and had a blast. The music was great, a lot of throwbacks, so everyone was singing out loud at the top of their lungs, good stuff. The crowd was probably 20s to early 30s, not very diverse though. Overall, I can't wait to come back for another girl's night out.
author: Anita S.

description:
I've been coming here for 9 years for Canada Day celebration. We were here on actual Canada Day and there weren't that many people but we made our own party.

The food is actually pretty decent, and we had chicken fingers, quesadillas and poutine. I ordered the shepard's pie and it was quite good. They treated us really well and I've always had a great time.
author: Jordan C.

description:
I liked the bar. What ruined the perfect night was security. One security guy was so rude when I was leaving (1am July 2nd) over my drink in a plastic cup which was as far as we knew fine to leave with because most countries and states don't care as long as their is no glass. He said "no drink beyond here" I said "ok fine" yes all news to me so I did NOT move any further!!! when he said that. BUT because I decided I wanted to finish the drink I paid for, he yelled at me "are you fucking deaf" ...how rude? Who does this security think he is? The other guard was fine told us to drink inside
but his collegue was upsettingly mean to us as paying customers.

 I'm a tourist here I'm far from drunk nevermind disorderly ! Deal with whatever your problems/misunderstandings are, better. I have everywhere else I was today at a 5 star rating on Yelp but that really made myself and my husband angry.
Shouting at women doesn't go unnoticed everyone in the area heard you. We won't be back. Maggie mc gees was brilliant way better service/security I'll definitely be back to there not kells specifically because of that security gaurd. 

"Goodbye and thank you" in Maggie mc gees
"Are you fucking deaf" in kells.
 Lesson learned Maggie mc gees anymore!!
author: Sarah G.

description:
I'm not sure how to feel about Kells.  My coworkers and I came here on a Friday night after work and they weren't that busy.  In the end, that actually was cooler because we could sit and chat without worrying about seats for everyone.  We got some fries and beers all around and our service was decently attentive.  It is kind of cool that it has two levels although I hope one day I don't need to use the bathroom and trek down those stairs!

Beer selection is restricted to UK/Ireland so don't expect more than that.  Drinks are usually strong as expected for an Irish pub.  

If I'm not too picky about a meeting place, then Kells is a pretty good place that can accommodate your needs.
author: Ben H L.

description: We've all been harassed at bars by drunk guys however it wasn't until Friday august 4th when my friends and I came to kells where the bouncers, who are meant to keep us safe, grabbed and touched us inappropriately!! I stayed in the bar for 10 mins before I had to leave due to how uncomfortable I was, and again was verbally abused by the bouncers on my way out!! I don't understand how these "men" were ever hired for their position, absolutely disgusting!!
author: Amber S.

description: I have been here multiple times with no issues before, until this most recent visit. The manager which is a girl who's name I did not catch was a an extremely rude manager. I simply wanted to see my itemized receipt because they gave me a second receipt to pay for after I was out with a couple friends. She refused to give me the receipt and called me a pain in the ass. Then she kept being vulgar to me as I tried to get proof of what I was paying for. Such amazing customer service... I'll be honest, I called her a cunt at the end of the day because she was so unbearable. What kind of customer service is that where they call you a pain in the ass. Customer is always right, right? Learn you're job betch! I wasn't even in the wrong in the first place, just want to verify what I am paying...
author: Frank N.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE. These bartenders add on to your receipts to STEAL tips. Called multiple times, finally got through and some clown decided the appropriate reaction was to say i sounded "like a fucking idiot." 

You guys are scumbags. The only idiot here is the clown that thought they could literally add a zero to a tip and steal from my credit card. Being unprofessional is one thing, but stealing is beyond acceptable.
author: Andrew M.

description: There is a reason this pub deserves a solo star and the reason is their staff. The staff (African-American man in his late 20s) checking IDs at the front door was super rude and stops people by putting his hand close to their shirt collar for no apparent reason, even though i was standing quietly in line. When i reminded him not to place hands inappropriately, he started uttering nonsense and only thing i could do is to bring it up here. This incident happened past Saturday when i visited this pub. People like him should be fired immediately.
author: Adam U.

description: This is great bar for "Happy Hour". The bar tenders are great and always recommending good drinks to try.
author: Michael S.

description: Came here really quick before our dinner reservation at another restaurant. Thursday at 5pm for happy hour, so two beers for about $9. Quick service, sat at the bar, and a private event was starting in the back seating area when we left about 30 minutes later. Place is pretty small and narrow, can't say how food is, but pretty chill bar!
author: Alexa T.

description: pickpockets, asshole bouncers and bad music. Why would you want to come here? Many people have gotten their phones stolen here.
author: Francesca S.

description: Love Kells! Kells is a super fun Irish Pub if you are looking for a good beer, shots or dancing on the weekend nights. Some friends have described the Kells scene on the weekends as a frat house party. But sometimes that is what is needed in SF, right?!
author: Ross S.

description: Have faith in Humanity and Kells!!! After a fun night of dancing and drinking with coworkers at Kells I thought I left my fancy wallet in the Uber ride home. Turns out I dropped it outside Kells on the street. Someone found it and when I called Kells they were so sweet! The bartender remembered our group and said she would be in my area the next day and dropped it off at my house. When I tried to give her cash as a thank you she refused and told me to pay it forward. Thank you Kells for an all around outstanding experience from the music to the dance floor, bartenders (especially Sara) and getting my wallet delivered to my home. You guys rock!
author: Mimi M.

description:
I came here with my brahs for some beers on a Wednesday evening. 

It was pretty quiet with what I assume were a few regulars making conversation with the bartender. Everyone seemed friendly enough.  

I have no complaints and will probably come back again.
author: Sean E.

description:
Came here for a birthday party. Spent majority of the time upstairs by the bar (more space, air, seating). This place is two floors. The downstairs basement is a dance floor, but it's small and not popping. There is no DJ. The speakers are just blasting a playlist of the weirdest mix of songs. You'll hear "Drop it Like it's Hot" from 0:00... enjoy it for the first 30 seconds... get tired of clicking your tongue along with the music to the very last second... realize the value of a DJ... question why you're spending your night in a lame basement... stare at the 5th drink in your hand and wonder how you became such an alcoholic... glance at the couples dancing around you and try to figure out what about you is the reason why guys won't commit... start asking yourself what you're doing with your life during the silent pause in between songs... spiral downwards into a deep, depressing pit... hear something random like "Mr. Brightside" play next... chug your drink to numb the pain you've been trying to suppress... put on a facade of happiness... sing along... and continue going through the motions of life. Or maybe that's just me.
Girls bathroom was also flooding. If you're calling an uber/lyft, I suggest you walk a block away from the confusing intersection that this bar is next to.
author: Annie S.

description: This is an awesome place to have a drink afterwork... Taking into consideration that I've been to Ireland before - this spot in SF brought good memories...they offer reasonably priced drinks... The crowd is cool...our server Sara was nice and attentive to our needs and provided 5 star service . Overall, its a great spot to hang out and have a good time !
author: George B.

description: Not bad though.. music is too loud. Fine if you wanna gather for party like gathering but its too hatd to hold a conversation!
author: Andrew I.

description:
Loving Kells, and looking at other reviews, you gotta have the right expectations. Caught a standup show a couple weeks ago, and just stopped in for a snack and a shot of Jameson. 

On food, tried bangers and mash, exactly what I was looking for with bockwurst and mashed potatoes. So good. And just tried the sausage roll, expect a sausage, but it was more like ground sausage Ina pastry roll with savory sauce. Hit the spot.

Don't expect a trendy experience, just a great neighborhood pub with solid food and drinks. Cheers!
author: Raymond H.

description: I always have a great time here and the crowd is pretty fun. It's always hoppin. I love the two dance floors and they have pretty good music.
author: Cindy L.

description: Such a memorable time here with friends. We came during Santacon, was our first, second for one of the friends. Since it was full upstairs, the bouncer directed us downstairs. It was crowded, hot, but the music was great! We danced until we couldn't anymore. Even though the bar was busy, the bartenders handled it well and the wait didn't seem long for drinks. There was also no cover, which was a plus.
author: Nani V.

description: Service was great until the bartender accused us of puking in the bathroom.  Wtf happened.
author: Marie W.

description: Is an okay place for dancing besides super hot inside and their drinks are awful! They put a fake tequila on patron's bottle and charge you the price of patron! Is the worst tequila ever
author: Layanne L.

description:
Went here over the weekend with girlfriends. LOVE this place.
Go downstairs where the music is- upstairs is just a bar area.
My friends and I closed down the place. The drinks are a little more on the expensive side for a bar, but the dancing and space makes it so awesome.

The toilets never have toilet paper so bring your own!
Good music.
author: Bori B.

description:
"Alright, let's go hit the D-Floor," Jeremy P. boomed as we slipped past the droves of tall, douchey young men at the front of the bar. 

"Never say D-Floor again, Jeremy," I complained, rolling my eyes. 

We got our Coronas and two shots of Jameson on the house for my birthday and moseyed over to the nearly empty dance floor area. Word to the wise: always a good plan to get a bottled beer at Kell's as people *will* bump you and spill your drink. Also mixed drinks are iffy and I, as a person who never sends drinks back, actually have sent one back at Kell's. My G&T tasted like flat bitter water.

Our other friends showed up shortly after and we switched between up and downstairs, enjoying different genres of music on each level. Kell's is somewhat of a go-to spot it seems, I saw people from my high school and old co-workers. 

At one point some tables upstairs were put together and a group of woo-girls got up and started dancing on them, not cute. Even my friend went up to dance (and attempted to pull me up to, but I protested too much).  Plenty of guys tried to get up there too but were quickly scolded by the bouncers who all deserve a medal for the amount of shenanigans they have to put up with. 

Fun times were had all around, but Kell's is pretty much always fun if you're in the right mood and with the right people. 'Nuff said.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Sure, I'll do the Macarena with all the drunk ass bitches here. This spot is run-down, rowdy and the antithesis of classy - perfect for me! Plus, everyone is heavily inebriated, especially in the women's bathroom, where I found a girl passed out on the toilet in a semi-handstand.

If you are in the mood for some sloppy drunk booty (and possibly getting vomit on your dick), look no further than Kells.
author: Suany W.

description: Kell's is a one of my favorite places in SF for lunch and happy hour.  Friendly staff and great food.  They always go the extra mile.
author: Kristie C.

description: This is my second time here. The first time they played really good music. However this time it wasn't as good. The music selection was interesting. They didn't have a Dj and played music through the bartenders iPhone. After every song there was a short pause. This bar reminds me of a huge college frat house party. I will probably give it another try next time.
author: Christina C.

description:
My coworkers and I are doing another company Dutch excursion, we wound up at Kells Irish pub, I ordered the Shepherds pie... Let me just say my mom has made a lot of Shepherds pie and I love them and this was just like moms... Although my moms had more gravy. This is still good everyone in my party is enjoying their food... We have asked the waitress for little stupid things like forks and hot sauce and changed orders half a dozen times and she still kept a smile on her face service was awesome!!! The only reason this place did not get five stars for food is because this place smells so bad like
Old spilled beer..... This place is a must for good Irish food
author: Dominic A.

description:
We came in to the restaurant and one of the waitresses told us to sit anywhere. There was only one other person besides us sitting in the restaurant. 

I enjoyed the toasted Brie, crackers, and fruit. It was delicious and the waitress was very friendly. 

The bathroom is downstairs in this creepy stone-wall area that leads into the bar in the basement, which was not open when we were there. 

This was an awesome restaurant for any occasion, whether it be a quick snack or a more substantial meal.
author: Olivia S.

description: Let me just start by saying the ambiance and decor in this establishment is unmatched. Whether I'm stopping by after work for their delicious fish & chips or I'm coming in blacked out at 1:45am to grind my nuts off on the dance floor, Kell's Irish Restaurant & Pub never fails to leave a smile on my face. The girls who come here late at night are also top tier, classy women. I'm a religious man and I imagine this is what heaven would be like. I already plan to name my first son Kells and my second son Kell. Have I mentioned their tequila soda's are unparalleled? I finally feel like I've found my home. 5/5
author: Stefan P.

description:
This was the only bar open at 4 pm the day after Thanksgiving. We wanted to have a couple drinks before heading to dinner and went to different places that were all conveniently closed. When we arrived to this bar, they had just opened and only had a handful of other patrons. 

Inside, the bar is all dark wood and dim lighting. They already had Christmas decorations up (unless it always looks like that...). My biggest complaint is that the bathroom is downstairs. Truly, I do not like bathrooms at restaurants and bars that are in the bowels of the building (too many like them in Washington DC) so making the seeming long trek freaked me out a bit especially after a couple of drinks. The day before I watched a YouTube video of someone playing The Silent Hill (I think that's the name) jump scare game and...I KID YOU NOT...the hallway to the bathroom looked like the freaky game! Anyway, bathroom was clean so it was all good. 

Service and drinks were fine. The bartender was a cute little lady that jumped up onto the bar to grab bottles high on the shelves. One minor complaint was they only carried ginger beer and not ginger ale, so our drinks tasted different. Took some getting used to.
author: Chas Y.

description: Good place to drink and talk to people on a Saturday night,very cool and friendly people. Hip hop music playing,reasonably price drinks. Only cons is the place get so packed and its hard to find parking.
author: Ed S.

description: Stopped in for a midweek lunch at 11:30 and enjoyed my pints and sausage roll appetizer (as a light meal). The barkeep was a very friendly lad from County Sligo with whom I really enjoyed talking. The atmosphere was slightly more authentic than most Irish pubs, and I appreciated keeping the TV volume muted so I could enjoy the campy Irish tunes!
author: Séamus C.

description:
I came here last weekend around 11:30pm and it was packed. Cover charge for men is $5 ladies are free. They have 2 bars one upstairs right when you walk in and downstairs where there is another dance floor with different music. The only think I liked was the music playing from both upstairs and downstairs. Drinks were a little watered down and it was so tight in there that your drink would spill all over you as your walking through the crowds.

OMG the women's restroom was GROSS! 4 stalls and only 1 stall had toilet paper and toilet seat covers. Right when I walked in the floor was flooded, not even sure if it was urine or water. Both sinks were flooded and over flowing. It was just a mess in there! I had to go so bad so I went real quick and ran out of there. 

I will probably never come back here!
author: Claire D.

description:
No Cover! Came here randomly on a Saturday night, [7.6.13] and it was packed!  It was very fun I must say, because of the variety of music they play.  

- they do NOT play top 40s of house or hip hop music
- they play the MOST random music combination EVER.....which was why it was so fun. lol

Example: They mostly play pop music like Icona Pop "i love it".  I think that was the song that was playing when we walked in, and there were blonde chicks dancing on the chairs screaming "I DON'T CARE!" to the lyrics of the song haha.  The club was filled entirely with fun white people.  

What also made it fun was the random songs they would incorporate throughout the night, like they had a salsa song, then 15 minutes later a country song, and later on an Irish song.  I did not know how to dance to those but everyone had a good time trying!  

So if you're in the financial district and don't have anywhere to go, check out Kells Irish Bar!
author: Raquel Y.

description: Do not come here unless you want your phone and/or wallet stolen. I have been here twice (reluctantly) and both times had my phone stolen. Both times I was far from the only one --after closing, more than 15 other people were complaining that their phones had also been stolen. My friend's phone was also stolen. I think the staff should be more aware and proactive about this issue because people are preyed upon here far more than other places I have been in SF.
author: Jenny C.

description: I have been several times and although it's a fun spot at times, there have been 3 specific separate instances that have ruined the night.
author: Robert S.

description: Great place for a shot of Whiskey and a Pint of Guinness,  Staff is great and fast when you place an order.
author: Robby A.

description: Man I freaking love this place!!!!! I LOVE to dance and this place seems to always be poppin. May be a little rachet at times but I am into that whole scene. Can get super crowded downstairs but ALWAYS plays great dancing music. Guaranteed a fun night out but dont go to this place unless you are ok with lots of people rubbing up on you.
author: Brady A.

description: Friendly and down to earth staff. Good and lively atmosphere (at least during the 2014 Soccer World Cup) Nice deco plus plasma screens for sport events. Good choice of beers and lagers. A place to go back to!!!
author: Pablo D.

description: This place is fun! It has two levels, the lower level is more like a dance floor and is even more crowded. I do not think we paid for cover ( 3 guys and 2 girls in our group). It is not really my scene because I love dancing, even with people I do not know but when people become too touchy it can get weird. However, the rating is mostly because of the bouncers. 10' before closing time they told us to leave, which sort of makes sense but when we took few minutes to wear our jackets they started shining flashlights on our faces!
author: Eva S.

description:
Two rules I live by:

1. I would never consider going here other than on a Friday/Saturday night for a dance.
2. When I think Kells seems like a good idea for a dance on a Fri/Sat night think again and go elsewhere.  Total ****show of people, horrible space, average drinks.

Bridges and tunnels-tastic.
author: Matt G.

description: Accidentally stepped up on the step where only girls are suppose dance, was looking for a friend in the crowd. Security bro immediately threw me down without warning. Almost twisted an ankle. Dont go here. Place sucks! Drinks are watered down. Unfriendly staff. 0 stars...if possible
author: Jake R.

description: I came here for NYE last month. I won't be returning for NYE ever again. There was nothing special and they charged a cover. The bartenders were nice and I didn't wait long for a drink. I liked the crowd except for the really drunk 21 year old who kept knocking drinks out of my hands, and then all over me.
author: Laurina S.

description:
Irish pub fanatic?  You've gotta love Kells.  There's usually a good crowd.. gets kind of rowdy at times, but what do you expect from an Irish pub?  It gets pretty packed upstairs (especially on a Friday or Saturday night), so we usually like to venture down to the basement.  There's a smaller bar downstairs, booth seating, and it's a little brighter.. it promotes conversation and not just drunk dancing!

Generally, they play Top40 downstairs because there's space to dance... not very Irish pub-like, but eh whatever.  We still had a great time.

Oh but FYI, it's totally a sausage fest down there... No lie.

Cheers!
author: Cecilia S.

description:
I LOVE Kell's! There are two levels with two different kind of Music so you have the choice! well upstairs the temperature is cooler and you have more space, more easy dancing and downstairs, it becomes hot and sweaty but the music still really good! 
Drinks are not too expensive, the music is always good, there is always a lot of people and nice friendly staff members.
it's  definitely a great place to go!
author: Kathleen D.

description: My friend saw a bouncer remove a passed out girl from the bathroom. My friends and I found her about an hour later in a ball on the street behind trash cans barely responsive. It is horrifying that Kells staff would choose to leave a girl passed out on the street rather than call her a cab, or get her needed medical attention.
author: Becca B.

description:
Used to come here all the time before the revamp a few years back. Most of the reviews are right, lots of casual dancing fun. Fri and sat nights are mostly a younger crowd. And i probably would continue to go on weekend nights if i was still 21-25. 

I went here the other day for happy hour and there was nothing to complain about. Clean and friendly service. I didnt order food but other tables did and it looked and smelled good. All in all its a solid irish pub. Id come again during the days or happy hour.
author: Kristan B.

description: I only went for one drink late on a Saturday afternoon. It was quiet and comfortable. The bartender was nice. I imagine it gets rowdy at night and during games.
author: P S.

description:
It's funny because even though I've lived in this wonderful city for the past three years, I still feel new. I feel new because I should've been aware of this place long ago.

Location: Situated on the edge of North Beach and the Financial district, it's actually tucked away. It's easy to miss, particularly at night.

Space: the space is decent. The upstairs is the main bar/restaurant area. There's lots of people at tables and others standing around drinking and such. As you head to the back though, you'll feel the place get increasingly hotter, almost like a steam that heads to a downward stair-set. This  is where the biggest surprise was. It led to a dance floor; playing old school jams. Obviously this was the most crowded spot of the place. It was fun though; good dancing and drinking.

Crowd: the crowd is good. It had good energy when I there. People were having fun and dancing which all you can really hope for, right?

Conclusion: glad I stumbled on this spot, however not a fan of cover charges for somewhat divey bars. Worth going though, especially if you like dancing.
author: Al S.

description:
Tremendous evening with AA and MS. We made delightful new friends. 
"Let's step over to my office....."

This is a great place to go dancing, particularly because it's so incredibly laid back and has a grand mix of everybody from preppy east coasters in flannel to Euro-trash- the former being (thankfully) more prevalent. The music is equally eclectic. If you arrive here and nobody has started dancing, it behooves you to begin the trend for the evening....
author: Zak R.

description: Been coming here for at least 10 years. I always have been treated well, with great service. Because I'm a regular , they always know what I like and drink. I'm sure it can get wild late at night,but to have an early evening drink, it's always a pleasure. The food is way better than at most bars
author: Ronald S.

description:
This review is for the way I was treated while watching the USA vs. Belgium soccer match during the day at Kells. 

The place was PACKED and you would think that the staff would be having a good time, watching the game with everybody else, but this was NOT the case with one cocktail waitress in particular.  
Due to the event the bar was very crowded and a lot of people were standing to watch the game.  One of those people was me.  Even though I was still a paying customer, this waitress felt the need to treat me, and the others around me, as though we were simply getting in her way. 

On multiple occasions she literally shoved me in order to get by me without saying excuse me, or anything else.  Other times she would shout at the crowd of people standing there because she couldn't get to those sitting down.  

Sorry, but just because I am not in a seat doesn't mean I should be treated like some bum who just came in off the street. 
I am still a customer who is giving my money to your bar.  This woman singlehandedly ruined my experience watching the game.
author: Sawyer F.

description:
5 stars for being so accommodating!!! 

We needed the downstairs, and the bar manager was very friendly and made sure we had the downstairs. There's a projector so if you need to do anything for a group, presentation, parties, make sure you talk to him and reserve the downstairs. 

Make sure you support Kells pub back by buying lots of drinks!!  We definitely did that.

Also, we requested the downstairs at around 4:30pm-6pm on a Thursday night. This request may not be granted if it was a weekend during peak times, but who knows?! Worth a try :)
author: Jen H.

description: I was here last night with girfriends. My phone got stolen and both my and my friend's jacket was stolen. Another patron's phone was able stolen. My bar staff/bouncer/etc was apathetic and didn't seem to care.  I will NOT be coming back again.
author: Shaheen S.

description: My husband and I have stopped here often on our way  back to Bart, but not for more than a year. Last Monday we stopped in with one of our best friends, Sil, on our way back from a fabulous seafood dinner at Sotto Mare. It was a quiet Monday night,  but the guy at the bar was just a great bartender! Engaging conversationalist, and even treated the birthday celebrants to a wee dram of Irish whisky. I think that deserves a mention. Nice place!
author: Mara B.

description: Sigh... Forgettable bar food. $8 for 3 tiny chicken strips cut in half?! Give me a break. Good thing I didn't tip the girl... Speaking of the total came to $8.68... I handed her a $20 and she game me $11 change? Shorting me $.32 cents? Well that gets -3 stars automatically. Don't waste your time here at this fake Irish bar.
author: Antoinette C.

description:
Great Bar Staff - bald guy is cool and a riot. He runs the show - and there's a few other guys and an adorable bartender - she makes excellent mannys.

We were there early on a Saturday night - got carded - I thought - hmmmmmmm interesting - quiet little bar became wild in 45 minutes - more beautiful women that I've seen all together in this Irish bar. There was a bachelorette party of girls that were having a blast - all dressed up and they were cool. And then so many more women - it had to be 5 to 1 women to men. 

IMPRESSIVE
author: Rew C.

description:
I MET MY HEART IN SF

Tony Bennet may have left it here but I found it here. This bar will always have a special place in my heart. It is the first time I met my wife in person. It was actually work related and not like a bar scene from an 80's movie. There was no Rob Lowe/Demi Moore moment with cheesy 80's music. 

The story is quite funny. My wife was stuck at the bar with another work colleague. We were like 45 minutes late. It was Friday and about 5 of us were driving up from San Jose. When we walked in, I walked up to introduce myself. They were sitting at a giant round table with 6 chairs. I asked if anyone was sitting next to her. She sarcastically said "Yes!" I said, "Okay! Sorry!" And went to the opposite side of the table. One of the best moves I ever made. She hit me with sarcasm and I made a bold counter move, even though the seat was empty. It made her think! Hey wait it was like an 80's movie. 

Its a great Irish bar located on the edge of North Beach and that is where the Italians would want it...right on the edge. 

Typical bar food...like cheese sticks...I'm sure they are good but we will have to ask my wife... since she took the last one!  Another great story. I think she was making a counter move from across the table. Okay who am I kidding this was totally turning into an 80's movie...where boy meets girl. 

Sundays are my typical night of grabbing some Italian food at my favorite places in North Beach. I always seem to walk down to the bar after dinner only to realize that they are closed. So don't come here on a Sunday or you will be denied! It's not a good feeling. I'll always take a photo of the outside and send it to my wife. 

So next time your in San Francisco, stop by Kels. Who knows your heart may be in there waiting to meet you just don't leave it there like Tony Bennett.
author: Anthony M.

description: Pretty cool place we stumbled upon while on a little pub crawl in North Beach... Kells is a little bit away from most of the other bars/clubs. It's towards the direction of the Transamerica building on Jackson Street between Columbus & Montgomery. We were looking for a bar with a slightly younger crowd than the one we just left and here we are walking down Columbus... we hear some classic hip hop being played & some people standing outside the spot. We had to go check it out... They were charging $5 for guys and girls were free admission. We walked in to a standard looking Irish pub with a long bar on the left side. It was packed, good music was thumping & the ratio of guys to girls was favorable to the fellas. That was an added bonus... But the surprise of the night was when we came to find out that there's a basement to the place. That's where the small dance floor was & another bar. It was packed down there too but you could still move around and get to the bar or go back upstairs if you wanted. It was good times. It definitely felt like a nice party in the city... Just what we needed to end the night.
author: Chuck D.

description:
Fun little Irish bar in North Beach owned apparently by some Canadians. So, I came here more recently to celebrate Canada Day with my friend Ayesha and it was so jovial. Friendly Canadians in red, free hot dogs and Poutine and a fellow guy at the bar handing out Ketchup Chips.

I ordered a Guinness and Mulsen (Canadian beer) and was not a fan of either but I'm not much of a beer person.

This is a pretty small bar with some booth seating in the back, so be prepared to stand or shimmy into a seat.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: I love this place. i would give a detailed review but all my memories of Kells are hazy. The bathrooms downstairs seem REALLY FAR when you're seeing double and the stairs keep moving.
author: Mike C.

description:
I usually have great times with my friends on the weekend when I come. 
Casual and fun, it's cool from time to time and you usually meet great people!
author: Carole P.

description:
Just to be clear, for me to be happy going out with my buds I need this:

-minimal to no cover
-good variety of music - preferably hiphop, top 40's
-alcohol
-space

I came here on a thursday night, so its not a surprise... I will have SPACE and no cover! check, check.
Music was so-so... I mean for the most part I can have a blast dancing to my own beat, especially with good company. But the macarena came on & sadly the venga boys.  Hahah fun for a bit... then after while I said "seriously?" Ha. I had three rounds of Jamison shots, so not gonna lie the alcohol made up for it ;)

 All in all, amp up the music so i don't feel like I'm at a family reunion reception.

BTW, I think you're bathroom is haunted. Thank God I went to the restroom with another lady from the bar, she was scared too.
author: Maricel O.

description:
Cool place to come after work for happy hour.  It took my coworker about 10 minutes to order a drink!  He was literally staring at the bartender with his wallet out for a very long time.  I understand that they get very busy, but 10 minutes to get a drink is just really tough.

Anyhow, I'm just rating this place for their happy hour.  Haven't been here for a full meal yet.  Could possibly change my opinion if I come here for a meal and the service is better.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Interesting change of scene after we started out at Bubble Lounge. The crowd here was distinctively different from the Asian yuppie crowd down the block.

It reminded me of the dive bars I found in San Diego along Mission Bay. The crowd was pretty chill and we didn't get too many stares at the bachelorette party. No cover charge, music blasted loud downstairs, and they had decent enough benches down there.

Music definitely reminded me of the top 40's on the radio about 5-6 years ago. We heard a lot of Lil Jon/Ying Yang Twins and Michael Jackson even made a showing!
author: Vicky L.

description:
Stopped by here for dinner with some friends before a night out. The place was really empty at around 7:30 on a Friday, minus a few giants fans that were watching the game on the large TVs they have set up around the restaurant.

First things first, the garlic fries here are BOMB, and only $3. My friends ordered the chicken tenders, and a veggie burger with clam chowder. The clam chowder was probably the best thing, of these three items. The soup wasn't that creamy and the clams were really good. The chicken tenders were mediocre at best. It seemed like they used the bread crumbs traditionally used for panko fish on the chicken, which made the whole dish seem a little off. 

The drinks here are pretty good, though I think $9 for a cocktail is a little pricey for this style of restaurant. I ordered the manhattan, which was strong, and actually really good. My friend ordered the lemon drop, which I did not care for too much. I also tried the pear cocktail, which tasted a little too much like pear for my liking (I know, what did i expect).

Overall it was good place to stop by for dinner, but I don't think I'll be making it back here any time soon.
author: Michelle L.

description: It's big, yet somehow still crowded. I think I paid cover? But the drinks were strong so it doesn't feel like a terrible loss. North Beach at it's Northest and Beachiest.
author: Misha T.

description:
1 star only because there are no negative options.  Staff sucks here, with exception to one nice server lady. Layout sucks, not enough room to move around without having to excuse and pardon yourself constantly.  Then when the bartender sees that he tells you calm down or get kicked out. If you are having any sort of group or party, don't consider this place.  Try Cigar Bar instead. 

As a side note, forgot my jacket here.  Went to pick it up and had my pockets ransacked and the valuables stolen.  Not sure if that is a tribute to the sketchy crowd or the sketchy employees, but either way speaks to the character of this bar.
author: Jon P.

description:
1. Drinks are aggressive so they taste like shit, but you want them to be strong because I don't think I would be able to deal with this place sober.

2. I like that there are two floors and two ways to get downstairs.  So much more room to breathe.

3. I actually don't think I would enjoy this place that much if it were not such a hot spot for my law school friends + SF friends + friends from San Diego / college.  For some reason, everyone always comes here, so I just come because I know i'll see the people I love here.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Great atmosphere.  Fast service.  Wonderful food. A lot happens in San Francisco and most of it happens near here.
author: Steve n lisa K.

description:
Irish night club? This is a review for the late night club. If you are looking for a douchy night club this is probably one of them. Music is always great tho.

 I've been here several times already. Always Friday or Saturday night. There are two areas. Downstairs is more fun and easier to get a drink. Bar tender is very efficient. 

Last time I went there was last Saturday night since I was celebrating St Patrick's around North Beach. It was fun to watch how people were already super wasted in it was only 10PM. There was a fight in the middle of the dance floor but the security staff cleaned it up quickly.  

Pros: Drinks are not too expensive. Music is good. There is always a lot of people.

Cons: Jersey Shore people all over. Fights and people giving you attitude is very easy to find. 

The place is missing something. They can definitely do better.

There was a 5$ cover for guys.
author: Alex R.

description:
Idk about the food and all that, but they have a dance floor, sexy bartenders, decent drinks for a decent price, and a very fun and board music selection. We went there on a Saturday night by recommendation and we didn't regret it. The "regulars" were a fun group of people, the staff was warm and friendly, and we danced the night away until closing. 
We will come back the next time were in SF!  Young fun and mature crowd, good music, nice friendly staff members.
author: Michelle B.

description:
I don't like crowds but I do like dancing- this place has both. It definitely has a fun vibe. But also gets some weirdos... It's a fun place if you want to just get fratty.

I've been when it's quieter to watch a Giant's game and it was a pretty standard bar.
author: Cesie A.

description:
For the last 3 years I've had the pleasure of Mr. Sawgy the manager of Kells & his team having taken care of events & gatherings by just a quick phone call. The service & quality at this place is truly amazing as well as the music & dancing. Sarah who coordinates with you to make sure you event needs are met via birthday party's & events. Thank you Kells Northbeach One of my favorite Go to places for friends to catch up & to have a wonderful nite. 

Best regards 
Joe Palermo
author: Joe P.

description: Horrible service and the bouncers are assholes! It took me forEVER to get a drink and when they finally gave me a drink they had the worst attitude like I was inconveniencing them for buying a drink. The bouncers were harassing my girlfriend and I saw them escalate a fight instead of breaking it up. Honestly worst bar in sf in my opinion
author: Thomas P.

description: No cover for women, I believe $5 for men. Current music - ground floor and basement.  Small place so the dance floors gets packed. AE accepted.
author: Magda G.

description:
Nightlife Review:

Came here on a late Saturday night with a large group for a birthday. There was a line and a cover charge. (Not to worry, ladies! It's free for us, but $5 for men.) The crowd was young and it was packed in an annoying way. There are two floors to this place, and they play different music in each level. However the music mix needs a lot of work, and I can't help but to notice how Katy Perry is played every 30 min or so.

Kells' bar seemed pretty generous with their shots, but maybe I was just trippin. It was kind of weird how our first round of shots was in plastic cups... and then second round was in glass. Overall I had a decently good time here, especially for a dive bar. Also, watch your step if you decide to use the restroom downstairs.
author: Zha L.

description: Paid $5 for a beer off the tap. Otherwise it's like any other bar.
author: Brian H.

description: Not to be rude but those two black american guys who work as a bouncer are being rude and ruin every time we go there, me and my friends are transgender people and every time guys tried to hangout and dance with us the thomas guys always grab them and whisper something in their ear then after seconds guys would avoid us and feel disgusted of whatever that guys told them. Why would he do that to a guess we are there to babe fun and enjoy cause we like the place so much even the guys who watch the door know us already but it's always those two people ruin the party for us! They have to stop discriminating and deal with there own business! Management wake up and protect your guess! Thank you! So disappointing for a place that we love and for those people who treat us like that!!! And when i came up asked him they both laugh at me like as of i don't exist and whisper to each other then totally ignore me. And when i asked those bartenders they won't even tell me there names and keep asking me what's wrong..like we appreciate if were proctecting people and not ruining someone elses night!!!!
author: Melton M.

description:
They charge a cover for guys, but not girls.  I love being reminded that men are second class citizens at bars. 

Bartender with arm tat was a jerk and pretended to ignore me when I needed help with the next point. 

Drunk guys kept brushing up against my gf even after the bouncer told him to leave us alone. 

Music was good.
author: Danny S.

description:
Always a fun time here.  Pretty crowded, very hot indoors.  Different types of music to satisfy all types of people and a fun place to dance!  Prices for drinks are not too bad (compared to the rest of SF).  It's a solid go-to on a random night.  They do, however, charge cover past a certain time (not much, $5).

Very casual, fun!
author: Sheena V.

description: Seriously... If you are an Irish bar you should be spinning some Irish music or SOMETHING! Irish!!!! The bodyguard guy was an a**hole as well!!! Boooooo!
author: Liz M.

description:
Come here of you want to get yelled at by a bartender who thinks the Warriors shouldn't be on TV in your section. I've never been so humiliated. Simply embarrassing. 

I will never come here again. And if a friend recommends it...I'll have to tell them the truth.
author: Jared S.

description: Last night had a blast with my good friend Kameron at this bar after some girls told us to meet them at Kelly's. The bars narrow and long with a long crowder bar at the front thats hard to get drinks form if you don't have cleavage as there's mostly male bartenders. A Corona with line was $8 average for the marina. The music changes regularly but there's a small dance floor in the middle of the place and more tables and setting in the very back. It's a good bar popular with 21-30 age group who want to impress with expensive cloths and large tabs. Even though Im in that age group and make really good money It's not really my seance I like being wealthy so I don't impress girls in short skirts with my pay checks, I leave that to conversation skills good looks and other hug things... Like being a nice guy.
author: Nicholas J.

description: This place sucks. First time here and they didn't let me go in because apparently I was here two weeks ago and I was drunk. Worst security ever. Don't come ever!
author: Paola P.

description:
I had no idea this little Irish pub was around. 2 floors, 2 bars - one on each floor. 

I am a huge fan of the spaciousness of the 1st floor!
author: Jess C.

description:
PROS:
- Fun, relaxed, young atmosphere, reminded me of college!
- No cover for ladies
- Observed versatile dresscode (dresses & heels or jeans or  t-shirt and flats)
- Nice assortment of danceable music (top-40, hip hop, oldies and reggae) 
- A lot of throw-backs that evoked sing-a-longs!

CONS:
- Would sometimes go to other floor to hear the same song that had just played on the previous floor
- Jam-packed dance areas, could barely move at times
- With the college atmosphere comes the wannabe college frat boys and their intentions for the night
author: Stephanie T.

description: Giving it five starts because they have comedy featuring up and coming San Francisco comics. Come to these shows and then you can say "I saw him/her at Purple Onion before they blew up!"
author: Veronica P.

description:
I fucking love Kells.

I also try to never come here on Friday or Saturday nights because it becomes a disgusting, sweaty meat market full of men on the prowl and sloppy drunk girls. When I do end up here on those nights, it's usually to retrieve my shirtless, drunk boyfriend after I get off work. 

People have their nonsense complaints about Kells, but the truth of the matter is that this place has the most wonderful and remarkable staff of any bar in the area. All well humored, attentive, and wildly fun, and if you feel otherwise, it's probably because you're a douche bag and they treated you as such. The manager (Saji) and the owner (Paul) are also real gems.

Good food, good drinks, good times.
Also, the Purple Onion now resides in the downstairs of Kells.

One Indisputable Reason Kells is Amazing:

Upon returning to Kells around midnight after a Pretty Lights show on my birthday, I was standing facing the bar in the downstairs portion when two guys walked past me, one giving me a pat on the butt. Needless to say I was livid. But before I could chase them down into the men's bathroom to beat the hell out of them with my heel, Carlos, the barback, chased them down for me and kicked them both out.
author: Jessi M.

description:
I won't lie, this used to be the hunting grounds for me.  I used to come here for fresh meat all the time!  This place was a good luck charm for the longest.. It would never fail.  They keep this place stocked with lovely drunk ladies.  

Me and a couple of buddies were regulars here and got pretty well aquatinted with the staff, they are great people.  I've had some really great times here.

Some things to know; girls get in free, guyz 5 bux.  No dress code other than no wife beater shirts for dudes.  It is ALWAYS sardine packed on weekend nights.  I'm talking cocks brushing up against asses trying to get somewhere in there.  It's also a smelly hot sauna of bodies downstairs.  Drinks are hard to get, so order a lot at once if you have a table.  Music is loud as hell so yelling in peoples ear is a must.  Aaand they play the same music over and over and over again.... Every night they close up to journey- don't stop believing.

I really hate going to packed bars and clubs in San  Francisco but this is by far one of the best in my opinion.

Cheers!
author: Brad K.

description: Came here on New Years Eve with a bunch of friends. It's a pretty decent bar. There is a small dance floor upstairs and there are a  lot of comfortable seats and tables around the bar as well. The bathroom was downstairs as well as another bar. The floor space and music downstairs was also a little better as well. It kind of just seemed like they were just playing music off of an iPod or something because there were no transitions. The song would end, there would be silence, and then the next song played. Although it was New Years, I don't know if I was expecting too much of this place because there were cups, glasses, and bottles everywhere. No one was cleaning. A little disappointing but I will probably give the place another chance.
author: Cathie N.

description:
Went here for st. patty's day only because there was a man playing bagpipes outside (ironic much?). The scots and the gauls coming together in an irish celebration was a fantastic sight to see.

The bar itself was charging a $5 cover (don't know why, since people were drunk and practically throwing money at the bartenders). It was packed and sweaty and hot, it was fantastic! Go here with your friends out of town to show them what's fly in san francisco.
author: Minks M.

description: Went here on a Monday night to catch up with an old friend after work. Place was not crowded, but there were quite a few people in there enjoying happy hour and watching MNF. We drank a couple of beers and had a couple of appetizers. One of the appetizers was the sausage roll - which the waitress said was their signature dish, and it was pretty good. All in all it was a nice place to have a drink and I would be back.
author: Allie H.

description: This review is for the quiet weekday evening, not the dance floor weekends. I really liked this bar. I was staying at the Hilton nearby and popped in here for some Guinness stew and a pint. It had a nice, neighborhood bar feel to it on a dull Tuesday evening. Warm and friendly. Service was good and people were civil. I'd definitely stop by again (on a boring Tuesday evening).
author: James S.

description:
It is an ok place to drink and party but be careful: DO NOT LEAVE YOUR CREDIT CARD TO OPEN A TAB. in addition to having a 10 dollar minimum to pay with a card, if you leave your card at the bar to open a tab they will loose the card. 

That's right. We left the bar when the bar closed; this was on a Saturday night. When me and a friend realized we both left our cards we went back and a guy opened the door to hand us our cards. My friend got it but the guy said he didn't have mine. I tried helping the guy spelling out my name and the guy got mad and slammed the door in my face. Sure enough I went back on Monday and another bartender gave me back my card. Horrible experience. 

Just use cash if you plan going here at all.
author: JD M.

description: Two friends and I went here to celebrate my 21st birthday after it being recommended to us by a waiter at dinner.  Kells certainly didn't disappoint!! Awesome music, attractive crowd, and great bartenders!  Such a fun place.  I'll definitely be going back!
author: Sara R.

description: This place serves delicious food, where you can also catch a live sports game.  The food is relatively healthy compared to the other restaurants in the surrounding area.  They serve really good salad here.  If you're looking for a salad under $10, then go for the Caesar Salad.  If you're going for the best salad, go for the Steak Salad.  If you are there at the right time, you can also make special requests as to which sports game you want to watch.  They obviously have a great selection of draft beer.
author: Buortau L.

description: I've been coming here for years. The food is a notch above typical "pub grub". The daily specials are the way to go; they really shine. The staff is great. As a regular, it's like a 2nd home. When you compare the quality, You can't beat the price in this neighborhood
author: Roger S.

description: Owner seems to be very sour about life, not a very positive person. Angry, aggressive, insulting in a racist way towards our diverse party of about 20 people. just a bad experience.
author: Anissa M.

description: They need a coat check. My pea coat and my friends coats were all stolen on New Years. There was absolutely no place to put coats on a very busy and cold night. Other than that it's a cool bar.
author: Will L.

description:
All that time working in the Financial District and I wasn't really a regular...

That slowly seems to be changing :) Good place to warm up before you hit North Beach. People are still dressed nicely so it looks fancier than it really is. That's the FiDi crowd for you!
author: Alexia R.

description:
I spent a few hours with my girlfriends, and I had a blast!

Some abrupt stops between music, but the music still rocked!  A lot of top 40 music was spinning at this joint.  

Service was cool.  Ambiance was cool too.  They have two dance floors and bars: One on the main floor, and another down in the basement.  Plus, plenty of sitting rooms for your purses, coats, or when you need to rest your dogs.

Drinks were about $10.  A little expensive.  In a decent area, so I wasn't afraid to leaving the joint.

Overall, nice little dive bar to hang out with close friends.
author: Susan D.

description:
This bar is okay, been here about twice for large group outings. Came here on a 40 and beyond night, so the upstairs was filled with middle aged adults, while downstairs was more of a younger crowd (~23-25 average age?) 

No cover when we got there at 10pm, but when we left around 12am, they started to charge cover. The drinks are okay, depends on what you get. The Cosmo and Long Island aren't bad, but lemon sour/candied apple drop or whatever it was tasted like shit. Everyone REFUSED to drink it.. and c'mon WHO TURNS DOWN ALCOHOL? 

Also, there were these two super drunk white girls who probably ran into me 20 times in the span of 5 mins (no exaggeration), and got me really pissed. Like seriously, stay in your own spot. And no sorry or whatever. So the clientele here can be kind of snobbish and rude. I then see them make their way to the other side of the room while stomping on multiple girls' feet with their stilettos (my friend included) like they own the place. 

Music downstairs was throwbacks from the 90s, which was nice.
author: Michelle L.

description:
My biggest beef with Kells was not the $5 cover, the ridiculously high temperatures in the basement, the rank odors that seemed to randomly lurk around the bar, or the fact that I heard the same exact Rihanna song twice in a one hour window. My biggest beef with Kells was the fraudulent charges on my credit card the day after trusting the bartender at this place to keep my tab open.

I suppose that I cannot prove that the credit card fraud was because of Kells, but the former reasons still warrant a one star review in my opinion. I won't be coming back to Kells anytime soon.
author: Thomas B.

description: This place is so odd. Came here slightly drunk from another (better [Maggie McGarrys!]) bar and bought some drinks with some friends. When it came to last call I had a beer still left so I asked a bar worker if it was ok if I finish it as he wouldn't let a random guy buy me and my girls some shots, and he said that was fine. For a moment in time I thought he was cool. Then one of my girls was on her phone as the bar closed, and he got angry. He told her to not be on her phone at the bar. We ignored this as this is clearly not a speakeasy, and wtf? He became so irate and threw a rag at her which hit our other friend across the face. Wtf???!! He then told my friend, ''wtf are you 12 and need to be on your phone?!'' Ummmmmm wtf???!! We're at a lame ass bar I'm so confused. He was like Chef Ramsay angry at her it was so odd! This place sucks go somewhere else.
author: Jessica W.

description:
I came here tonight to support a friend who was doing a little fund raiser/silent auction for the charity she runs for Lymphoma research.  I like to drink Scotch once in a while, and here I was in an Irish Bar.  I asked for  a Black Label, and the Irish Bartender let me know  that he had a really great Irish Scotch whiskey he thought I would enjoy instead of the overpriced English Scotch Jonny Walker! 

Of course I can't remember the name of the scotch he poured for me but it was really a delicious scotch whiskey, rich and smoky and I have to admit a bit more tasty that the Jonny Walker Black Label I drink more times than not when I'm drinking Scotch!

Not too loud even though the place was packed, easy to carry on a conversation, great atmosphere, a great bar to hang out with in downtown SF!
author: David K.

description: Just happened upon this place on a Weds. night on the way home from doing some errands. Stopped in because the idea of Irish pub fare caught our fancy. Had never been here before even though it's only 6 or 8 blocks from my house. Glad I didn't read the Yelp reviews first. My experience, on the contrary,  was very good. On the ground level, there's the restaurant. My husband had the Irish stew and pronounced it a bit runny but otherwise tasty. I had Bangers and Mash and it completely met my expectations. Then our server mentioned the comedy club downstairs as we were about to exit, so we decided to give it a shot. The amateurs were up first and they were pretty terrible ( f this and f that) but I'm glad we endured them to get to the good stuff. Each successive comic was better than the one before. The whole evening was thoroughly entertaining and the prices can't be beat!
author: Paula H.

description: The bar is actually a lot of fun most nights of the week, but watch out for bartenders who don't listen to your concerns. Luis in the downstairs portion wouldn't serve me a soda. I didn't want my friends knowing I wasn't drinking anymore, so I ordered a soda. He refused me.
author: Danny P.

description:
Kells is a good food choice. I went here for lunch with some coworkers and the place was empty.

Saying that, it took a while to get our waiter to come take our order. He was the only person there so I understand the wait...but it's reflected in my 3 stars.

I got the enchiladas with a side of garlic fries, they were awesome. Wasn't here for the bar, but the food is good.

I hear the night life gets going on a Thursday or Friday or even Saturday night. Will have to check it out
author: Tom L.

description:
Kells- you may be my new favorite spot. For serious. Dive bar+ dance floor? I think yes!

A friend from out of town was coming to visit for the evening. I also had a friend from Italy, who'd never been out in America. (Yes, Kells, you got that honor.) I'd never been, but was open to suggestion- and I'm so glad we went!

The place is inviting. Something about all the wood and spilled alcohol made me feel at home. (Not sure why- I wasn't raised by alcoholics, or in a cabin...) Kells is divided into two floors. The bottom floor is where the magic happens though. The bartenders were friendly, as was the crowd. We had a great time singing and dancing well into the night!

I will certainly be back!
author: Annalise F.

description:
The white kids play in one corner, and the Asian kids play in the other.

The bartenders could use some primers in socializing.  If I wanted to have someone hand me booze without banter, I'd have a Safeway clerk grab a bottle of booze from the display case.

This just makes the dank and musty atmosphere at this place all the less pleasing.  Compound that with the nigh impossible feat of finding parking  and you have a winning combination of my business going elsewhere.
author: Sam W.

description: Kells is a great bar in the financial/North beach area. I came here to watch the Niners Championship game and was slammed packed. I was fortunate enough to get a seat at the bar. The drinks are stiff and the food was very good. the menu offers your typical bar food. Overall I enjoyed being at Kells and I plan on coming by in the near future.....
author: Richard G.

description:
My night in a nutshell:

- heard Kelly Clarkson's "Since You've Been Gone" twice downstairs and one time upstairs

- had an epiphany.  "Don't Stop Believing" by Journey played in every bar and will never fail to get a lot of awkward and belligerent people super nostalgic.  Ever since Jersey Shore, I have to brace myself because I fear that someone might punch me accidentally in the face for over-fist-pumping to that song.  Note to self: stay in the corner whenever a bar plays that song...for safety reasons

+ super generous with drink portions

- the night I went both floors did not have a DJ, rather they were playing music from the bartender's ipod.  (it was a Saturday night too, which is surprising).  The bartender downstairs had good taste in music, not sure of the one upstairs, however.  PS--it was painful to hear the ENTIRE "Hot in Herre" by Nelly.  That song should never be on one's mp3 and should just stay on your CD shelf.

+ no cover, no line, loose on the dress code

+ really nice and charismatic bartenders and workers

+ Not super packed or musty, I can breathe!  I hate going to bars where it's scorching hot and crowded to the point where I accidentally rub up against numerous sweaty body parts as I try to push myself to the restroom.  

All in all, I had a good time.  I will be back.  Hopefully my next experience will be just as fun.  The thing about this place is you have to come here with no expectations.  It's a good place to end up at if the crowd at Bubble is whack.

+3
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: Just like a college frat party -- rowdy crowd, cheap beer, basement dance floor and all. I had an amazing time, probably because I was already drunk when I arrived. (Not a place to hang out at sober, FYI.) Kells was super packed and blasting fun tunes the entire night -- can't remember a single song I danced to, but do remember screaming in excitement and not being able to leave because the music was so fun.
author: Tiffany W.

description: I was told their burgers were really good and I have to say I wasn't disappointed. I work a few blocks away and went for lunch on a friday and got a nice table not too crowded. Also had a good drink here before a well made Moscow mule with the proper mug and all really refreshing. I would definitely come back again for lunch or happy hour. Well kept and not dingy.
author: Christina A.

description: Absolutely horrified tonight. Found a girl unresponsive in the restroom and spent 15 minutes trying to get her out of the stall and help her. Finally, another woman got a bouncer to help carry her outside. 1 hour later my friends and I found this same woman in a ball on the street outside the bar behind trash cans -- still unresponsive. We tried to wake her up and assist her but only had luck when we called the paramedics who arrived a few minutes later. Completely horrified and shocked that the staff at this bar would carry this woman out (who clearly needed medical assistance) and leave her on the street to fend for herself.
author: Allison K.

description:
Decided to stop by here one night because according to my friend's previous visit, "everyone was super wasted" the last time they came and seemed to be having a good time.  There was on going joke the entire night about how drunken white people were singing Nelly's hits from a few years back, so I was a bit eager to hopefully watch this play out.  The singing did not happen the night we were there, but the Nelly CD was out in full blast.  Hahaha.  I guess the upstairs bar area needs to re-vamp their music collection.  Made our way downstairs to the dance floor, but it was pretty empty except from some wannabe hippy girls who were wasted and doing some kind of ancient rain ritual.  Too many drinks, wrong combo of drugs, or just plain off beat?  Not sure, but either way, it was a very entertaining 15 min.  

The place has potential and the servers are quick and really cool, so the place is not that bad.  When we left around midnight, a lot of people were slowly creeping in, so maybe we just need to adjust our timing.  Definitely wasn't a bad experience and I would be down to check it out again.  Oh FYI for any other short asians out there, be prepared to feel like a midget here.  EVERYONE is super tall for some reason or maybe there was some long leg convention that weekend that I just didn't know about.
author: JP T.

description: Did a couple family birthdays at Kells and it was awesome. I reserved a table for about 8-9. The staff were super awesome, they were on top of everything. The food was amazing! Who new pickled mash was delicious?! (Mashed potatoes & pickles). Both family members got free t-shirts from Kells for it being their birthday. We ordered drinks and dessert, and both were yummy! The pub seemed pretty busy, and the restaurant was defiantly busy, and I was thankful that we reserved a table earlier on Yelp. Would come back anytime!! The pub and restaurant are separate rooms conjoining. They even have a cigar bar, however we did not venture into it.
author: Alexis A.

description: My friends and I found a girl unconscious in the street directly in front of the bar this evening. We immediately ran to help her, only to discover an hour earlier we watched a bouncer drag her limp body out of the bar. One would think the staff at Kells would have the decency to do something other than leave this woman in the street.
author: Alexa K.

description:
It doesn't smell like teen spirit here, more like caca.
