Saturday night with a gigantic group, last place on the pub crawl list for the birthday boy. This place is the Bubble Lounge for white people. Dank downstairs dungeon but the people can't dance. And it smelled liked poo.

Girls don't pay cover so hurray for double-standards that work in my favor.
author: May C.

description:
Love this place! This for young adults, recent grads, and mainly those in their 20s!

As a recent college grad, this place suited me and my friends well! Its young, hip, and in the middle of North Beach. There usually is no cover, and for girls, I've never paid more than $5. There's two floors, upstairs mainly for mingling and downstairs mainly for dancing. Its a good mix in what you're into. Its also convenient for those with East Bay friends visiting/grabbing a cab home or driving. 

Tip: If you're looking for a cab in North Beach, try to leave before 2am -- After that, it's incredibly difficult. Go grab a cheese wiz roast beef sandwich down the street while you wait.
author: Erin M.

description: Annoyingly packed. Almost impossible to get drinks on the street level, it's easier to get drinks in the basement. Street level is dank, and swampy, especially on a busy night. Even worse, the basement feels like the butt crack of Satan's ass. Condensation dripping from the basement ceiling. Pretty gross.
author: Joon Y.

description:
Went to Kells on a Wednesday night after a networking mixer at another local bar.

The place was pretty quite. My buddy had come here before and said they had some good bar food. Ordered the fried chicken sandwich special with fries and a pilsner that the waitress recommended. He had the chicken tenders. 

The beer complimented the food and the food was great. I enjoyed the chicken sandwich, one of the best ones I have had in the city. Maybe on par with Chick-fill A considering I was in a bar.  The fries were just the right amount.

The place started to pickup and we left. Overall a very good experience.  Next time I will come in for drinks.
author: Johnny V.

description:
yes yes...we all know this place. 
cheap drinks. bridge & tunnel crowd. two different floors playing equally crappy top40 & 90s hits. Irish themed...i guess, although ive never personally partaken in any car bombs or jigs here...but its definitely got a pub-ish vibe to it. and if you're really lucky you will be surrounded by throngs of cologne-soaked foreigners that try to follow you out as you stumble to go find a slice of pizza... *jokes*......

im not gonna lie, i find myself here drinking $5beers and navigating the masses while bopping to Nelly's Hot In Herre more frequently than i'd like to be able to remember. BUT the ONE star review is not based on the bar overall, because i'd say its on my C string lineup for SF bars that proobably deserves 3stars as a whole. 
this review is purely a reaction to the ABSURD and completely HORRIBLE behavior by one of their staff members Saturday night. 

not a surprise, this place allows, if not encourages saucy hoes {such as myself} to get loose and dance on top of the benches and tables, and i GET that they pull the general bar/club/line/cover rules that girls get privileges over guys. BUT one of my guy friends wanted to join in on the fun and as soon as he stepped onto the low coffee table he was reprimanded by the Kells employee shouting "You need to get down. This isnt a gay bar!"

..........i was APPALLED!!!!!! 

a second time, the same buddy boogied his way up on the table because lets be real here, he was just havin fun, the employee immediately freaked out & shouted some combination of "This isnt a gay bar. / If you want to act like that, go to the Castro" and proceeded to take the table away entirely ruining EVERYONES fun while making himself look like an ignorant, homophobic A-HOLE!!

wow. just wow. 
its 2010 and we live in SanFrancisco. 
that dude needs to CHECK himself or be checked!!!
author: Kaylan S.

description: It wasn't my scene. Very crowded. Very hot. Worse down stairs. I gave it two stars for the decoration it looked very nice and another star because I did not have to pay a cover to get in..but probably will not return.
author: Jessica S.

description: Depending on which bartender is working, expect to pay a different price for your cocktail. My experience: 1st nite, ordered double Grey Goose w/ soda $15.00, the very next evening same drink was $20.00. Grasslands is less then one block away, same drink $13.00.
author: Séamus C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night with my slutty ho friend. It was pretty nice, especially since the cover was free for girls. I hovered awkwardly close to my friend to make sure that she wouldn't be taken advantage of, but I needed not to worry since she was the one that was groping everyone else. So my mission for the rest of the night was to remain unmolested, to varying degrees of success.

It was pretty hot inside, tons of people, and a downstairs area with a bunch of couches where you could sit down. I got some drinks, I have no idea if they were a good deal since I didn't shell out for them. I spent a good 5 minutes trying to get this guy to stop humping me and slapping his hands away. There was a good crowd dancing,  consisting of maybe 1/10th of the actual people in the bar.

I'd stop by again...I have nothing to lose. I'll make sure to wear my granny panties and hike them up to my underboobs beforehand to keep the pervs at bay.
author: Grace Y.

description:
This place get's 3 stars for one reason: a great selection of whiskeys and scotches.  Other than that, its a pretty basic, overpriced, douchetastic bar.  Its great in the middle of a Saturday afternoon when its dead, but don't go at night.

And to Vlad V - Its your own fault for not checking this place out before giving a presentation.  Don't give a place 1 star for your stupidity.
author: Brian K.

description: Completely agree with other reviewers .... Service here is horrible. It's the World Cup... You would think a business would be happy to make )what I'm assuming) is double what they would typically make on a Sunday at 11:00... Nope... Being busy is obviously an inconvenience to the folks of Kell's.... People standing out front waiting to get in.... Staff scowling at the crowd as we file in.  'Which seats are open?' 'I don't know, we're going to be really busy, you might want to go somewhere else.' Wow, just wow.
author: Tiffanie C.

description:
I have been to Kels twice now and so far I love it. Honestly the best bar I have been to in San Francisco.

It's fun! The staff is awesome, they play all different kinds of music (not just the mainstream stuff... which does get boring after awhile). AND i hear the guiness is quite good here! They also make some awesome drinks and I really enjoy this place. 

There's also a downstairs and upstairs. I suggest getting there early so you don't have to wait in a que and pay to get in as it does get crowded quickly and expensive. Also the downstairs is awesome to dance at and the upstairs is usually packed, but is still fun. Pretty much no matter where you go here... you'll have fun 

Go to Kels, order a drink and you'll find yourself staying there the whole night :]
author: Julia L.

description:
First, consider getting a real equalizer for your sound system so that you don't deafen everyone in the joint for a good 24 hours afterward. Last time I still had ringing in my ears the next day was after being 10 feet from the stage at a Green Day concert. Unacceptable, as is having one of your bartenders doing the DJ'ing.

The drinks were good. Bud light should not be $5, but then again, $6 for a Guinness is not a bad deal!

Lots of cops standing around outside, but it *was* St. Patrick's Day, to be fair. Plenty of drunkenness to go around. There were some real preppy frat boys (nice way of saying douchebags) there, too!

$10 cover sucked, but I'm guessing this might have been standard fare for any well-known bar in the area on a holiday.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Stopped in for lunch. Really mellow but by the looks of it I'm thinking this place has the potential to get packed. There is a downstairs bar that is just as big as the first floor bar/dining area.
The food was really good. Opted for the bangers and mash as well as the shepherds pie w a side of seafood gumbo.  Everything tasted awesome. The sausage in the bangers and mash was tender, juicy, and flavorful.  I wanted seconds and the portions are already pretty large. 
Would hit this spot again for a good brew and a nice Irish meal.
author: Sunni B.

description:
Oh Kells,  let me count the ways....
Kells is what you make of it, which for my friends and I its FUN!  

I would recommend getting there a bit earlier (11ish) and then you can avoid the door line & cover (for the fellas).  

The bar tenders are legit, but aren't going to hold your hand.  They respect you if you have it together.  Know exactly what you what you want and have your mullah ready.  If you have that in line you should get good service.  They make GREAT cocktails, well mixed, drinkable but not weak!

The crowd varies, although it does tend to be younger.  Some bridge and tunnel, college students, Hostel travelers (I've always met lots of fun travelers here who love to dance) and a healthy sprinkling of locals like myself.

DANCING, my friends and I have started the dancing here many times, usually downstairs has a better mix or legit dance music (not 80's crap Marina crap) if you have a few drinks and get out there the crowds will follow :)  I miss my favorite HOT bartender (blond guy) that used to work down stairs, I haven't seen him there in some time.  

Food is pretty okay, if you are there after work you can get something yummy to eat and a good beer before heading home.

Over all I've NEVER had a bad time here, I don't go out all the time either (work too much) so I'm a bit distressed about the latest reviews, but I'll keep believing that good'ol Kells is there waiting for me and my next dance night :)
author: Clair F.

description: Went in for a few pints after a day in Chinatown.  The beer and service was great. We did not order any food so I can not tell you about that.  Seem like a fun place.
author: Doug G.

description:
Definitely had been awhile since I had been to Kell's, and after the St. Patrick's Day parade, it only seemed appropriate to keep in the irish theme and go here for the night. 

We celebrated my boyfriend's birthday here and had such a fun time! Having a table to sit at upstairs really made the whole night so much better, it sucks having to stand and carry coats. My only problem with this bar is that there is ZERO ventilation upstairs and downstairs. Why are there ceiling fans if you're not going to use them? Ugh, it seriously felt like I was in the jungle last night, it was so hot haha.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Fun place to dance if you don't mind a pleasant, attentive bartender "spinning" from his MP3 collection with no song transitions. Downstairs it's the same thing.

Young, happily inebriated crowd.

Reasonably priced red wine.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Boo Kell's, Boo...
The trip to the bathroom was scary, down metal stairs to a deserted downstairs club...dark and dank...
Music was bleh and so so...Bouncer was rude... just...no....
author: Michelle G.

description:
This was stop number 2 or 3 of the night.

Being an Irish bar, that alone would usually warrant a 3-4 star review (big fan of the Irish). However, I think I had to pay cover to get in here? Dubya T. Eff? $5 only, but it's the principle.

We didn't stay too long. Hung out on the 1st floor for a bit, checked out the basement dungeon for a bit.

Really though, just a typical, crowded Irish bar. Would be a 3-star, but the bartended in the basement was Irish.. so +1 for authenticity.

Music was actually kind of janky... okay not janky janky... since they DID play Cotton Eye Joe, which is quite possibly the best song EVER.... but the main floor DJ was one of the bartenders, who would select songs from what I believe is a fancy digital library.

So yeah... most people would give this place a 3-star, and I would agree... but Guinness is my friend.
author: Victor C.

description:
Sweet Home Alabama! Expect to hear this song about 5 times over the course of your evening if you hit up Kells. I like sing-along music but 5 times... really?! If there is a long line at Kells, I'd recommend turning around and heading back up to some of the fun bars/dance clubs on Broadway (Impala, Bamboo Hut, etc). You might want to people-watch for a few minutes first because the youngsters in risque outfits can be pretty entertaining. I think I would really love this club if I'd just turned 21... it's young and crazy but really YOUNG. 

Kells boasts an upstairs and a downstairs with different dance-along/sing-along tunes on each level. The cocktails are pretty average stiffness and price. One of my guy friends loves to try to impress the ladies by purchasing multiple bottles of champagne here... fun when you get a few glasses and apparently not TOO expensive. Anyways, my friends can sometimes drag me to Kells but it is just about never the bar of my choosing...
author: Meghan P.

description:
Well fuck this place.

We showed up, myself, another guy, and three girls, on a Friday night.  They told me guys needed to pay a cover.  That's shitty, but fuck it, big deal.  I went to the ATM, took out some cash, came back and paid.  On my way back in I learned they'd let in several guys without charging cover, like any one I gave a little attitude but humbled and paid at the status quo.

Fuck it. Paid cover, got it, got drinks, had fun.  There was something mad stinky going on that other reviewers have mentioned, but that's not my strife.  After about an hour, I went to the restroom, utilized like all normal people, and walked out.  On my way out, one of the bouncers who'd given me shit on the way in told me I was out of line and had to leave.  I was not yet drunk, fully coherent, and asked why.  He pawned me off to another worker who admitted he had only started there a few weeks back and that it wasn't his responsibility to discuss why.  Asked if I even looked mildly faded or out of line, new bouncer responded that I wasn't but it was out of his jurisdiction.  Fair enough.  Fuck these guys.

Effectively, I was kicked out for some short bouncer's fragile ego, after being charged an erroneous cover.  Don't patronize this location til they pull their shit together.
author: Josh T.

description: Run by nothing but useless pricks. The middle Eastern boy was the biggest joke goin and so was the lil 4 eyed goggly loser from Northern Ireland "bouncers" my ass the most pathetic looking rudest assholes you would ever meet in your life. Steer clear of this joint.
author: David G.

description:
What's with all of the terrible reviews for this place? I think the Kell's is fantastic! I think some people gave bad reviews because they don't set the right expectations for this place. "If you want a prime rib sandwich don't go to McDonald's and get a McRib" and if you want to go to a fancy club with a DJ don't go to the Kell's. The bartenders also act as the Ipod DJ so expect to hear the same playlist every time you go, but I don't go to the Kell's for their fine music selection anyway.

Let me tell you why I do like the Kell's: 
- friendly staff 
- cheap drinks ($6 for "fake" red bull and vodka!) 
- people get wasted and dance 
- 2 floors of fun and mischief
author: Michael C.

description:
Requirements for a good time at Kells:
Age - 21-25
Tolerance - Low (drinks could be stronger)
Moral Flexibility - high (lots of creepy dudes and the rare kind of women who will actually still go to a place that has these kinds of creepy dudes)
Dancing Ability - None (everyone likes to fit in right?)

Why two stars?  Get there early, get one of the couches etc downstairs with several non-creepy friends and/or dates, don't let them take the table, keep the bartender down there happy, and you will have a great time without having to move, fight for a drink order at the bar or have some sweaty dude on the dance floor dump half his retained water all over your jacket.
author: Mike V.

description:
I started out the night with my 3 friends at the Bubble Lounge. After looking at the drinks menu we decided this was not the place for us ($13 a drink). So we headed over to Kells. What a great idea that turned out to be! It must of been 80s night because that is all they played for the first hour. The place got gradually more crowded and louder. Everyone was dancing and enjoying the pleasantly strong cocktails for $7 a pop. 

As the night went on there were some glitches with music and for some reason more and more lights were being turned on in the place and it wasn't time to leave yet. Overall a super fun night of dancing and drinking. Only bummer is that one of girls I was with had her phone stolen.
author: Polina S.

description:
Well, I've been coming to this bar since I was under age. It's definitely a college bar and are usually packed on the weekends. 
If we can't think of a place to go and we are in the area we'll go to kells. It's better to get there EARLY. It gets really packed around 11:30 to the point where it's tough to move around. Bartenders are nice and real fast. I would suggest getting a booth downstairs so you have place to hold your stuff. But Be Careful, my friends have had their coats and sweaters stolen so keep an eye out.
The music is alright, it use to be much better. The can repeat some songs so that's no fun. 
Just get there early have a few drinks, dance a lil and move on. If you like sweaty dance floors, this is the place for you.

It sounds like I should give two starts but I'm giving 3 because I've had some good times there. 

:)
author: Lana K.

description:
I don't know where to start...

What's up with all these haters?  It's an Irish pub, with cheap drinks and plays top 40 and 80s music.  If you're not about that, obviously this isn't a place of choice for you.  If you like "nicer places," you can head around the corner to Bubble Lounge (where I might add it gets just as hot) and pay $10 for a cocktail.

This use to be my place of choice, but unfortunately I'm growing up and I can't enjoy it like I use to as frequently.  Pretty impressed the bouncers are still nice to me, after countless sloppy nights and bring a brat.  I also appreciate the DJ bartender for playing my song requests within a reasonable time.  Thanks guys.

Let's stop bitching about the $5 cover, suck it up.  I also get really freaked out seeing people eat there; girls dance on that table, rocking bare feet or stilettos.
author: Laura H.

description: Omg this place was awesome ! My first time was last weeks. My friends and I usually go to.the same bar. But last Saturday we decided we try something new. So we went around search and came across this! There was a lot of people but it eventually got.less crowded. The music is awesome. They play pop, hip hop, 90s hip hop .. also they was a downstairs that played just hip hop which i love !! Only thing i can dance to. I'll be coming here more often.
author: Clariza M.

description:
I don't think so.  It is amazing they can stick around for as long as they have even in this economic downturn while other places much better have gone under - what gives?!?

The setup is not good for people flow at all.  It gets loud and no room to pass.  You think the place is packed until you squeeze through and see how empty the place is. 

What we had:
Dozen oysters - $18 - we were first told they were out then the waitress came back to say we got the last dozen.  While I initially thought we got lucky, the fact is it was the beginning of a bad night to come.  I love oysters on half shell but you can't pay me to eat them here ever again.  I've never had such disgusting oyters before - they should never be served on half shell but steamed w/ garlic and black beans Asian style because they are just way too big and not very fresh.

rueben that was made like panini -$8 - not very good

fries - seriously, are they just heating up Ore Ida? 

widmer hef - $5 - not very cold
 
razzitini - stoli razz, triple sec, fresh squeezed lemon - sugar rimmed glass - $8 - too sweet and it was flat - YUCK!
 
downstairs played hip hop music but it was empty
author: Gloria H.

description: Tried the sausage roll (yum) and the Irish stew, which was basically lamb stew except  in broth--tasty, but underwhelming. Great service.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Came on Friday night after a disastrous time at Rouge.  It was free (which I thought was a good sign right off the bat) and there was no line. woo!
Once we got inside though it was so crowded! I don't remember how much the drinks were but they were pretty good. 
We wandered downstairs to find the bathroom and were pleasantly surprised to find another area for chilling. That lasted about 2 minutes and then the downstairs became packed too. 
The crowd was good (but being a yuppy myself  I tend to like other yuppies). I thought there were a lot of attractive people and there was a lot of mingling.
Getting a cab at the end of the night was not a problem at all (always a plus) and my only complaint was that they start to kick you out at 1:45. 
I'm sure I'll be back :-)

Positives: good crowd, fun atmosphere, free to get in, no line
Negatives: super crowded (but I count that as minus 2).
author: Rachel E.

description:
Went here for a book presentation in the downstairs room. Quite a bad place for such an event:

* it's relatively loud, and there are random noises all the time, probably from the plumbing system

* the pillars in the room make seeing the presenter difficult

* there is no projector, but a flat screen, which is too small for the room size

* tables are made of cast iron and are very heavy to move around for better viewing positions

The food is also pretty odious: all dishes have onion, most of the sides are nothing healthier than French fries, and the Steak Salad (what I ordered) had unchewable parts in every single meat strip.

For dinner+presentations, Axis Cafe is a much better choice.
author: Vlad V.

description: "Dude, did I tell you about the time we went to Kell's? I was soooooooooo wasted. It was awesome. It totally reminded of the house. Remember that invitational with Delta Delta Delta? Kell's even has a sweaty basement where you can grope chicks and we can stand around and look at girls without stepping up to dance with them. Dude, wtf was up with the pledges forgetting to get the kegs?"
author: Carlos A.

description:
Okay. So does it deserve 2.5 stars? Let's talk.



Kells is a great big bar, in an easy to reach location. It's near the thoroughfaire of Broadway. You are near other bars and food.  Cabs are a sure sign at 2 am - no chance of desertion out in the hood. 

The service is great!  I went on a packed Saturday, and waited for 2 minutes at the downstairs bar. Drinks aren't too pricey. The front door guys are pretty cool and easy-going. The bartender upstairs was grimacing. Grimacing. 

And I don't blame her.

Why? Because although this bar boasts an upstairs and a downstairs dancefloor and accompanying bar, the music upstairs is pure unadulterated crap. No joke, Poison, Guns and Roses and Journey and like minded sounds assaulted my ears. And EVERYONE in the bar sang to Journey with gusto. Aighh! Apparently the sing-a-long is tradition.

Downstairs plays more hip-hop, dance and current pop music. It's still not very good. 

I am honestly surprised at how bad the music is. This bar could be amazing, but hey, there're good people, great drinks, and everyone seemed to be having a good time.
author: Em L.

description:
1st Jack & Coke: $5, upstairs, glass.
2nd J&C: $6, downstairs, plastic cup.
3rd J&C: $6, downstairs, plastic cup, with lime slice.
4th J&C: Free (thanks cute British dude), downstairs, plastic cup with Coke & glass shot of Jack.  Wait, what?

This place is weird.  Not really bad weird nor good weird, it's just weird.  It's a pretty chill spot early in the evenings but turns into a mild douchefest later on, as well as a major hook-up spot (and no, I didn't hook up with cute British guy, though I could have...actually, I could've hooked up with a chick too but mentioning those two incidents would be pointless and a waste of your time so I -oops, sorry).  The downstairs bar is easy to maneuver, though it gets incredibly warm inside - you really, really, really don't want to be wearing a sweater in here, no matter the time of year.  Bouncers and bartenders were equally nice and easy to look at, though I believe the place may sometimes charge men a cover to get in.  

Not someplace I'd normally go out of my way for unless I had a reason to, but if I lived nearby I'd probably stop in after work every now and again.
author: Sus... B.

description:
Everytime I come here, I have a great time - whether it's to drink, dance, or watch a game.  I went here again on Saturday night (no cover).  The crowd was friendly (definitely not pretentious...included some cute guys), the music was awesome (hip hop with Journey and other goodies thrown in), and the vibe is just welcoming and fun, fun, fun!  

I just absolutely hate the location because it's right below North Beach/Broadway, and finding a cab at 2am on a Saturday night is pretty much impossible, unless you walk all the way up to Broadway to catch the cabs (definitely NOT fun in heels!)
author: Tram T.

description:
This is a fun spot if you're feeling social!  If you're not, why are you out anyway?  There's enough space here to get your groove on to top 40 hits with an occasional Bon Jovi song thrown in for good measure.

It's a bit like being back in college, but with mid 20-somethings who still remember how to have a good time.   Not an "Irish pub" where you go to sulk and berate the British, people come here to socialize.  Good prices, energetic, young vibe.

Ladies-you will get hit on by some decent guys, enjoy it!

Guys-you can hit on cute girls here without being condescended for trying, enjoy!
author: Justin B.

description:
The only redeeming feature of this terrible, terrible wannabe-cool bar is that I met a fellow University of Montana alum at the bar when he pulled out his MT ID to pay for his drink. We had a round of whiskey and reminisced about good ol' Missoula and The Griz.

Other than that, the place was way over crowded, the music was much too loud and the drinks overpriced. Over, over, over: I'm over Kells.
author: Wes T.

description:
I guess in an effort to re-live my early 20's, I ended up at Kells...seemed like a decent idea at the time.  My friends and I showed up at around 12:45 a.m. and were surprised to still find a cover ($5 but still annoying) and the place was PACKED.  We darted down to the "secret" ("not-so-secret") downstairs bar which was much roomier and much easier to get a drink.  The floors were sticky, the place was filled with really, really drunk people (many of whom were making out), but it's Kells - what do you expect?

I was slightly annoyed by the "fire alarm" that signaled closing time; I feel like I should be able to finish my drink in dignity...
author: Wendy L.

description:
So here's the deal about the place - when I was told we're going there, I hoped on here to check out what its all about - and with all the negative reviews - i was kinda doubting wanting to go there....

after a few drinks - i'm not gonna lie, the night folded out exactly like it said on here.  I went about 7 deep, 3 guys, 4 girls - good ratio... and from the ladies in my group, they continued to tell me how creepy the guys are ... and the "@$$-grabbing" that continued.  
Overall a sub-par expensive night (3 shots of patron, and a beer)=$40?!?!? i thought it wasn't that expensive there, and college people go!!
I must've missed something
author: Ken T.

description: I went to Kells once just for lunch on a not so crowded weekday. The only thing that, I liked at Kells Irish Restaurant & Bar  was the Chicken Pot Pie and The Guiness Beer.The only thing that , I did not like about Kells... Is when I went to go use their restrooms which is downstairs... Once I went downstairs in the begining it was a little creepy because the walls and the floors at Kells were so old and needed some remodeling!!!!!!!!
author: William B.

description:
Went here for lunch. My co-worker always wants to go here (maybe cause he's part Irish, but hey man, where's ur Filipino pride?? j/k!)

Anyways I had the Chicken Enchiladas, pretty good for an ok price, but the dish didn't wow me. I think I'll have to try the Shepard's Pie here next time or one of those "pasty" dishes. But for now, it holds on to 3 stars. :)
author: Quinallison D.

description:
Not as Irish Pub-y as I like, but it'll do just fine.  I was here on a Friday and had no trouble getting drinks right quick.  I don't remember a lot of other girls being there.  I don't think I saw one Suit in the place.  (hmmm, coincidence??)
There was kind of an odd mix of folks there, some youngish, some (ahem) my age, some older than me.  I like that in a bar.
author: Meg W.

description:
I liked Kells, non-suspecting Irish pub upstairs, and dance action with its own bar downstairs. Friday night crowd seemed like strictly 22-25 year olds, so maybe not the most distinguished of spots.

Overall good time, not to mention, good drinks, the raspberry kamikaze in particular! However, would you be interested to know which drink was not good? The irish coffee - because they had "run out". I am going to be honest, I do not know which component of this sacred beverage they ran out of, but.... that is not acceptable @ an Irish place. I feel like I should tell on them to the Buena Vista.

Minus a WHOLE star for: no paper towels in the ladies bathroom. It wasn't even like they were out because it was a big night - there wasn't even a dispenser! Are you joking? Just an air hand dryer - no thank you. And Kells, don't even try to act like this is an environmental move, because it's not.
author: Christina P.

description:
This place was enjoyable. When I first went in, I thought it was just another sport bar with some snack type kind of food. Man, I was wrong. The waitress and everyone else who came to check up on us were very attentive. The food was good. I had one of their game specials... Which I thought was awesome. We ordered sliders, cheese platter, soup, salad and we all had drinks. From wine to beer to mix drinks. They also provided bread & butter - the bread was good. 

While we were eating & drinking, people who were watching the game started to scream & shout because of an exciting moment. (I'm not in to sport) But for some darn reason... It was fun cheering with them. All in all... it was a great vibe, good entertainment, food was good and service did not let me down. I would go back.
author: Nokie N.

description:
Wow, reading the reviews, I kinda feel like a tool for liking this place...but I do.

The music is standard top 40, the drinks are moderately-priced, the crowd is decent, and the bartenders are friendly and fun. For the young single woman, this is the place you go when you're not feeling so sexy, and you need the type of validation only a random drunk dude with slightly-above average looks can provide.

It is also where you go if you want to hook up. Honestly, I've been hit on more times in the fifteen minutes between last call and when the bar actually closes than I have in my entire life. Validated? definitely.

If you're mid-twenties(ish) and feel like revisiting a little bit of those college years, go here. I always have fun, and so do my girlfriends...I think the guys like it too. Of course, my memory's a little foggy...I always feel the need to drink large amounts whenever I do go.
author: Erin M.

description: Great place for dancing, but without the long lines and douchebaggery associated with most clubs.  Come drunk, leave even more drunk.  Potentially +1.  Two floors, so you can pick your music/crowd.  Only drawbacks are that it can get really hot inside, and sometimes it's a little too crowded.
author: Bud L.

description:
Usually when I update a review it's usually to reassure myself how much I love a place.

With Kell's however, I wonder to myself, WTF.... last spring I used to hit up Kell's every now and then with Devon F. and Keith Charles F. always a decent time, Keith loved the "talent." 

So Friday night, when my girlfriend Nicole L. wanted to dance, but not at a club, I thought boy do I have a place for you. 

Unfortunately we were smothered by boys who on a scale of one to talent, definitely score a negative 5. This place is hot for letting in underage patrons, and at the ripe ol age of 24 I felt decades older than the crowd.  

Never again Kell's, NEVER AGAIN!
author: Hailey P.

description:
We love to start the dance partay....but then all the nasties come and dance on the tables.   We get upset, and we end up sitting and judging them as we laugh and mock the music.  If only the playlist didnt consist of three songs which usually include Journey, that spanish counting song or Lady Gaga, we might enjoy our night much more.  For some reason, we keep coming back, hence why I give three stars even after talking so much crap.   Kels should be reserved for those under age 30....and who are ready to deal with drunk girls in heels stepping on your feet.

add:
A year later I would like to edit this.  I love kels.  You are the worst, and the best.   too many great foreigners, and entertaining people.   overplayed but fun music.    I will see you soon.
author: Cassie B.

description:
My mom once told me that it's only as good of a time as what you make of it (aw, thanks mommy) and judging by some of the ratings left I can only surmise that some people expect to have a good time handed to them on a silver platter.  Wah.
My Irish buddy keeps dragging me back to Kells to finish up a night out and while it's not exactly heaven (crowded and hot) I never fail to have a hell of a time right up until closing time when the lights come up and it's time to go to Golden Boy Pizza (see that review too).  C'mon!  Where's your sense of fun when they play old cheesy anthems??
author: Ed P.

description:
This is a DEATH TRAP waiting to happen.

You hear about those clubs that go up in flames and no one can get out, right?

I bet this one will be on the news for that someday.

There is a long corridor to get to the "dance floor" and it is PACKED with people because the bar and the bathrooms are across from each other.

Just the fact that this is a safety hazard is enough that I won't go back; but if you want more info, it's a meat market ladies, and the guys who go to this place ain't the grade A kind.  :(  They were all chubby or short and about 70% of them wearing PLAID.
author: Kitty O.

description:
Wow, I can't believe this place has such low ratings :(  I've always had an amazing time here--tons of memories.  Even though it gives off that frat party feel (which isn't really a bad thing) it's got a pretty diverse crowd.  I always seem to meet a bunch of guys from some European country haha and then we end up on some funny adventure.  Anyways, the music is awesome, both on the first floor and the ground floor.  I love that I don't have to listen to the nasty ass dropping hip-hop (which I do like)  the entire time.  Variety is always refreshing.  

Overall, a great party place.  Also, it's really close to my other love, Bubble Lounge.   I often visit these places on the same night.
author: Karen N.

description:
I asked the bartender for vodka soda with lemon - she made a weird face. Sorry, honey that I have preferences. The older bartender was good at serving drinks. Also, if you do not like your drinks in a plastic cup ( it does not mean drinks are cheaper, my they are may be a dollar here and there from Cigar Bar & Grill's prices) - this may not be the place for you. 

Crowd: If you are looking for frat boys crowd, go here.There would be plenty of room to find someone to get laid with.  I would not be surprised if you have a bad experience or random bad encounters with other people at this bar. 


Overall, never stepping into this place again.
author: Bhoomi B.

description:
I've been to Kell's in Portland several times, so I was really looking forward to the one in San Francisco. What a disappointment! After spending 45 minutes getting there, we were told they weren't serving dinner that night (it was Saturday), but they DID have some bar munchies...And the employees looked at us as though weren't we the strange ones, expecting them to serve food.

This gets 1 star only because I can't give them no stars. What a joke!!!
author: Al S.

description: Love the weekend day/happy hour vibe.  Kells is not too busy, has cozy spots for couples, and attentive staff that puts care into their work.  Talk about a great cocktail!
author: Lauren J.

description: Dancing, dancing, top 40s, Jaeger bombs, beers, dancing, and more beers. Be warned that the dance basement is not open on Thursdays and that the upstairs staff is not particularly excited about table dancing. But, it's a happenin' place for a few drinks if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Megan G.

description:
Kells' is pretty carappy. Almost 90% i have a bad time.  Since there was one or two good ones, I gave them 2 stars.

Simply put the place is full of douchebags.  you have a couple little ones, and a whole lot of big ones.  All shapes and sizes, colors and forms!  At least they keep it clean?

I mean it's rediculous.  Even the bouncers are total assholes (for the most part).  True, I've had some great conversations with some of them, but the rest are just total tools.

Upstairs can be anywhere from semi-crowded to cluster-fuk.  The few times I've had fun were when it wasn't that bad and we could dance upstairs.

Once you get downstairs, forget about it.  Sweaty, nasty disgusting and rank.  It's like a frat party but everyone forgot to invite the girls.

Come here if you feel like going to the marina but don't want to go that far.  Oh, and if you want 40 dudes rubbing your ass as they walk by?  you're in heaven!
author: Joseph F.

description:
I felt like Meryl Streep in High School Musical. 

This place is disgusting. It is the stomping grounds for the worst people in the universe. I think I got herpes just from walking through the bar. The skeeziest guys ever pressed their stinky, sweaty selves against me as I navigate through the masses. Crowded, messy, awful, expensive. The bathrooms were a pit of bacteria, and chicks were fighting in it. 

Don't go to this place unless you hate yourself enough to contract a variety of STDs.
author: Halley B.

description:
Went with a friend to have a beer.  We definitely got what we wanted... the beer.  The bartender was nice but really didn't want to engage with us at all.  It was a slow night so it wasn't too loud or crazy (which I loved)

Overall, I wouldn't dismiss it or recommend it until I go another time and get a real feel for the place.

I really like the space.  It has the "old time" San Francisco feel.  I LOVE that.  So I have high hopes and really hope that next time impresses me.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Oh, Kells...where to begin. Well, let's put it this way. I'm pretty open to fun places where there's lots of people and good music playing. Kells definitely delivered with the number of people (place was pretty packed). However, the music kind of sucked, and the drinks really weren't strong, but I've had worse.

For the dudes: If you're at least 6', love polos, and unabashedly listen to Bon Jovi when you party, then this is the bar for you. It's a pretty fratty bar, and there's definitely lots of pretty ladies to scoop up. If you're into typical 80s bar music and sorority girls, you'll love this place.

For the ladies: See above, as most of the dudes that frequent this place fit the above description. You'll dance when they bang out "Livin on a Prayer," you'll be surrounded by tall dudes looking to take you home and never call you again. Or maybe at least get a second date out of it. You'll be up for some competition, so wear your best slutty outfit if you're looking to meet people. If you're looking for a relaxing night where dudes don't hit on you all night (myself included), then go somewhere else, or wear your favorite college hoodie out to the bar.

Overall: the drinks are pretty weak, but they're not overly expensive (mind you, I live in Manhattan). The music is pretty mediocre (the night I was there, a cover band was playing Beastie Boys, Led Zeppelin, and Jimi Hendrix, to name a few, which at first sounds awesome, but the singer did a pretty good job of destroying it. At least some people were into it.) The atmosphere was lively, though, so if you have a group, it actually might be a good place to go because it's loud and happening. I probably won't be back anytime soon, but I know where to go when I want to drink with my boys and look at/drunkenly hit on pretty bunnies.
author: Pete V.

description:
Went here at around 10pm on a Friday. It was pretty dead. I was about to leave but then it suddenly got really crowded and people started dancing. We ended up staying and had a ton of fun. The music was not super great, they played Kesha at least once!!
There was some good looking people here and the bartenders were friendly which I never take for granted and always appreciate.

It peaked around midnight and started dying out around 1am. I will be back for some for fun in the near future.
author: henrik T.

description: Looking for a bar to hang out with your friends at?  Kells is the place.  If you are looking to pick-up a girl for the night, this is not the place.  However, if you have a group of friends and are looking to have some good beer, watch the game and tell a few stories, this is it!  Patio seating is limited, but the inside has plenty of room for any size party.
author: Tony S.

description: Not a true Irish pub and a pale comparison to The Irish Bank.  They serve Guinness I guess...
author: Ken S.

description:
Kells... where nobody tells. 

I can say, without a shadow of a doubt, that Kell's is my favorite bar in San Francisco. Big statement, right? Where I can understand that Kell's is not a place for everyone, I do think it is a place for anyone who wants to have a great time.

A typical Kell's night would start with a friendly welcome greeting from the dashing doormen. OK- that might not be the case for everyone, and sure, guys do have to pay a $5 cover on Saturday nights, but it keeps out the riff-raff! Covers are typical in big cities and fun bars- it's not like they're robbing you blind like other places around town. 

Kell's usually gets busiest after midnight, as the North Beach bar hoppers slowly make their way to the party. The crowd is a mixture of college aged co-eds, young professionals, foreigners and locals. You can meet a Silicon Valley techie, a couch surfing/hostel-staying Peruvian or your typical USF baseball playing d-bag, all in the same place. The music is great and adds to the general ambiance of Kell's- a hodgepodge of  80s favorites (Bon Jovi, Journey, Neil Diamond are typical), 90s&2000s classic top 40s (Ride Wit Me-Nelly, It's Britney Bitch, Rihanna all guaranteed) with your everyday Irish jig thrown in there somewhere. There is no DJ because this isn't a club, so if you're lookin for the hot 100, look elsewhere. (or request it downstairs, chances are, they'll have it!)

The drinks are stellar. Most notably, and my favorite, the Long Islands from the downstairs bartenders are always on point. Specialty drinks from the upstairs bartenders are also delicious. All the bartenders have heavy hands, as you can't really order a weak drink at Kell's. Where ever you get your drink, it will definitely quench your thirst and leave you a little tipsy, to say the least. 

Overall, the experience at Kell's is a fantastic one. Highly recommended for you and all your friends.
author: Amy B.

description:
I am optimistic (and incredibly naive) enough to believe that my future husband may be waiting in the next bar. Kells might not supply me with the future Mr. F., but it does provide a great time with a lot of eye candy.

Wearing my highest heels and my favorite dress, I headed out last night with my favorite wingman in tow. We ended up at Kells for a friend's birthday party, but after an initial scouting revealed no birthday boy but a bevy of young hotties, we altered our plan. There was plenty of *cough* female talent for the roving eye of my buddy, and I had my hands full with the gentlemen.

I could ramble on about the fun music and great drinks made stronger by the flutter of an eyelash or two, but Kells is really the kind of house-party-in-a-bar atmosphere that you either get or you don't.

I get it. And love it. And the narcissist in me really enjoyed the dance-off for my attention downstairs. There really are no winners when it comes to a threeway competition between a white Carlton Banks, a balding short guy asking me to slow dance to Lady Gaga, and another who felt that he had won just by virtue of it being his 33rd birthday. Sadly, I left the trio emptyhanded as I continued my prowling.

Oh wait. Free drinks bought by handsome would-be suitors later in the night? I win. 

But I'm a girl, so I always do.
author: Devon S.

description:
Abusive Owners and staff.

I went to Kells with a couple of friends last night (Sat.)  and upon returning from the bathroom one of my friends was grabbed and kicked out after being mistaken for someone else who was causing problems.  While he was talking to the doorman his $250 jacket was stolen and they would not let him come back in to look for it.

Sounds bad, right? It gets worse.  Everyone who worked there seemed to be on a power trip and had no respect or concern for the problem, or their subpar relations with their guests.

I eventually found the owner (and his lawyer happened to be there too) and discussed the situation. He then took a step towards me aggressively as I held up my hand asking for him to calm down, at which point he yelled that I was attacking him and a waiter ran over pulled my arms behind my back, picked me up and used excessive force to physically throw me out of the door (does this actually happen?) 

As I waited at the door to have a calm conversation with the owner he threatened me several times while yelling completely belligerently with no concern for his actions or how he handled himself.

After I contact them about their practices and how their treat their guests, I will have nothing to do with this place ever again.  

It is truly unfortunate when some people believe they are on top of the world and the only thing that matters.  People who run such places should have a little more respect for those who visit them, and they should understand that is no way to ever treat a customer with a legitimate concern, and that actions have consequences.

I have never had an experience like this ever before, and plan to never return.  Horrible management.
author: chris m.

description: Its a great place to go dancing. There is modern music, as well as some classic oldies if you wanna move to that groove! :)
author: Emily K.

description:
On our way on a Friday night to Italian right around the corner we spot this place .. cool looking people sittn' out front.. we change our minds.. this is a great spot for a quick chill before going to a late show at the Punchline.. 
We got  Irish beer and the BEST Shepherds pie ever! so hot and great flavor.. cool tunes and not too busy yet but you could tell it was just starting to get going ..  
can't wait to drop by again..
author: Ruth M.

description:
I was there last year for a friend's bday and the party itself and people and the night was fun. 

When we got there, we got seated in the back by the corner.  We were 10+ people so it was nice to be accommodated without space issue. We ordered some foods and beer.  Server was nice and food was ok.

When we were done on the street level, we went downstairs for the bar and dancing floor. Against the wall, they have a few booth style seating area and also has bathroom closeby so you don't have to go back upstairs.  Guess what. I ended up going upstairs every 10 mins anyways. Not because the bathroom was packed. But I couldn't breathe.  The place gets packed!  it's like the subway in Tokyo or Seoul at rush hours. And there is no ventilation or air conditioning at the downstairs and all those packed people start dancing.  Heat will engulf you in no time. Going outside to get some air requires some level of acrobatic skills to make sure you don't rub someone's ass.  

Since there are so many people, you will find a few interesting ones. hopefully interesting enough to make you forget about the mackerel in a can.
author: Kyu K.

description: Kells is a great pub.  I would have have given it 4 stars but for the fact that I want to report the african american bouncer on saturdays who doesn't let brown-skinned people in to the club.  Yes, indeed, especially if they are single and when he thinks he can get away with it ...i.e., being an absolute racist, which he has got away with up till now.  Keep it up buddy and we'll make sure you're not a bouncer anywhere.
author: Messina S.

description:
Kells, Kells, Kells... I have a soft spot for this bar. The ladies and I love to head here around 11:30ish when all other bars have failed to meet our expectations for the night. It's not for everybody though, you have to be in the right state of mind for this kind of debauchery. Maybe not everybody feels like it's that wild though? Maybe it's just my friends? Maybe we should grow up and act our age? Doubt it, but it's possible. I've never had an uneventful night here, either in the bar or after we leave something always happens. Which makes for good Sunday morning recaps. So I recommend it if you are looking for fun, dancing, and a little wonderwall!

Shout out to Dan the bartender, and Eric and Mike at the door... basically the whole staff!
author: Paige B.

description:
When we drink, we get drunk. When we get drunk, we fall asleep. When we fall asleep, we commit no sin. When we commit no sin, we go to Heaven. So, let's all get drunk and go to heaven.

I love me a good Irish Pub and I love me some seXy Bry(i)ans downstairs! :)

Would give it a *5* buuuuut, they need some better ventilation down under.  Good music, good people, good vibes!!
author: Allison N.

description: This review is for the dancing on Saturday nights. I went last weekend with my sister from another mister and we had had a pretty good time. There are two separate floors for dancing. I would say the music was a mix of current top 40's mixed with classic songs from the 80's, 90's, and early 2000's. The night that we went there seemed to be a ridiculous amount of 5'8" white guys and basic bitches acting like idiots on the first floor and then hooking up EVERYWHERE around 1am. The lower floor was a bit better,  it was less crowded and a more diverse group of people were hanging about. There are plenty of places to sit on both levels which is a plus for those of us rocking the 3 + inch heels. Ample parking in the side streets around the bar also got this place some points. Overall this place was okay, I would probably go here again as a warm up for the rest of the night, but it wouldn't be the focal point of the evening.
author: Adrina F.

description: My review is only based on Friday and Saturday night as I have not really gone on any other night though so I could be biased.I do not know how this bar is rated with the stars it has. This is the ultimate gem in terms of bars.   On this so called Friday and Saturday night people are here to have a "go out" night. They place things from the 80's to classic hits to top 40's. The crowd in general is very energized and if you want to dance, this is the place.
author: Patrick W.

description: Most consistent Cobb Salad in the neighborhood and their soup of the day can be pretty incredible. Service is fast and friendly and prices are reasonable. Good easy lunch spot.
author: Kelly M.

description: Been here with some coworkers, and it's pretty much your basic bar. Service is great and prompt (but that might have been because they picked up immediately from our attire that we were all at a work function aka we were going to run up a huge bill and tip heavily).
author: Melody L.

description:
Horrible bar with bad bartenders and worse music. It gets really hot and stuffy both upstairs and downstairs.
BUT I met and got a picture with Tim Lincecum here, so I had to give it three stars, otherwise it would have been one
author: Meghan B.

description:
Pros: good DJ downstairs, not terribly crowded dance floor, places to sit down when tired from booty-shaking

Cons: Really crowded bar, sweaty, paid a $10 cover (ridiculous!)

I had fun when I went but did not appreciate having to pay a cover. I'll probably go back at some point though.
author: Jeanette L.

description: I can never get tired of this place. The drinks are the right price and the energy is always up. It does get overcrowded at times, but tolerable if your dancing around with everyone. You can go dressed up or down because it suits both. A great place for a fun night out in SF!
author: Jessica  Y.

description:
I like Kells. It's a great place to show up to around 11PM or so and get ready to be energized by an awesome crowd and great staff. It's a good place to get some dancing done downstairs and bring your friends because the place is full of interesting people to meet and mesh groups with. 

Let's say it's setup many fortuitous encounters. 

One time a drink's potency was brought into question and the bartender reset the drink immediately and poured out a shot for good measure. Not only does the staff deliver, they do it in a pretty awesome manner. 

The upstairs has a bit of a bottle neck  - so stay clear of that area and you'll be more than fine. Good luck and have some fun!
author: Niket D.

description:
Came here to reunite with old friends. Things seems to be unchanged. Faces are younger, people had better fashion sense, except the people who wore Christmas attire....AWESOME!

Bartenders were better, I think last time, they had two of them, now they have four on the top and two at the bottom. 

One thing about bars, you can never have too many bartenders. The more, the more you can serve people. 

It's been a long time since I came here, and now I know why I haven't been back. Same old tunes every time I've attended. I guess they don't have dj's on the lower level anymore. 

Other than that, it's great if you're young, you'll fit right in.
author: Stanley K.

description: I had a Buena Vista Irish coffee in the morning, and a Kells Irish coffee in the afternoon. The Kells Irish coffee was topped with creamier whipped cream, and made with tastier coffee, and smoother whiskey. This is where I'm going for Irish coffee from now on. The bar was nice and the bartender was friendly.
author: Eric E.

description: Had parked my car in front of this place on a Saturday evening and my car was completely damaged from a bunch of people sitting on it. The bouncer does nothing about respecting other people's property as they just stood there and watched. When I arrived home and looked at my car with more detail, paint was missing in a few spots.
author: M C.

description:
Ladies, ever have that unclean feeling.....like you just can't ride horses, play tennis, or run on the beach. Well come on in to Kells, largest selection on douches in SF. 

Yes in this corner we have Summer's Steve (making sure him and his brothers' collars are popped)......and over here we have Massen Gill (grabbing more ass than a proctologist, then pretending it wasn't him). 

Yes, the selection here at Kells is the best in the west. And you thought this was just a hang out for: 

1. People who just discovered alcohol. 
2. Every frat to ever exist. 
3. The congregating point of girls who think their hott but fall of the table and land in your lap and make you spill your drink... 
4. The most over priced cover in SF. 
5. The longest men's bathroom lines in the city.
author: Angelo F.

description: Came here for a birthday outing. Brought 20 people. They charged the birthday boy a $5 cover charge.
author: M K.

description: Having had a crappy day at a conference, I spied this place from my room at the Hilton. Like a vision from heaven, a shaft of sunlight cut thru the clouds and lit up the front of the building. Had many Guinness and several dozen of the best oysters yet to cross my gullet. And, turns out I know the owner. Not to be missed!
author: James B.

description:
I never thought I'd ever say this but.... there were too many penises here. 

Oh yes, men coming out of every corner giving you the horny head nod, the lustful grin and the migratory invasion dance.  

I means seriously...hot beef injections being implied with every step and suddenly, viewing the selection, I became a vegetarian.  

I did make out with someone the night I went, realized I wasn't really into it, then got my drunk ass a cab and went home.  Only to see a line of about ten more penises waiting to get in.  

Danger Will Robinson!!!  Avoid!! Avoid!!
author: Jay H.

description: I really enjoy this place, especially downstairs. From my experiences here, it seems that everyone comes to Kells for one reason, and that's to get wasted. Can get a pretty crowded, but a perfect place for strong drinks, music and dancing.
author: Bridget B.

description:
Came here on a Friday night at midnight and paid the $5 cover to get in.  What was I thinking?  Well, my friends wanted to come here so I just paid it.  Went inside and there were maybe 30 people in there and it was really slow.  Got drinks pretty quickly but they were priced the same as any other bar in the area but the pour is not that strong compared to other bars in the area.  The basement bar area was also not that crowded and had groups of people lingering around chatting it up.  About a half hour later, we decided to go back upstairs to see what was going on and to our surprise, it seems like everyone just showed up.  It was pretty crowded with people dancing in the tiny area by the stairs.

This bar is definitely the frat type bar that others have described it to be.  With that said, the people seemed pretty cool but I wasn't feeling the vibe that night.  I guess I might give it one more try, but since it's a restaurant that charges a $5 I would have to think twice before going back soon.
author: Paul C.

description:
I dated a girl who thought this was really a bar. She really, really thought that when you moved to The City, this was a bar and you'd pass by any and all others to crawl in the door of this sausage factory. Just look at the group pic, it's packed hairy ass to nut. There's like 600 people, six chicks and my conservative estimate of enough parfum de dude for 1800.  

I asked her what was so great about it and she said, for one thing, the variety of music. You could hear, say, Brown Eyed Girl, followed by Sweet Child Of Mine and maybe Black Eyed Peas. Oog. If I'm being honest though, I think it was all about getting hit on by gelled-up mini-bankers and your bog-standard Oirish (most of whom I'm convinced hail from Pleasanton but crammed Accent 101 by watching Trainspotting twice).

Remember when you had a sack lunch you were "brown-bagging it"? Can we resolve to not go here? And when those we know plan to, can this be called "douche-bagging it"? Drop this joint in the middle of Vacaville and then, only then, is it a bar you'd go to. Rohnert Park, mebbe, but not Cosmopolitan SF.

Anyhow, I'm single now. Big surprise.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
A good stand-by place for a night where you want a little dancing and a lot of drinking. 

But beware:  I don't know what it is about this place but every time I've gone to Kell's I end up losing something.  I thought it was just me (and in that case I would have been too embarassed at my drunken state to admit this on Yelp), but I've spoken with other people who seem to have lost things here too... cell phones misplaced, jewelry that we were stupid enough to take off while drunk, scarves and sweaters left on seats, friends disappearing (ie: hooking up with guys in a corner so you are left saying "Hey, where'd she go?  Crap, I lost my phone too...")
author: Mariko H.

description:
OH MY GOD I LOVE YOU KELLS, WHOEVER THE HELL YOU ARE.

I'm sure my enthusiasm for this place demonstrates my immaturity, notoriously bad taste in music and my alcoholic tendencies. Whatever I'm still in college and newly 21, how the hell am I not supposed to like Kellls? My friends and I came here on Saturday and had a blast.

There was no cover, which is great since that went to the drinking fund. Wasn't hard to get a drink, there's a bar upstairs and downstairs, and we got drinks with ease. The crowd was great, it seemed like a good mix of people. My friends and I felt a little younger than everyone else, but we're newly 21. I was drinking vodka cranberries all night, and they were decent. 

I think I have pretty good music taste, but sometimes I just want to dance to the top 40s, 90s music, and sing along while drunk. And Kells was absolutely perfect for that. 

Also there were plenty of men with accents. A total weakness of mine and my friends (and just about every other American girl don't lie). 

The music was an eclectic but still enjoyable mix. Sweet Caroline played, and going to college in Boston made me fall in love with this bar and its music choice. Yes Vanilla Ice did play, and yes Train's "Hey Soul Sista" played, and yes my friends and I danced and sang along to all of this. NO SHAME IN OUR GAME.

There was also a river-dance-esque Irish jig that happened. Last call resulted in my friends and I being included in singing an Irish drinking song and being included in a circle of men, no complaining here. Also the outside at last call gets rowdy. There was someone dancing in a truck bed, they're my new idol.
author: Pearl R.

description:
Kells is where desperate USF wenches with bad skin go to find balding Marina dudes in stripey shirts.  Think of an "Abbey away from Abbey" -- Tavern, that this.  Except with stickier floors and more obnoxious music (if you can believe that).  

And what the deal with this place calling itself Irish?  Can you even get a Magner's on ice here?  Not the last time I checked.  But a Bud Lite?  Bet your ass you can.

Avoid if you are good and decent.
author: Thomas M.

description:
Ladies, prepare to be violated. 

The reviews don't lie. If even dude-yelpers are commenting on the sheer amount of ass-gropage on the dance floor, you know it has to be significant.

But who am I to pass judgment on the drunken, sweaty, thrusting mosh pit that is Kell's?  After all, there are definitely some occasions when this bar is exactly what the doctor ordered. For example:

1)  You are a dude who has not gotten laid in months, definitely won't get laid tonight, and is therefore so horny that you can't control the urge to bump and grind against some unsuspecting (and possibly unconscious female) in the semi-darkness. Come to Kells! You'll fit right in!

2) You are a chick who has just gone through a traumatic breakup and you need to be reminded that someone--ANYONE-- of the male species finds you attractive

3) You are a chick that just gained 10 pounds, you find yourself absolutely repulsive, and you need to be reminded that someone-- ANYONE-- of the male species finds you attractive

4) You are so inebriated that ALL you want to do is break it down on the dance floor to decent music, but you are not yet at the passed out or puking point.  You feel invincible and are prepared to ignore all other factors, including but not limited to, groping on the dance floor, puddles of beer underfoot, and the pervasive stench of unwashed bodies emanating from the basement. 

Under scenario #4, I have actually had a pretty enjoyable time at Kells, although the morning after was less than super.  Just remember to be safe and bring your sober buddy . . . .
author: Chelsea R.

description:
Got alot on your mind? Relationship problems? Economy starting to get you down? 

If so, head over to Kell's and have a great time! 

I live in San Jose and love every chance that I get to head up to the city, get tipsy, dance recklessly, converse beligerently, at this gem of an Irish Pub. To me Kell's is a glorified dive bar that is always rockin and full of fun-loving folks. Grant it I've only been there 5-10 times in the last couple years, but each time was a blast and I've never had any run ins with your usual drunken A-hole. And if you could secure that on any given friday or saturday night(or any cocktail night) you can usually rest assured that you are going to have a good time. 

Good Job Kell's!
author: Andrew F.

description: Service was rather slow for a lunch hour period. I was surprised. However the food and price was amazing. I hope to return as Im looking forward to try more dishes in the menu only then I can review further. Bummer!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Okay, I really wanted to try and give this place a 3 star rating...but my night here (make that 30 min) just really really sucked...

First off, it's near Broadway, so good luck finding parking late at night...

You never know what kind of music is going to be played...my and my friends really did pray that the music was gonna change to hip-hop, but it stayed playing 80's and that ain't my thing, not at all...

They charged $5 at the door, and I honestly wnated my money back almost instantly...

The crowd really wasn't my kind of crowd...it was the late 20's - early 30's crowd, prolly been out of college for a few years and tryin their best to hold on to what is left of their post college fun life...no offense...

Yeah, it just wasn't a really great nite to be there
author: Mike V.

description:
You know you're in the wrong spot when everyone in the place knows the lyrics to the songs that are playing and you don't.  If you remember that car ride scene in the movie "White Chicks", then you know what I'm talking about.

This place is 3 stars BELOW the Bubble Lounge.

In case you're interested:  I refused to wear a collared shirt, shoes, etc Friday night, so I was tricked into coming here and then the Dragon Bar.  I was planning on staying home and watching my TiVo favorites.  This is what not being a party pooper gets me.
author: One Black Mans POV.. ..

description:
If you watched the movie Coyote Ugly and said to yourself "this is what I was meant to do, dance on bars", then Kells might be for you.  I don't think they actually let you dance right on the bar, but the spirit of bar dancing is alive and well.  Also, if you missed out on the whole frat party experience, or just have a hankering for it, Kells might be the right bar for you. 

However, if you are an adult with no overwhelming desire to relive college days or quit your job to dance on bars, this bar might not be for you.  It is regularly very crowded on the weekends.  The mainly younger crowd is more interested in dancing and drinking to excess than hanging out and talking to friends.  It is also a frequent stop for bachelorette parties, party buses, and the like.  If you don't believe me, just hit up Kells at about 11:30 on a Saturday night.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Oh my god, the stench!  Downstairs smells like vomit, wet dirty dog, & moldy towels.

Went here with a bachelorette party.  So we were actively LOOKING for this frat-party cheesiness.  You know, a place where we could dance on tables and toss our bras around.  Probably this was the perfect location for such antics.   Unfortunately, the stink chased us out in less than 10 minutes!
author: Ravena F.

description:
Kells is fun and all, but here's my issue.

I'm 22 and I'm usually one of the oldest people there.  WTF?  Clearly this place takes AWFUL fake IDs because these kids look 14.

Sorry boys, I don't make out with high schoolers.
author: Caitlin D.

description:
Meh this place is okay. Visited last friday for a friend's birthday party. Okay drinks but I just had a vodka cranberry so can't mess that up. My friends were drinking beer and ya can't mess that up either. Probably woudn't go for food. Everything that came to the table was fried,  and not that good but it was after work and we were hungry. 
They have a downstairs area which I assume is for dancing, and there's a bar. We got there super early so it wasn't set up yet. No one was down there. 
Didn't stay long enough for it to get crowded. The music was good upstairs. Bathrooms are also downstairs (minus one star if you're upstairs!)
author: Lauren W.

description:
I need to see what this place is like during the evening!!
Some friends and I had lunch on Saturday and after making my way downstairs to the bathroom I realized how amazing the building is! Service was okay (there was hardly anyone in the place at such an early time), but I bet everything changes after 5. Definitely want to return and try sitting in one of the booths downstairs!
author: Hilda Z.

description:
Who would have thunk that an Irish bar could be sooooo shitty on St. Patty's.  Let it be known though that my anger does not come from the crowd that was in attendance tonight, but by the ignorant and incompetent staff member that I had to deal with. 

Its funny how quickly your night can go from great to terrible.  At one moment, my friends and I were chatting with some great females and at the next moment, I am getting raped on my tab.  

Let me explain.  Before I left the bar, I went to sign my tab out at the front bar.  When my tab came, I noticed that it was much higher than I anticipated.  Now, normally I am not one to dispute with how much I am being charged and just pay the thing.  Tonight was different though.  

I had noticed that I was being charged for more than twice the amount of drinks that I had purchased.   When I tried to ask the bartender (ass) about the charges he ignored me.  Not once but twice.  He continued to poor drinks and act like I didnt even exist.  When I finally got his attention again and showed him the receipt, his exact words were "what do you want me to do about it".  I told him there was a mistake and that there was no way that I bought the amount of drinks on the tab. He then proceeded to call me a liar and walked away.         - Great Service !

The end result - I will be getting way overcharged than I should have been.  Whats funny though about the situation is, I dont give a shit about the money. What I care about is my character being attacked by some punk ass bartender that  wont take the time to understand that he is serving me, a customer.

Bottom line - dont show this place the light of day.  They have lost my business and my friends business forever. I will never recommend this place to anyone and I recommend you stay away as well.  

If you want an Irish bar, try Irish Bank or some other pub.  Dont waste time in a place that doesn't care about your time in their establishment.
author: Jon K.

description:
Ok if I said that Bix was the upscale version of Cheers, well this place was Cheers where everyone and I do mean EVERYONE knew everyone else's names.  Kell's is a great Irish bar that I had frequented in my collegiate days and actually hadn't been back since.  When I walked in everyone was shouting out their hellos to the party that I was with as if they always go there and all knew each other or have had a long history of coming and had planned on going there that night.

Coincidentally I really did see a small handful of people that went to my undergrad with me.  It was like a time warp and nothing had changed.  So try going there and see who you recognize.

One thing I liked about this place is although it's small, the floor near the back is just about right size for a little rump shaking when the bartender is playing just the right music - which he was that night.

This place is cute quaint and not quite a dive bar but close to it since I was just at the more upscale choices in the neighborhood.  So either plan your night out so your perspective isn't let down too early in the night.  Being that this place was at the end of my sloppy drinking night, it's perfect!  

Oh But beware, be very aware of the long steep stairwell to the bathrooms.  Jeez, don't they know we're drunk and can't stumble down stairs very well?
And another plus is there are many cabs that come through at the end of the night because it's in a great location.
author: Sharon T.

description:
Who goes to this place?
Oh wait, I know - TOOLS.
What kind of Irish bar barely has Irish beer? Kels.
What kind of Irish bar is full of Marina-ites? Kels.

I saw more people drinking Molsons and Bud than anything else, so sad.
author: Tom S.

description: I used to frequent this place for lunch. They have a great bangers and mash and a few other excellent Irish dishes. I could eat a whole loaf of that bread they serve too.
author: Scott M.

description:
Please excuse me while I rant...OK, don't excuse me...you should all read this before going to the Kells.

Since I just moved here from Boston a couple of months ago, where there is another Kells which I frequented, I figured that I'd check this place  out as well.  Went about a month ago with a couple of good-lookin' ladies and the downhill began at the front door.

No cover for ladies but $5 for guys?  Now THAT'S some bulls***.  ESPECIALLY for a place of this quality.  I'm not opposed to paying a cover if the place warrants it, but this place should pay ME to be there.    

HERE'S THE BIGGEST PROBLEM ABOUT THIS PLACE--I know half of the yelpers find the music here to be terrible and I second, third, fouth, and five-hundreth that.  This place is huge, has 2 dance floors, and is ALWAYS packed, yet they can't afford a DJ?  The bartenders switch the songs on their stupid cd player leaving awkward silent breaks in the music as well as absolutely no continuity.  The music is fast hip-hop, then slow classic rock, then fast classic rock, then slow hip-hop.  People pretend to have fun dancing but really they're thinking, "Who the F is playing this music?"  Plus, I'm an admitted top 40/mainstream hip-hop listener and not once did I go, "that's my jam!"  Trust me, that's hard to do.  

On top of it all, I'm a DJ myself so maybe I'm overly critical, but as a paying patron at a place like this, I expect a certain (if low) standard.  I don't know of any place with a dance floor that DOESN'T have a DJ and that relies on their bartenders, who could be spending that time selling more drinks, to play the music.  

1 star for eye candy and strong, not overpriced drinks.  -10,000 stars for everything else.

Kells Manager/Owner, if you're reading this, call me.  I'll DJ for free so your guests don't have to suffer anymore.
author: Vijay N.

description:
Kell's is the spot for girls night out.  Great location, the people are friendly and the music is all you could want.  The music always takes me back.  The drinks are strong and cheap, though sometimes it is difficult to get to the bar.  Always keep your drink securely in you hand and above the crowd; it is Crowded!! Girls can stand on the benches and dance, sometimes on the bar and pool tables, they really hate it though when guys get up there so please don't test it: they Will shut the music off until you get down boys!  Cover charge for guys= $5, girls are free, of course.  
There is an upstairs and downstairs and its fun to check out both scenes, the bars are different and there is a sort of lounge downstairs.  The music is different at both locations.  Kell's is the spot you go to at about 11Pm and stay all night.
author: Jess P.

description:
We came here for the last hour or so after getting drinks at Frisson and dropping by Bubble Lounge.  I don't think I enjoyed this place so much...the crowd, the music...it felt like a Frat party.  The Christmas tree and light decor was eye-catching, though.  

And when the night ended, a few drunk guys got into some fight outside.  But I guess that is expected at any bar, right?
author: Lisa C.

description:
There should be an option for negative stars...

This place is a nightmare, and I am not sure why people still go there... maybe Bridge and Tunnel Weekly has yet to rate this place poorly.

Let's just say my night actually got better when I left this place and got conned into joining into a scientology social...
author: Adam O.

description:
I was there on a Saturday night and this place is so crowded, hot, and stuffy that I needed to go outside often for fresh air. The upstairs and downstairs were just as crowded. It was hard to move around that my friends and I were in the same place pretty much the whole night. The layout was awkward and probably contributed to it.

The two bartenders told me two different prices for the exact same drink, which is not cool. To make matters worse, when I closing my tab at the end of the night, he WAY overcharged me and did the same thing to my friend. I'm assuming he does to a lot of people, thinking they are too drunk to notice or they buy rounds for other people. Although he was quick to give us a new bill with the correct amount, when my credit card bill charges, there were TWO charges on my card. I was majorly pissed off by that.

I probably will not go back.
author: Kimberly N.

description:
At night: Pleasanton High School Class of 2003 Reunion.

Happy Hour time: Nothing discounted, food makes the Irish Bank taste gourmet.

No thanks.
author: Suo L.

description:
Take 20 people who just drank 20 bottles of champagne at 10 AM and drop them in Kells after a long walk across North Beach and you will have a freakin blast.  We did.

The place was dead so we got great service at the bar.  The music was fun.    Every one of us was dancing like no one was watchin.  Seriously we had like a hundred beers and endless rounds of kamis.  This is what you are supposed to do at 2 PM on a Saturday right?

I really have no idea what this place might really be like, but I sure hang out with some fun people.  We could have been at the end of a dank alley with 40s and had just as much fun.
author: Ian M.

description:
This feels like all of the frat parties I used to go to in college and don't really miss. 

the basement is worse than the upstairs. The girls seem to get really really wasted here though, so if that's your thing head on over.
author: Jake R.

description: I don't know why others have ranked this place so low, but every time I have gone here I have had an amazing time! I love the fact that there is an upstairs and a downstairs with two different types of music so you can switch between them the whole night, and it brings in a pretty diverse group of people which for me is always a bonus. The people here are young and fun and trendy and like to have a good time--so go here if you fit that description!!
author: Sarah G.

description:
I've had my share of drunken debauchery-filled nights here. 

Two levels, downstairs is only slightly more chill with its own bar, "dancefloor",  space allotted for restrooms, whereas upstairs is a shitshow with everyone walking in and going for the bar like wildcats.  

The Irish in me loves a good Irish bar, and Kells is pretty good :)
author: Christy M.

description:
Looking back about 10 years, I can say that I had MORE good nights than bad going to Kell's.
