I'm sure a lot has changed since then, but I appreciated the long bar from which we did car bombs, the makeshift upstairs dance floor that seemed to play the same CD consisting of U2, Neil Diamond and B-52s, the downstairs DJ who played the hot hip-hop tunes of the day, and the sticky dancefloor and the general debauchery that always seem to ensue when we used to go here back in the day.

I don't miss having to push through crowds to get anywhere and the hordes of young foreign students staying up the street at the Green Tortoise Hostel. But that was all part of Kell's charm...
author: John Eric S.

description:
The Humpty Dance is your chance to do the hump

The one song blaring on the system basically summed up the whole night I.E:

Black people, do the Humpty Hump, do the Humpty Hump
White people, do the Humpty Hump, do the Humpty Hump
Puerto Ricans, do the Humpty Hump, just keep on doin' the hump
Samoans, do the Humpty Hump, do the Humpty Hump
Let's get stoopid!

Except there were no black, Puerto Rican, Samoans or Asian people (save myself) But there were a shitload of Irishmen and Aussies. But it reminded me so much of O'Reilly's  in Frankfurt that I kind of fell in love with it. 
You don't go there for the music. You don't go there for top shelf libations. You don't go there for stimulating conversation.
You go to get shitty McDitty
Straight up Ass Over Teakettle alll night.
And on night's like last night, that's all I wanted. 
Free drinks (if you work what yo mamma gave ya), cheap drinks (about $5) if you don't,  and accents galore.

Ladies get in for free because "Yo ladies, oh how I like to hump thee."
author: Mary F.

description:
Decent music, not terrible service at the bar. Great basement to get your dance moves on. Makes a great closing bar for a night of dancing with your girlfriends. 
Cheers!
author: erin D.

description:
STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!!!
Last night the bartender refused to give my friend a cup of water and then kicked him out of the place. The bartender came outside and punched him without any reason. We had to call the COPs. They have the worse service ever.
author: james l.

description: Got stuck here on a Saturday night. It was like an elephant graveyard for douche bags. Will only go back if forced at gunpoint. Even then, I'd try to karate chop my attacker's gun hand and turn the tables on him. It'd be risky, but that's how bad this bar is.
author: Aaron Z.

description:
This bar is frequently mobbed with advertising students...I should know, cuz I'm one of them.

It's a good looking bar, but a) the service is Bad, & b) people get thrown out of here on a regular basis.

"Maybe they deserved it," you might say.  And actually, I would agree with you.  But it smells a little militant in here, a little ex-fratty, a little tow-the-liney.

Proceed with caution.
author: Holly F.

description:
Cheap thrills and classic drunks make a night in the city a clown, clown night indeed.

This place was the first bar we walked into before we hit up this club/restaurant off Broadway called IMPALA.

We got our drink on in here first before proceeding to IMPALA.

we got out the car and walked up to this joint. As my friend and i were finishing our cigarettes before we joined our other homies these 4 chicks who looked like they bought their clothes from baby gap walked out and i had to listen to my already drunk boy try to hollar at them and then when shot down or dissed by them, he began to talk shit to them. It was sad, yet amusing to me.

So, after my friends horrific and sad drunk attempt to hollar at some bitches, we walk inside this Irish bar. The place was small and narrow and wasn't really impressive at all.

we seen 3 toasted ass white females, who ironically looked as if they too could be from the O.C. lol 

One of them who was really wasted, had a cute face and big hooters and was hugging and kissing both me and my friend and was pinching my cheek asking how old i was because she though i was like 21. But this chick was really drunk but amazingly could function.

We drank some more, bullshitted with each other and these females (or at least that drunk one) , watched some TV on KELLS 3 non-HDTV flat screens that they had posted up on the wall (Hella Lame).

Overall, I'd say this bar, being hella random that we walked in there and ordered a drink, was not too shabby. Choppin' it up and dancing it up with a drunk super cute white O.C. chick wasn't that bad either.  

But  the girls thinking that it was my friends 21st birthday that night and singing happy birthday to him when he's actually 26 and it's not his birthday.........fucking priceless.......better yet...fucking hilarious .

rating 2 out of 5....small joint....lacked people, good music, not a great experience but one to talk about for laughs.
author: Bob E.

description:
"JUST A SMALL TOWN GIRL, LIVING IN A LONELY WORLD, TOOK THE MIDNIGHT TRAIN GOING ANYWHERE...DON'T STOP BELIEVING, HOLD ON TO THAT FEELING!!!!!!!!!"  

I will forever associate Kells with standing in the middle of a crowded dancefloor, WASTED, scream singing Journey's "Don't Stop Believing" with the rest of the drunken twenty somethings that frequent this place.  

The first time I went to Kells, I was overtaken by the sheer volume of drunken people and smell of clorox.  I was DD.

As a rule, I now never go to Kells without the intention of getting wasted.  Take a cab.  You wont regret it.

Drinks are cheap.  Crowd is fun and always good looking considering the beer goggle situation.  Usually a good night (followed by a bad morning).  Just don't wear anything you mind having beer spilled on.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Friday and Saturday nights: 9pm-2am  (two stars)

"I juz wanna dance!  Tats all I really wanna do!  Its Friday, and I wanna dance....whoooooo-hooo!....OMG, why hasn't he texted me back???!!"  


If you like screaming that on your Friday nights then you will love this place.  During the weekend it festers with striped-shirtees, an ingenious breed, who grind against Marina girls.  It is potentially fun for an individual if they embrace their Yeager Mister consumption threshold and who are with a small group of people.  Otherwise you will find yourself slithering through a tight crowd while you look for a familiar face.  The downstairs plays better music but downstairs looks and smells like Chlamydia.   

Nights: prior to 9pm  (four stars)

This place is a great place to grab a beer after work or during the day.   It's in a great location where you can pub crawl and hang out with a substantial enough group of people to have fun.  If you weren't impressed with this place as a "club", come here closer to the sunnier hours of the day and you will see it's actually a pub.
author: Bill B.

description:
Happy Birthday to me! My manager took me and a co-worker out to lunch to celebrate. What did I want for lunch? Shepherd's pie!

So we came to Kells, the closest Irish bar to work and from recommendations from other co-workers. They also have beer, beer, beer. 

I had the creamed carrot soup that was very salty but tasty. Unfortunately, the shepherd's pie was dry, dry, dry. At least it didn't feel fattening--the meat didn't have any fat left due to dryness. The mash part was okay but not great. 

At least I have dinner to look forward to!
author: Kat H.

description: I came here Friday night after happy hour/dinner and went straight downstairs to meet up with some coworkers. It smelled like a combination of ass, feet, mucus, and urine in a small crowded room that felt like a sauna. It was so bad that I had to go to the ladies room and HURLED because it was so disgusting down there (bye bye $40 worth of shabu shabu). I'd been here before on one other occasion for a happy hour celebration upstairs and didn't expect it to be so filthy downstairs. On my way out, I heard a drunk breezie ask my coworker if he had any coke? Uh, no.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
to be fair, it's more a 2.5 - and this review is for the bar, not the restaurant. 

kells tries to be a dive bar, but it's a marina kind of crowd..

2 levels of dancing doesn't make up for douchebags. sorrries!
author: Jessica S.

description:
I visited Kells for the first time after the Yelp event at Scott Howard, at 9pm on a Monday night, it was pretty quiet inside Kells.  Which is pretty much how I like to roll, not screaming in each others ears or trying to develop some kind of spontaneous lip-reading ability.

No, I like to drink my drinks and have a conversation, not a tall order for any bar 9pm on a Monday night I guess.  Well this night I happened to be pretty drunk already so we were already in good shape.  

Some details I did remember:  Bathrooms are downstairs, they have a whole downstairs area with a whole 2nd bar which is pretty cool.  They've also got booths of some kind you can use to lounge on.  I think this place closes at 11, cuz that's what time my receipt is stamped.

I'd definitely go back, especially if it's nice and chill like that night.
author: Eric L.

description:
We first heard about Kells as it was featured on the Food Network. We took the trolley to Chinatown and walked down Jackson Street to Kells. We got there about 5pm on a Friday night, was not too crowded,
but the waiter told us it would get real busy later that evening. We had dinner there, I had the shepherd's pie (made with a hint of Guinness) and my husband had the roast pork with mashed potatoes and cabbage. The food was incredible!! Very reasonably priced, great atmosphere, excellent service. This place is frequented by the locals, not a touristy place. A nice, relaxing place away from the hub-bub.
author: Linda B.

description: Was here on a Saturday around four. Was quiet. Service was good. Sausage roll was ok, bangers and mash was just ok, hamburger was just ok, shepherds pie was just ok. It's a little disappointing that the food is not as good as the Kells in Portland.
author: Jeff P.

description:
I wandered the financial district in a whiskey haze. Two coworkers by my side, we needed someplace to go before *ahem* hittin the Bubble Lounge. I had a craving for potatoes....and more whiskey, as most Irish girls do when the sun goes down.

The Kells doorstep met my feet and we sauntered inside. It was pretty quiet, low key and the waitress fairly open to musings and questionings on true love vs. infatuation. The drinks were good, the taters satisfying and I'm sure we'll go back again if I ever find my way around the neighborhood again.

I've never been there late night, and I can see the meathead factor starting up later, but I probably wouldn't stick around long enough unless my Irish eyes were crossin' ....
author: Jessica P.

description:
Ugh.....I've ended up here way too many times against my will.  I blame my drunken single girlfriends for that.

Admittedly, I had fun here the first couple of times I went.  I got trashed, danced on the bar, and drank free shots.  This is pretty much the scene there......add in some cheesy, old top 40 tracks blasting and that's pretty much an average night at Kells.

The crowd is really young here.  21-25 max.  No good for me anymore.  I'm married now and no longer prey on young boys to make out with in a drunken horny stooper.
author: lea m.

description:
(!) Achtung (!): Biased Review; I work right above Kell's.

#1) The owner(s) of Kell's & the people who work there are all sweet, friendly, and caring people.

#2) Their lunch-menu is restricted, but the BBQ chicken sandwich is pretty darn good...

#3) They have great drinks, great beer, and an awesome ambiance.

#4) I have never been there on a weekend night, but have seen the lines tailing way outside the door -- it looks like an awesome/ fun/ happening spot for a fri-sat night bar-stop...

"You wanna be where everybody knows your naaaame ~ !"
author: Anjali V.

description:
It is what it is.

For what it's worth, it seems to be one of the only bars in the city that actually has enough bartenders on staff for a Saturday night.  I think there were 6 or 7 between the two bars.

I didn't make it far enough to the dance floor, but overall the place wasn't too packed.
Anyway, what do people want, an empty dance floor??

Oh well, wouldn't go back myself, but with the right group (like a rugby team) it is a good time.
author: laura g.

description:
F*ing love Kells (only the bar scene, never ate there). BUT you have to be in the correct mood to go there. Yes, the guys are sleazy but they buy you free drinks (yay!), and there are many hot foreigners there who accents rock (remember you're in tourist spot North Beach) .
Another plus--dancing on the tables, (well benches, whatevs).  Often when the dance gets to crowded or one wants to be center of attention, flip up those bench seat covers and start dancing on it! (the row on the upper floor by the windows are the best but they may be falling apart by now...) 
Okay minus--soooooooooooo many underage girls. Especially on thursday nights (college night i like to think, so many USFers) And must get there late, earliest would be 11pm (even then it can be kinda dead).

Overall, good place to go in the middle of going out --drunk enough to not care who's hitting on you and still want to dance!
author: Kristine F.

description:
Every college has that cool Irish pub that plays the same top forty hits on repeat and sells cheap pints to underage girls.  The place where everyone goes because everyone else is already there.  

Apparently San Francisco has one too, and its called Kell's.  Which is not really a bad thing.  I crave that place sometimes, though not as much anymore, considering I graduated.
author: Korey A.

description:
I planned on writing a review for this place, hoping to impart my wisdom and experience, but after reading the first 4-5 review, realized everyone seems to have the same experience at this place.  Crowded (both upstairs and downstairs), packed with extremely aggressive guys, who when you're drunk enough you can ignore, but then when you get drunk a few weekends later and against your better judgement decide to go back to Kell's and run into the same guys, you sober up pretty quickly for fear that you've become *gasp* a "regular."  

So, why the 3 stars?  Pretty easy to get a drink, no matter how crowded, and it's free for girls!
author: Chris L.

description:
I love Kell's! Why? I'm 21, and have never been inside without being completely drunk off my ass. I've been kicked out multiple times, but always let back in the next night. Sausage fest is on Friday nights. Chicks come out on Thursday, but mostly Saturday I've noticed.

Are you in college? Love getting drunk with other stupid college kids? Love watching Irish people fight eachother? Then go to Kells. If not, you probably won't like it one bit, like everyone else seems to say on here.
author: Patrik J.

description: I arrived here surprisingly early before a Meetup. That was the fastest bus downtown I'd ever taken. I didn't want to linger outside - too near the Happyology Institute. I ordered bangers and mash, and had a Coke. Service was swift and friendly.  Bangers were delicious. Will come back again.
author: Marcus M.

description:
Great for happy hour, my husband and I come here for beers on the way home from work.  It's chill, TVs are in great spots for catching the game, and I love their soda bread.   

Weekend nights are another story.  Definitely would be my thing if I was still 23, it's a fun place with a great dance playlist.  Alas I'm old now. 

We had our pre-wedding party here on Halloween night as my husband used to be a regular of Kells in Seattle, we were forewarned that it would great crazy.  It was fine until about 10pm when everyone crashed our party in the back-upstairs area and ate our food, but I guess we had it coming.   Our single guy friends had a blast, however.
author: Jessica W.

description:
I love lunch. My company gives me an hour for lunch, and you better believe I take every minute of it when I can. Kells is just down the block from me and while I've never been to the bar after work, I can say that their menu is worth a good lunch hour.

If their chicken vegetable soup was on the menu every day, I'd never eat anything else. It could be 100 degrees outside and I'd still eat their soup. I've also had their Shepherd's Pie and unfortunately, I can't rave about it the way I can for their soup. The meat was dry on the bottom, like it had been cooked too long beforehand and then was plopped in the serving dish, only to parch more beneath the mashed potatoes and cheese as the whole mess baked in the oven. I pretty much just ate around the meat. 

The space itself is so incredible it makes me jealous of the lucky bastard who owns it. Making your way around this bar is like winding through an old speakeasy. There is a whole basement bar I didn't even know was there until I went looking for the bathrooms. The restrooms, in case you're wondering, are nothing to write on the wall about, but at least there's more than one stall. 

I get the feeling that the later crowd around here is probably a little douchey, but the space itself is so fabulous and comforting (the way a good dark bar should be!), I would say it's a great spot to rent out for private parties and there's plenty of room to bring your friends and try to avoid everyone else around you. 

And with that, I give it 4 stars. Minus one for overcooked Shepherd's Pie, but hot damn, that's good chicken vegetable soup!
author: Kat E.

description:
This place is a thinly veiled front for the fraternity mob.  Don't tell them that I told you though.  They might give me new pair of  "keg shoes" or the dreaded "sigma phi" neck tie, and then that'll be then end of 'ol jamesy.  

One extra star for girls so wasted they dance on tables to Neil Diamond and think I'm attractive.  Cheers!
author: James M.

description:
I wandered into Kells one night, and I thought I was back in college again. This place is ridic, I saw one other Yelper refer to this place as full as Tools, and they are right. 

However, this place can be fun if you feel like getting drunk and allowing yourself to get hit one by random men in sweater vests. 

BTW- The Downstairs Bartender is quite attractive, but pours weak drinks. Don't let him fool you!

Guys beware- They charge a $5 cover for the privilege :)
author: Lauren W.

description:
Back in the day, when i had a fake ID i loved this place, cool music, tons of guys, wall to wall dancing

Now that i can use my own real ID here it's way different.  I always have to use my soccer arms to get around or my team(myself) will get defeated and stomped into the ground.  It's cool if you're squished between a bunch of hot dudes, not so hot when you're squished between 5 ugly, sweaty, drunk guys who all think they're justin timberlake because you swear they think they're bringing sexy back.  

If you are one of those guys, please stop trying to bring sexy back, it just won't happen for you, try to bring personal hygiene back instead.
author: Chrammy D.

description: What you'd expect from an irish pub.  On the edge of neighborhoods in SF and because it's SF, parking is scarce as I expected.  Didn't eat, but had a couple of pints.  Classic look and decent service.  I'd return.  It's clean, has a huge downstairs bar that surprised me but it was dead when I went (on a tues. about 5:30pm)
author: Jack L.

description:
There are two possible reasons to go to Kells Bar - either you're new to the city and don't know any better, or you're looking to lay someone from the Marina who's "slumming". Now I've obviously been there in order to review this place, but I'll leave it to you to determine what my particular reasons were :-)

Kells is crowded, hot, expensive, and not exactly teeming with brain surgeons or rocket scientists. Want an uptown girl looking for downtown man? This is the place for you. Want to meet someone who you don't need to be drunk to appreciate? Try elsewhere.
author: Kevin R.

description:
Totally cheesy, feet stick to the floor, drinking from plastic cups kind of place, but for some reason, every time I come here I have a fantastic time. Maybe it's just the company or the way everyone packs in and dances to music played by the bartender, but Kell's is definitely one of my favorite places to go on a Saturday night.

Just don't expect it to be anything more than it is...a dive-ish Irish bar filled with way-too-drunk people who are totally going to spill their fruity kids drinks all over the place. Just join in and enjoy singing along to your favorite songs from pretty much every decade. I promise you'll know the words to just about every one that comes on.
author: Michelle D.

description:
This place reminds me of college parties I would go to over a decade ago, not that that's a bad thing.

I definitely like when they play hip hop, but find it annoying when its hip hop, then guns n roses, then hip hop, then bon jovi.  If it was more consistent that would be good.  I think this problem only applies to Friday and Saturday nights.

Here are some of the things I like about Kells:
- Love Irish Bars, mmm Guinness.
- Fantastic little space.  Some nooks and crannies in the basement and very classic bar setting upstairs.  Definitely an interesting place from a ambiance point of view.
- Decent bar service.  Decent (as much as can be expected) facilities.

Here's what sometimes bums me out:
- crazy music mix.
- crowd can be immature and slightly B&T
- the guy working the door wasn't too considerate.  the girl I was with left her coat in the bar and I forgot to get stamped as we were leaving.  So when we went back in, he gave me a ton of crap.  If he was more intelligent, he should have let me go with my friend to look for her coat. If I don't come out in 10 minutes, have someone kick me out, but that wouldn't have been a problem, since we just would have been hunting down a missing jacket. Kind of a jackass move on his part.

Overall, its a decent bar and an OK choice to have in your repertoire.
author: M S.

description:
I've been here twice, both times with my gf. Once late during a weeknight, this time we came for happy hour.

Typical Irish bar with all the cultural accoutrements, lots of wood everywhere. Plenty of liquor and a halfway decent beer selection. The food looked like typical pub food and they even had pastys.

Guess when you don't really know where to go out you'd probably think this place is cool for late night drinking (like some other peeps on yelp). I've heard there's been a lot of robberies, muggings, and car jacking's in this area on the weekends late at night.

Meh, it's just ok. I'll let the wannabe's hang out here.
author: Gary T.

description:
If you are a single girl who enjoys being hit on constantly and deafened by random musical selections of the last 30 years at ear-shattering decibel levels, this place is HELLA TOTALLY WICKED AWESOME!

I am not that girl.
author: Aron L.

description: Oh Kells, there's never a dull moment. Both of the bouncers are awesome. Sure, they're not gentlemen, but isn't that why they're at the door and not at the bar? Ladies, they keep the creeps out. And guys, get over it. Don't be a jerk and they won't treat you like one. Once you're in, there's no way to deny the energy of the bar. If it's packed upstairs, scurry on downstairs where the music is always loud and the bartender is hot. Whether its Journey or GaGa or a bizarre Irish jig, the crowd is always having a good time. Sure it's hot, and of course you get sweaty, and it's well advised to bring your own toilet paper... but it's a bar. A fantastic bar. My favorite bar.
author: Stacy G.

description: Perhaps the worst bar in San Francisco, if not the world. This place is filled to the brim with an international array of former panhellenic council members. The people were rude, plastic, and just awful. Never go. Ever.
author: Andrew K.

description: Hi Bridge, my name is Tunnel. May I spill a drink on you since I am so packed in here I cannot move? Maybe I can take you for a spin on the dance floor to the oh-so-esteemed hit "Jump jump" by those hip kids daddy mac and mac daddy? Maybe introduce you to all my tunnel-y male friends? I'm so glad we're both 21 and can join in the frat party.
author: Nikki M.

description: "happy hour" food monday to friday....$3 for anything with a clover next to it.....5pm to 8pm.....beers are always $4....baked sausage wrap is pretty grubbin' snack while downing a beer....chicken strip is fried up in intalian style bread crumbs...decent bar food....deep fried calamari is mostly batter....it's an alright place to come solo or small group after work...have a beer with couple $3 snacks....watch an evening game....and call it a night....it's a friendly place...large old school style 2-level building bar/club....but with a local home feel to it for the weeknight office warriors....
author: Hen A.

description:
Once upon a time in a time before now, I was walking to Kells to meet up with coworkers for a night out.

I found parking in Chinatown at around 7 and as I was making sure it was the intended rendevous spot, a boy comes up to me and says... "Have you tried it?" I said no - explained that I was meeting friends, and invited him to join, as he was visiting from Europe.  We all had a good time - and it was early and we tookover an area, got good bar service and had a fun and crazy before running around North Beach for snacks. 

Serendipitous meetings are always memorable and Kells led to a very good Autumn that year.
author: Cheryl D.

description:
It was a crowded place, though I'm not surprised as there's no cover.  We went downstairs where there was a bit more space and kept to ourselves in front of the bar.  The music was fun, though this is definitely not a dancing type of crowd.  

Not sure how much the drinks are as I was lucky enough not to have to pay this particular evening.

lots of drunk people around..though I'm not too surprised...it's an irish bar
author: Naoko M.

description:
$20 for admission on St. Patty's Day? For this place that never has a cover??? Psh - yeah right. NEXT!

I'll have to admit, I've had fun here in the past...although that is largely due to partying with my girls and dancing to some fun tunes. But this place has a bunch of downsides: it's always been packed beyond belief on weekends, there is absolutely no ventilation downstairs, and trying to get to the bar and order a drink upstairs results in many hands conveniently brushing across my lower waist and butt. Uhhh...no thanks.
author: Dalia K.

description: Great Irish bar. You have the really feel of a normal Irish bar on street level. Meaning it is a tight fit around the bar. Then you go downstairs and you get a larger bar and room to walk around. What was great is you have two different styles of music playing on the two floors. So you can decide what kind of mood you are in. I did feel like it was a younger crowd.
author: Justin C.

description: This place is super fun! Especially fun for a girls night! There happened to be a particularly good crowd, so it made it even better. One good song to dance to after another, definitely coming back here more often! Next time however, I will try and avoid "that" creepy guy who decides to hand me his fake business card that says "You're Sooo Hot", and on the back his personal stamp that says his name and " You're hot, call me". Um eww? Guys these days!
author: Sonya D.

description:
I've been here twice and tried to go a third time, but they were remodeling.  Both times were for lunch.

Nice little tables in the sunlight in the front of the bar, and interesting little tables in the dark in the back of the bar. 

Good, meaty sandwiches on the menu -- all were quite good (according to those in my party).  There's always something Irish on the menu.

The dessert is made special for that day, and is always scrumptious.  Be sure to ask.

We actually considered making this the site of a retirement party, but figured it couldn't hold more than 20 people comfortably.

The only negative I would give the place is that the restroom is down a narrow flight of steps into a dank room.  If you've had a few too many (like, one), good luck coming back upstairs with your neck intact.
author: Linda B.

description: This place is horrible. I have given this place a handful of tries and it sucks worse and worse everytime.  The food is defrosted crap, and that's the best thing about this place!The upstairs bartenders are inconsistent, rude, and incompetent, and the downstairs bartenders...clueless. That's if you want to risk you life going down narrow stairs, to a dark stinky dungeon with no fire escape, windows, safety!  Tried to complain to  the owner about being charged double for my bill, but he was too busy picking up some young girl to be bothered. Oh, ladies get in free by the way.  This place really sucks and most San Franciscans know it. Only poor unsuspecting tourists populate this place.  Stay away!!!!
author: James B.

description:
St. Patrick's Day

Went with 15 friends.
Stood in line for 20 minutes.
Paid $20 cover and got the last Kell's St. P's t-shirt.
Ordered drink
Mixed crowd.
Main floor hard to do anything.
Downstairs space, but not too many bodies.
Place was boring like this review.

Recommend - Maybe with a large group.
author: Po L.

description:
Our preparty location before going to a party, my buddies up in The City chose this place.  As I walk in, I notice something odd.  It's empty.  They claim, it must of been an off night.  I don't think so buddies, can't take your sides on this one.

However, the place is huge, an upstairs and downstairs bar, and a huge selection of alcohol at the bar.  That's about it.
author: David K.

description:
Great spot when it's not busy, but be sure to leave before 9:30-10 pm because pretty much on the nose, hoards of nasty "Brad & Jenn" types come pouring in, and the place turns into one of the worst places I've ever been to.  The people are rude with no manners (or parenting), there's plenty of underage drinking, men grope women's crotches, and I've witnessed people having sex anywhere from the dance floor to the bathrooms... and this place isn't the cleanest... I'm just saying.

As far as the "European" men.... well they pretty much go there to pick up skanks.  Sorry, but it's true.  They know that these girls will do pretty much anything for an accent, so they go there to get laid.  Being a European myself, I have had some of these same men laugh and brag to me about it as if I should be impressed.

Also beware of the older "gentlemen" who go there.  They are just as bad with the groping and grinding.  Most of these older men are just looking for a cheap prostitute or underage girl for the evening.

This used to be a really nice spot and I don't know why or how it went so downhill.  Having said that, if you're looking for a decent spot to have lunch or some drinks for happy hour, it's pretty decent and fun.  But if you're looking for a place to have some fun for the evening, you could do A LOT better... and cleaner!  Nasty-nasty-nasty!
author: N J.

description: This place was packed for my friend's going away happy hour last hurrah gathering.  It didn't seem too bad for a happy hour place. I've heard it's different though when it's after happy hour. I like the fact that there's a nice downstairs bar as well. It seemed much more low-key down there but I'm not a huge bar hopper/pub crawler anyway. The prices seemed decent. I'm not sure if I'll go here again.  It's a good seven or eight blocks from the Montgomery BART station.
author: Amy J.

description:
Half obnoxious, half hot and fun!  Somewhere in the middle - is this place. 

 I'll never forget the night one of my girlfriend's met this guy after he spilled a drink on her, and now they're MARRIED!! Ha!
author: Yelper A.

description:
I had a 3-star time, but Kells gets an extra star for inspiring a sweet name for my friend's boat- Pelvic Thrust.

Seriously, I was pelvic thrusted about 18 times at Kells. That is even more than my nightly average from back in the day on Avenida Revolucion in Tijauna! In fact, Kells is a lot like Tijauna, which in my opinion can be a good thing. 

The extremely good looking bartender in the basement was kind of a jerk though- it must be hard going through life being so hot. I feel sorry for him.

The crowd wasn't as young as I expected, nor as bridge and tunnel. So I am confused about why everyone hates on this place so much- it's just a bar. With lots of pelvic thrusting.
author: Katie H.

description:
So. Yeah. 

Not typically my scene, so I may be biased.

Music was spasmadic..they played a techno version of a hillbilly song, generic techno, old hip hop, and other generally crappy music. It was only at the end that I liked the music (when they played classic rock). 

Have to say that this place is good if you're looking for a quick pick up or groping, but not really for much else. In fact, I think that's why most people go there. 

Floors and furniture are grody and kinda gross. 

Overall, meh.
author: Whitney I.

description:
This place sucks...

I have been to Kells twice and both times I had to wait in this long ass line to get in. When I first got in line I was clean shaven and looking dapper. But when it finally came time to go in and pay, I had a full grown beard, my shirt was wrinkled and I had pissed in the side alley twice already and lost my buzz. The place is way to packed and  it feels like Africa inside with it's safari humidity. I wonder if the Fire Marshall knows about this place. 

So over all avoid this place. If you are in the neighborhood go to Clown Alley and get a burger instead. It will me a more enjoyable experience.
author: Eric B.

description: We got there about 8pm or so? It was nice relaxing and spacious. I really did have a good time, until it became so crowded I couldnt move or breath... maybe they should have AC? The crowds were really overwhelming. We were all smashed in, but I danced anyway ;D
author: Star Z.

description:
I only give this place one star because I have to.  I really WANT to like this place, I do.  I love Irish bars.   I love North Beach.  I even love the Kells in Portland, Oregon.  But this place is to be avoided.  Not only are the drinks weak and they pour Guiness wrong (if you drink it, you know what I'm talking about)  ...AT AN IRISH BAR???  REALLY???  But here are the real pissers:  I can't fault the bar for this but my jacket was STOLEN.  AND fellas beware:  They charged all the guys $10 at the door and there was no live music or anything to justify it at all.
My night would have been a LOT better had I taken our group up the street to Vesuvio or just about anywhere.  If you want a good Irish bar in the area, go to O'REILLYS on Green Street/Beach Blanket Babylon.  Trust me, I wouldn't be writing this review if I did not truly believe that the SF KELLS SUCKS.
author: Luke D.

description: It has been ages since I have been to Kell's but it used to be one of my go to spots in San Francisco.  I've had some great nights here along with some nights that I wish I could forget.  I went here last week with a group of co-workers for our Christmas party and it had a great vibe inside and there were quite a few people.  I must say that I don't really remember coming here right after work as it was more of a late night destination where it is super hot inside and lots of drunk people gather but it was good for an after work drink.
author: Blake B.

description:
For some strange reason, Kells swarms with the B&T crowd on the weekends.  It gets insanely crowded and while it CAN be fun, it's not fun enough to justify enduring the bumping, shoving, spilled drinks, crappy pop music and knuckleheads wearing Terrell Owens jerseys (okay, the last time I went there at night was over 3 years ago). 

Kells IS a decent happy hour place during the week, when it is relatively quiet and you can manage to have a conversation over a beer and some good pub grub.  Otherwise, I'd stay away.
author: Andrew E.

description:
I've only been in here twice, but for some reason most of the guys in here (both times) are sort of unfortunate looking. Is that mean? Probably. but its not just me noticing the superficial either, my friends also took note...

otherwise, an ok place with a fine selection of beer.
author: tulipa L.

description:
I hate to admit it, but I sort of love this bar. My friends and I will send texts back and forth before a night of going out saying "Looks like it's gonna be a Kell's night...I've already had about 4 vodkas." 

Be warned: a lot of guys at this bar still don the popped collar. Either they haven't gotten the memo, or they're visiting from Jersey Shore. Go with a group of girls and just have fun
author: Krystha B.

description: Did you know that the original Kell's is actually in Seattle? The one here is much nicer, but their Old Fashioned's come very pink and in a martini glass. Awkward.
author: NickJess S.

description:
A coworker & I decided to go to lunch - agreeing to try somewhere new.  Because he is a kindred spirit, he made the declaration, "I don't wanna walk uphill."  So, we started our trek to North Beach & stumbled upon this amazing little place.  

The waitress was great...very friendly & efficient.  I had me a seafood Pasty & it was served with brown gravy on the side.  BROWN GRAVY.  It totally didn't "go" but it was Dee-Lish-US.  

I want to make it my bizness to eat there once a week.
author: Charlene E.

description:
Okay, my girl friend and I just finished getting plastered at our local wine bar and decided we needed to DANCE!!!!!

My first thought was 111 Minna, it was fashion show night (soooo fucking gay!!), so that was out of the picture (thank you blackberry!!).  We cabbed it to 15 Romolo (empty) so we walked to Kells. 

Alright, totally packed.  Pretty good music, but totally packed.  We somehow managed to get to the bar after a 15 minute wait (good thing we were already hammered!!).  

My first thought....packed full of 21 year old meat heads!!  My second thought, hey there are actually quite a number of people my age here!!! Sweet!  

We had a good time dancing and messing around... and I met a fellow mtn. biker so I was stoked!  Who doesn't like to talk about bike trails when you are drunk????
author: Inga B.

description:
I love Irish Pubs.  Of course I am biased.  However, this is not my exact idea of an Irish Pub.  But it is close. 

The best part of this place is the atmosphere.  The main floor where the main bar is is always packed and the downstairs - when packed - is a steam room! 

Everytime I have been here I have had to wait in a line.  But never had to pay a cover, so it is worth it! [Guys usually have to pay cover]

A good place to fall back on.  And that's not a bad thing! You know you will have a crowd here and it is stable "go-to" place!
author: Kira O.

description:
My friends and I made a visit awhile back to check out the night scene at this locale. They did not have cover charges up to 10pm (for both guys and gals) and they had your standard pub drinks. 

The "dance floor," as they have it, is located all the way in the back of the pub; nothing too fancy. This place is usually pretty dead until after 10pm, so if you go early, you won't find any excitement or real opportunity to chat with any other singles, if that is your forte. 

There are both locals and many of the traveler types, especially from the homeland of Ireland. When we were there, we met a bunch of guys in their early 20s, straight from Ireland. They were a neat bunch. The locals seem to enjoy the drinks, but that's all they seem to pay attention to. 

The music they play is pretty much your typical bar music, but some good tunes for dancing, too. 

If you're in the North Beach area, check this out. It's just a few blocks down on Columbus Ave. and is a pretty neat place to just kick it.
author: Melinda L.

description:
Why anyone would go here is a mystery to me. Probably the nastiest bar I've ever been to. Gets way too packed and hot. Near impossible to get a drink upstairs. Zero ethnic diversity. They sometimes charge a cover, which is pretty absurd. Good luck catching a cab after it closes.

Thing is, I'm a 24 year old former frat boy and I love going to clubs, so I guess I'm supposed to love this place. Too bad I think it sucks so badly.
author: Bruce D.

description:
This place defines MEAT MARKET. 
Full of douche-bags and girls that love to get themselves fondled by douche-bags. 

It's a sad excuse for anything Irish. 

If you enjoy being crammed up against some guy with too much cologne on, and a girl with her ass hanging out of her miniskirt.. then have at it.

**update**
the only bar in the city where i've been punched in the face by a dude. This is before I initiated by hit-back policy. The guys bought me a drink to "make up" for the hit...since he was aiming for someone else.
But as i was taking my first sip, some bimbo bumped her big ass into me and spilled the drink all down my shirt. 
now i hit back.
author: Towanda S.

description:
The Caveats:

I don't go to Kells at night.

I don't order the strange happy hour drinks (flavored-vodka sweet syrup vanilla daquiri-tinis or whatever).

I like dark bars where I can have a decent Guinness.

That said, Kells is (during day and early evening hours) a perfectly fine watering hole, and always has been. The beer is fresh and well poured, the food is edible, the staff is friendly, and the music and sports TV unobtrusive but fully available. Conversations can be had. Solitude without annoyance can also be had.

Also, my good friend works next door, and there is no drinking place more convenient for meeting up with him and his colleagues.

I can't speak to what Kells might become later at night; whether or not it is a nightmare cougar trap of freakish music and even more freakish creepy dudes, I've no idea. And I plan on keeping it that way: I like my Guinness between the hours of 4 and 7pm.

Kells works for that.

And like I said, I like dark bars where I can have a decent Guinness.

Three stout Irish stars.
author: sascha b.

description:
By day, nothing but suits and unbuttoned Armani shirts.  But by night, Frat Boys gone wild dancing with Seven Jeans ho's.  Obviously I don't fit into either category, yet I find myself pleasantly admiring these two very separate scenes transitioning between 7-8.  

They offer a worthy arsenal of beers and head splitting cocktails.  The ambiance dim and decadent, making it easy for the not so good looking suddenly look hot to the drunken eye.  The booty shaking dj downstairs certainly knows how to even make the most uncoordinated white-boy look good dancing.
author: John P.

description: I can't give Kells a bad review because every time I've been there I've had a blast! I like how spacious it is and I like being able to go downstairs and dance...just da-ance
author: Sarah Z.

description:
Kells is clearly not getting enough love, so I'm going to talk about the awesome things that have happened at Kells:

- My roommate hooking up with an Irish guy on the skeezy couches
- "Don't stop believin" ... 
- My roommate hooking up with ANOTHER Irish guy at Kells
- Jager bombs

This place is good at what it does: gets people to drink, have fun, and hook up with randos.  What more can you ask for on a Saturday night?
author: Julie L.

description:
If I was a gambling man, I wouldn't gamble my night on Kells.  However, if there's no other choice, its definitely not the worst place to go. I went here during the later hours of the night.  Sooo...I'm sure its different when there's not music blasting and people dancing, haha. The major downfall with this bar comes from its small size...Basically...It gets annoyingly crowded and hot.  Having two different floors does help break up the army of people though...Even so...If you're dancing, you'll bake alive in a group of fellow dancers. 

Dancing at Kells on one of their two dance floors was pretty fun.  Despite the overcrowding, my group and I still had a great time dancing the night away.  The drinks they served were pretty good too.  I just dont know about this place though...There are definitely better places for dancing and bar hopping in the city :/

Awh! Not bad...Not great!
author: Ryan L.

description:
Decent bar, went there to celebrate a friend's birthday and had a blast, but I'm not sure it was because of Kells.

Bartenders were attentive, but the overall layout of this place was a little off. The narrowest space was where the bar was located, which made it a little difficult to grab a drink, but if you could squeeze in the bartenders got to you quickly.

After reading the other reviews I definetly agree that the crowd was right out of a frat house. In fact, drinking there took me back a few years to my freshman year of college. So if you're looking for that, it's great, but if you're not, then steer clear.

Overall, I had a great time with my friends, but then again who doesn't.
author: Mike K.

description:
I went to kells with a purpose. To get hammered drunk on St. Patty's Day! 

Just Joking, but seriously. After about an hour of trying here we moved on and I gave up... on kells. I was still able accomplish my mission, just elsewhere. Since we started drinking here I still wanted to talk while I was coherent enough to know what I was saying unfortunately since there music was so loud I couldn't even hear myself order my drink.  Also they don't have Kell's on Tap?  I've been to Kell's in SF, Portland and Seattle and definately enjoyed their own Kell's Irish Beer.  Unfortanetely SF doesn't have it, which let me down since this is the original Kell's or so I thought.  

Overall it's decently priced and would be funner as a later stop, but not the first.  If you're ever in Portland or Seattle and want a good place to check out, I've had better experiences at those Kells.
author: Greg S.

description: Had a great lunch here. Cold beer and Irish whiskey. So Good!
author: Bob L.

description: This bar has never turned me down. Good drinks, always has great dance music, packed with happy people dancing. 2 floors of fun.
author: Haleh H.

description:
The girls and I were looking for a fun spot with no cover and no line.  It was frustrating because SF has tons of places but too many of them are lame with a cover charge of $10 or $20. Now if you know you will have the time of your life "maybe" it's worth it. However, you never know until you get in and I'm just not a fan of paying to get into a place Im gonna drop a shit load of $ on booze...its stupid. My friends had been here before and said it was a blast so we have it a shot. 

Turned out to be a decent place. Id definetly go back. Its a relaxed atmosphere with a nice mixed crowd. However I don't advise you order a drink with red bull in it. its warm..and tastes weird. We had a really fun night here, aside from the jackesses that can't seem to keep track of where they are dancing. I dont care how drunk you are pay attention to who you are bumping into and have some damn common courtesy. I can get drunk with the best of em, but i have a sense if I'm bumping into someone. I cant stand rude people. Over all the place is good, and I'll be back Im sure.
author: Leza B.

description:
3 stars...but only because this bar's name is the same name as my favorite man in the whole world! (mwwa baby, I luv you!)

Otherwise a dump (read: NEGATIVE 3 stars)
author: Jill O.

description:
Ah Kell's... so Kell's is sort of like, well, Starbucks - in that reliable kind of way... you know that 100% on a Friday + Sat. night that the place is going to be filled with drunk asses hollering, er, singing, at the top of their lungs, and you know that they won't see you so they will likely spill beer/vodka/gin something on you.  oh yes, old reliable...  *wink*

Speaking of that, the drinks aren't bad, but they aren't good, they are what you get at a crowded, sweaty bar, nothing fancy, nothing sophisticated... but wait, we're at Kell's, what was i thinking??

I don't know if we went on an Irish night b/c there were a whole lotta people singin Irish songs....  anyway, so yea, i mean don't like make a special trip there, but if you're around the area and the line's too long at the Bubble, i guess this would be next closest in physical proximity...
author: Ella B.

description:
Stopped by this place before the Yelp event for a quick drink to loosen up. Being a newbie and all and scared of all you Yelpers, I needed some pre-game to loosen up and be "on".  The bartender was cool and the place has a feel of old skool San Francisco when it probably is nothing of the sort.  I like it well enough but I have no desire to go to North Beach for a night out unless I'm with the girls from Sonoma County.  Because it's just easier that way.  

Maybe I'll come back when I'm with the girls.  If there is dancing there later at night it probably is alot like my favorite bar in Petaluma, and provided there is no cover (which being a bar, it shouldn't) I would more than happy to check it out.  But my favorite bar in Petaluma is my favorite bar BECAUSE it is in Petaluma.  San Francisco is soo not Petaluma and if I have options, I'm going to take them.
author: Alexis B.

description:
I know alot of people hate the place, but I like it.  I like places with good looking people.  Yeah at 31, I think I was older than most of the crowd but definitely not the oldest.  On a Friday night the dance floor downstairs was busy but you had room to move at least. The bar upstairs was busy, and people were having fun.  With that kind of environment even if you don't like the people how can you not have fun?  

The guys I was with, admittedly were "those guys' the ones sticking their hands where they shouldn't be, picking girls up and tossing them on their shoulders and just being the wild and crazy drunk you always have to encounter when out at a packed bar.  And while I waited for some girl to scream bloody murder, it never happened while I was there, they just looked at my friend like the creepy pervert he was being, and sorta gracefully danced away from him.  

Aside from pretending not to be with the drunken idiots of the bar, I had fun.  Everyone was dancing, and just enjoying themselves.  And since I don't get out on a dance floor often (boyfriend hates it) the few times he is willing to dance with me, I take full advantage.  

Not my favorite place by any means, but not bad either.  

Any bar that has people is gonna be crowded, sticky and have beer spilling everywhere, it's just part of being out at a decent place.  This one is no different.
author: Denise B.

description: This is a nice Irish pub.  Soccer on TV and guiness on tap.  The place is classic.  Not much in the way of Microbrews though.  And the food was uninspired typical pub fare.
author: Andy Z.

description: it was a fun and popular place. bar tenders were nice and funny. i had a great time (probably because of the company), it's close and a young crowd with lot's of people, so i'll definitely be back. but honestly, it was so hot in there. everyone was dying of heat and it was a freezing night. turn up the air conditioning!
author: Megan F.

description: Effin! French Fries soooooo Good! + They have beer!  Super YUMST!
author: Mark B.

description:
So this was the followup spot to Voda lounge for night two of Wisconisin D's birthday weekend (hey, if you can squeeze two nights fee cover for the guy out of his Bday, why not?). Arrived and got parking within 150 feet of the door on the street - always awesome - and rolled up, saw a couple cute and obviously recent college grads at the door. I dropped my 5 on cover and D slid in on pure bday love. 

And we were greeted with what the D - who was born in, raised in, went to college in, and got his Master's in Madison Wisconsin - described as "the whitest bar I've ever been in". Seriously I thought I was about to be shipped out to Gitmo for sure... thank god I had to D with me, otherwise someone would have called Homeland Security on my ass. 

I'll give Kells credit - it does what it does really well - piles of fratty white guys and a lot of white girls of varying levels of attractiveness drunk to varying degrees. The bartender was fantastic - ruthlessly efficient, with a radar for who needs a drink when. I didn't have to wait more than a minute for a drink, even though the bar was packed to the gills and rowdy as hell. 

It was a loud, boisterous frat party with lots of drinks and everyone having a great time, and I could imagine I would have no problems picking up a very cute little sorority girl here - were I white. Unfortunately, I ooze "terrorist" from every brown poer of my body, so instead I got the coldest shoulders I've seen since moving to the bay. 

One star for great bartending and good parking, and one star to represent how fun this palce could be if I were as white as the D.

EDIT: Ah... and one more thing to add... someone stole the D's jacket! Of the 30 or so jackets strewn around the place, they took his... goddamn it. Now I have to knock Kells down another half star... if only there was a 1.5 star rating!!
author: Mani F.

description:
This place if ok.  You have to pay to get in I think, after a certain time.  The music is ok (but is played at window shattering levels), the vibe is very casual, and the drinks are decent and moderately priced.  There is dancing on the main floor as well as downstairs.  Aside from the some of the swea-TY and obnoxious people you'll encounter, you should be able to have a good time if you go with a group of friends, because really...you can basically ALWAYS have a good time when you're with your friends (and drinks are involved)!  Just never make a night of it at this place.

P.S.  "Where did you come from, where did you go?  Where did you come from Cotton Eyed Joe!  (oh yes...it plays there every time, EVERY SINGLE TIME)!  I could even hear it as I was leaving Scott Howard's last weekend!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
B&T

If you don't know what that stands for, then the Kells is for you!

If you know what it stands for, but you don't care, then it is even more for you!

In SF my theory has always been it should be "B&F"--after all, we get a lot more people coming up the freeway and into the bars than through any kind of tunnel (I guess the only tunnel would be BART, if that qualifies?). I must admit, I was B&F on the weekends in New York City for 3 years, and I have nothing against the starry-eyed suburbites who make the trek every other weekend--god bless them and what they do for the Broadway/Columbus economy. I don't think god blesses what the male variety of the B&F do at the strip clubs when 2 am hits though...
author: Mike G.

description:
I hate this place!  I come home from LA and most of my friends still live in SF.  Somehow we end up here pretty often and I just can't stand it.  It is always way too crowded and you are constantly bumping into people.  There's a dance floor the size of a small bathroom on the main floor that is always way too crowded.  Then the downstairs/basement area is TERRIBLE.  I'm kind of tall for a girl, 5'11", and I wear heels....the ceiling down there feels soooo low and I get claustrophobic.  

You know when you go to a frat party at a frat house and you are scared to touch everything because it just seems disgusting?  That's how I feel here.  

Just don't like it.  Sorry.  :(
author: Morena C.

description:
No cover, good music, and 2 floors to roam around in!

And if there's a line at Bubble Lounge, this place is right around the corner and there's no wait. Good deal!
author: Jen D.

description:
When I lived in San Francisco, I rarely went to this place. But on a recent visit back to the City my hotel was right around the corner so my friends and I decided on Kells after dinner. 

When we first got there it was relatively quiet and empty so we sat downstairs and just hung out. The downstairs is actually pretty cool. Sorta speakeasy like. After a short time it seemed like the crowd multiplied by 10. There was dancing. There was yelling. There was drinking. There was the random Euro dude in a soccer jersey stumbling around. More dancing on the tables this time, thankfully by cute girls in their LBDs not the random Euro dude. More drinking and yelling until the lights came up. Good times.

It does get really crowded in a confined space. I can't imagine how hot it gets in there during the warmer nights but if you're with a good group or meet some fantastic guy or girl while there its a blast.

Go earlier in the night and there's no cover.
author: R P.

description: Kells made St. Patty's a blast.  Not only did they have yumo Irish Car Bombs but hard to find HOT & TASTY Corned Beef and Cabbage.  The authentic live music was fun and downstairs had great dance music too.  The two levels made it easy to move around and even dance crazy.  Good times!
author: Alicia K.

description:
I've been to Kells for lunch, the food is average and leaves little to be desired. 

The evening is a good time. The music selection is completely random. One moment "cotten eyed joe" will play, the next will be a fine selection circa 1983, then back to country with "save a horse, ride a cowboy." I enjoyed the random music and it kept things interesting. 

It was great being a lady and paying no cover, however the doods weren't as happy to pay $5. 

The drinks were weak...c'mon, I asked for gin! Next time I'll ask for a g&t hold the tonic. 

I would go back...if I've been to cocktail hour ahead of time.
author: Natalie C.

description:
Note -- this review is for Kells as a work-week lunch spot, not a night spot.

Good UK food (if this is a contradiction to you, then stop here), linen tablecloths, friendly waiters, and a cool interior (sidewalk seating too). You can get a good burger and a soda here for around $10. Pick up one of the free Irish newspapers and have a nice quiet lunch.

This is one of my favorite lunch spots. If you go for a late lunch, you'll have the inside of the place to yourself. Pat yourself on the back for not eating at Clown Alley.
author: Pat T.

description: I refused to come here right after graduation, knowing I'd run into 10,000 other Golden Bears at this bar.  (yeah, yeah, was definitely going thru a love u/hate u kinda stage)  But finally paid a visit to this joint several weeks ago and it was ordinary fun.  The music downstairs was ...ok.  The ambiance was ...ok.  The crowd was ...ok.  The drinks were ...ok.  Overall, I give it an ..."eh".
author: Wendy H.

description:
I was dragged to Kells twice. Don't go there. 

First time: We lasted about 7 minutes. Enough time to walk through. Was there with about 5 friends in a mixed group. The men there poked me. It was very strange and my girlfriends and I ran out as fast as we could. 

Second time: I was caught in a bar fight! We were downstairs ordering drinks at the bar and two idiots came flying through and before I could run I got an elbow in my jaw. WTF???
author: J-Meoww W.

description:
I have been here on a Saturday night and it was heinous. 
Some guys got in a fist fight and one punched his own drunk ass in the face with his wrist watch, cutting himself very deeply. The drunk idiot was bleeding all over everybody. I helped him out of the bar to find my forehead and new handbag sprayed in blood. Ew. Gross. 

On the upside, I have been here for lunch on a weekday. I have to say the food was tollerable if not tastey. I would eat lunch there again but as far as the drunkin Saturday night blood bath brawls, I'll take a rain check.
author: Shawn P.

description:
Move along.

There are plenty of inviting pubs in the city...this place is not one.
author: Dpb T.

description:
I always have a great time at Kell's but it takes a bit to get the night going here. Recommend going early so you don't have to wait in line but be prepared to wait for the crowd to come. It's a big bar with a downstairs dance floor so it takes a bit of critical mass to get the party started. Music is usually a bit better upstairs but packed with dudes. If you're with a group and just want to groove, head downstairs for the dance floor and full bar. Crowd here is not all together great so don't plan on meeting the love of your life here. Drinks are very strong as well!

P.S. To the guys at Kell's on Friday night that I've seen the past 2 weekends - you're cute. I'll be at Big Foot on Thursday
author: Josephine H.

description:
This place reminds of all the stupid stuff I did while going to school in Austin and getting wasted on 6th.....which, depending on the night can be a good thing. 

So, minus one star for charging my guy friends cover. Minus a star for being ridiculously crowded. Minus the third star for having one jackass bartender who threw my friend's drink out before he was finished. 

On the plus side, if you want to go crazy on the dance floor, this is a good place to do it. Although note you will have your ass grabbed.
author: Jenn G.

description:
Just plain HORRIBLE.  And if I hear anyone the term FiDi again I will scream, because it's called "the FD" people, so please get it right next time.  Obviously you are not from here if you use that term, and don't even get me started on "Frisco" - that's just plain bad ettiquette.  Do not call it that, EVER, it just pegs you as someone from out of town immediately.

Anyway, the food here totally sucks, except for the soda bread, which is the only reason I go, because it reminds me of my grandma, she used to make the best soda bread, but she's gone forever, so now I have to suffer.  All I ordered was a cup of soup (tomato basil, simple enough), but it was so salty and unbelievably bad that I did not finish.  I also ordered a caesar salad with chicken, and how do you screw that up?  It's almost impossible, but they managed to do nothing right, dressing had no flavor, tasted like mayo with a little milk thrown in for liquidity, warm chicken, burned bread chunks trying to pass for croutons... oh my god it was just awful.

Maybe I'm spoiled by all the great places to eat and drink in San Francisco, and yes I probably should have just ordered a Guinness and left it at that, but I was hungry.  Needless to say, this place is not for eating, it's for drinking, obviously.  And I hope you don't mind listening random worker guys hanging pictures loudly expressing their sentiments by saying "fucking this and fucking that" for the entire time I was there, I'm Irish too, but please, give it a rest.   Clearly he did not give a shit if anyone was actually trying to enjoy a meal and a little peace and quiet at lunchtime, which is why I go here, because it is usually quite dead during the daytime hours.  

I guess that I will go back at St. Pat's for my yearly corned beef meal and jsut leave this place for a once a year stop, but I was so disappointed by this latest disaster of a meal that I really didn't want to ever go back.
author: Barbra K.

description:
Went here for a kind of late happy hour on a Friday night (7-9pm).   Just figured I should check it out since everyone seems to have been here (although I've never heard anything great about the place)

Pretty lame overall although the fries are pretty good (had some fish and chips).  So I think it's probably a decent place to grab some pub food before you go out.

But we didn't stay long enough for me to witness the so-called meat market aspect...
author: Sam H.

description:
Sure, this place is young, loud, packed, sweaty, and full of commuters - but that's never stopped me from having a good time! 

The biggest appeal of this place is that it's UNPRETENTIOUS, which is refreshing in this city. It's so nice to go out and just have a good time, without feeling the eyes of grown-up mean girls searching for flaws to share with their friends.

And the guys? I didn't experience any of the douchiness everyone else seems to find here. I met lots of guys who actually attempted to talk to my friends and me, (despite the loud music), and who actually  asked us to dance with them. I hardly experienced any Dane Cook "let me rub against you with my denim cock"iness.  In all honesty, many of them did look the part , (button down and hair product seem to be the uniform here,) but I didn't experience many of them acting like it. 

I'll go back any time I want to have a carefree good time. This is not the place to go if you want to be fabulous, or see and be seen. It's just not that kind of scene.
author: Emily T.

description:
So I was playing in the city with my ex for the day and we were waiting for our friend to get off work. He insisted that he knew of this awesome Irish pub in the strip club neighborhood and he said he could find it. 
After an hour of walking in circles we arrived at Kells. PS if this doesn't make sense let me explain... I'm like a guy in that I REFUSE to ask for directions because I hate to look like I don't know where I'm going and he is the same way. Plus, on this particular day, my cell phone GPS/Inernet was being a brat and not working. 
By the time we find the place our friend had gotten off work and met up with us. The 3 of us get seated in the back of the main dining area and OMG these are the cushiest benches ever! Soooo comfy! Low lighting and comfortable seating makes me love this place. The waitress made me subtract two stars. Even though my ex bf was the only one who ordered a beer, she insisted on seeing everyone's IDs. Uh.... we aren't sitting at the bar!! Dummy. 
So we order 3 bowls of clam chowder, which was the soup that day, and seriously it was soooooooooooo delicious!! We were all in love. 
We also share: 
Calamari (bomb!) 
Crab cakes (eh.... I'm picky about crab cakes, these weren't anything special) 
Side of French Fries (crispy goodness with wayyyyyy too much salt!) 
Service they whole time was slow, especially when we asked for a box and the check... the chick was too busy talking to the bartender the whole time to pay attention to her tables. 

When going on an adventure to find the restroom (gross!) I found that they have a really cool area downstairs that looks like it might be a hoppin' bar scene at night. It totally seemed like somewhere I would hang out for a few drinks, so I will be back for sure!
author: Tori E.

description:
kells is okay. it's definitely a fun time if you go with the right people, but it's nothing special. unfortunately, i didn't know there was another floor so i was stuck on the first floor, which is pretty small and extremely crowded. 

the layout of the first floor reminds me of gravity, with the bar in front and a squarish dance floor in the back. except gravity has better music. music here is not very good. they play weird irish songs mixed in with slutty hip hop songs. the one highlight of the night was when they played journey - don't stop believin' and everyone was singing along. 

i've gotta admit, the energy here is pretty good. maybe it's because everyone is so trashed. the crowd is pretty diverse and you can amuse yourself people-watching, which is what i did. people here were making out all over the place! everyone is the older side, 30+.

overall, this is just an average bar i'd probably find myself at if i lived in san francisco. but since i don't, i won't be going out of my way to come here.
author: Shirley H.

description: I've been there for food and it is bomb. Now I have been there for the bar and presently surprised. I must remember its not a real dance floor and not to trip on the uneven floor. Otherwise, a fun night. The place just keeps getting more crowded. Everyone in a great mood, with strong drinks.
author: Natasha M.

description:
This place is a total meat market shithole. And it's expensive.

You want proof? Around 10 pm they go around the bar area, which seems pretty nice when you first walk in, and they pick up all the seat cushions so the clientele doesn't puke or piss on them. Seriously! Then a crowd of creepy old lady cougars, even creepier dudes in suits, and trashy drunk underaged undergrads descend upon the place and I guess it becomes a club. Or whatever. Zero redeeming qualities.
author: Melissa J.

description:
Never been here as a bar scene but came in one day for lunch.  
Best Chicken Pot Pie i have ever had in my life!!! Guinness and Pot Pie what a combo!
author: Bernardo C.

description:
Yea I'm going to have to agree with my friend Jenn below.  Just not a great place.  I mean I had to pay cover for what?  No band, no dj, nothing.   It was really crowded, but some people enjoy that, its cool.  

I just didn't enjoy it for other reasons as well.  But definitely not a place I'll return to, thats for sure.
author: Aaron G.

description:
Kells is my favorite Irish pub and restaurant in San Francisco!!  This place has a fantastic beer selection, has amazingly good tomato basil soup and grilled cheese sandwiches, and the BEST shepherd's pie I have ever had in my life.  I strongly encourage people to try this place.  You will find yourselves extremely satisfied with the high level of service and the hearty Irish cuisine.

Bonus: The incredibly sweet and attentive staff, and the authentic Irish pub ambiance!
author: Jacqueline T.

description:
I have only been to this place on Friday nights, & can hardly stand it.  2 stars because it always manages to draw a crowd, even on those random nights where the rest of North Beach is deserted.  Unfortunately, the crowd will generally consist of striped shirts and overweight (but not fat) groups of homely looking girls who are looking to dance to Aerosmith.  I am not sure how certain nightlife establishments manage to attract the same types of people over and over again, but you can count on the Kells crowd being exactly as I describe every weekend.

Drink prices are reasonable & they have more than a few beers on tap.  You will witness some of the most uncoordinated dance moves known to man on the upstairs (non hip-hop) dance floor.  Use this place as a last resort on a night when nothing else is happening.
author: T D.

description:
WHY do my friends continue to insist on having birthdays here? Sure it's free for chicks or whatever but it's far from home and there's a line and a crowd and bartenders who will keep your change from drinks that are already way too expensive.

Well, if you must, dress lightly and prepare to be both physically and mentally uncomfortable. Two stars because i have been to worse.
author: Jordan B.

description:
Oh Kells, what can I say about Kells that has not already been mentioned below. 

Kells is the spot that you go late night when you've already had enough to drink and you're not going to be embarrassed if pictures of you are snapped in er uh compromising positions or you feel like a good bridge and tunnel make out session with that questionable (21 wink wink) year old.
author: Summer C.

description: Not crowded at all for a Friday evening and the bartender was very attentive and sweet.  Fun with a small group of friends. My friend said it can get crowded and frat-party-like but I didn't experience that.  I'm not a huge fan of North Beach on a weekend night (too chaotic) but this place was fine.
author: Kari L.

description: A Plastic cup fill fun time! If you're in the area, and looking for a unpretentious good time, this place is worth a look. The drinks were cheap and strong (especially compared to the Bubble Lounge across the street) , the staff is cool, and the clientele seemed nice enough. The music was fun and everyone seemed to be having a really good time there, a vibe that you just can't get anywhere. I could see the basement dance floor/makeout room being a tad skeezy, but if you're looking for a frat party flashback, and there's nothing wrong with that, why not?
author: Janette W.

description: Good fun after work but don't go in looking for authentic Irish Pub. Fine with me, I got a big kick out of watching the 20 year olds stand on a table to sing every word to a Journey song that came out before they were born.
author: Helen K.

description:
You can't get a better place to grab happy hour post-work drinks than at Kells Irish Pub in a historic block of San Francisco where the majority of the businesses are selling antiques or designer nouveau chic couches for way more than I can afford.

Kells is Jekyll and Hyde place for me - I will go there now only after work for drinks and am gone by no later than 10pm. I will avoid after 10pm on a Friday/Saturday night as I think I have outgrown the scene and the unruly types that exist in this establishment on those nights.

Probst!
author: Will C.

description:
I was a little reluctant to go to Kells since it was my pre-21 bar hangout, but I was pleasantly surprised.

It's a quality casual bar with good music. There was a DJ downstairs as well as upstairs playing different music & 2 bars, one downstairs and one upstairs. The crowd was pretty decent and overall I had a great time...It's all about who you are with, and like most bars, I wouldn't recommend going there to meet someone.

I will definitely be frequenting Kells in the future!
author: Elaine S.

description:
Good old Kells, tried and (somewhat) true. This seems to be one of the definite go-to places for recent college grads like myself, since every time I've been here I've ran into people from college or even high school. It's actually quite a decent place to go out compared to many of the other stops frequented by my demographic. Bartenders are quick, prices are decent, and it's always a fun time, but just too predictable to earn more than 3 stars.

They've got two floors with different music going, which I thought was a great idea the first time I went, but since have realized that the patterns are quite repetitive. It always starts out decent, but as the night goes on, slowly deteriorates until it hits rock-bottom of the mediocre bar music world, the one-two knockout punch as I like to call it:

Sweet Caroline and Don't Stop Believing.

A genuine match made in heaven for any DJ who likes the old flip-the-mute-switch and let the liquid courage of the crowd take over for the chorus, but it's absolute kryptonite to anyone with taste in music or a blood alcohol level below 0.4. But oh well, I guess I'll stop complaining and just have another gin and tonic.
author: C P.

description: I should have known better.  You should not go to this place if you are anywhere near 30.  My friends and I felt like geriatrics when we walked into this place.  I'm sure I would have enjoyed this place several years ago (nope, not telling you how many years ago), but the Kells is absolutely not for me now.  Had I not been with my awesome friends, I would have been miserable.  But since it's the company you keep rather than where you are that's important, I actually had a fun time.  Then, my geezer friends and I turned into pumpkins around midnight and left the kids to do their thing into the wee hours of the night.  I will not be going back to this place.
author: Danielle B.

description:
Yes, it's hot. 
Yes, people party here like it's their last night on earth. 
Yes, it's a younger crowd, but so are Disneyland, playgrounds, and arcades. People forget to have fun and worry more when they get old. It is definitely a place where most people would walk in and say, "I'm too old for this crap". 
Yes, maybe I should be one of those people, but I still need a little craziness after a long work week. 
Yes, it smells like vomit in various corners, without fail, every single Friday and Saturday night. 
Yes, my friends and I all say we are not, absolutely not going to Kells, for obvious reasons, then somehow end up there at about 12:30 after other bars and clubs being supper uppity and boring, or just filled with American douchbaggery. 
Yes, maybe we only think it's great because we wait until 12:30 to go when we already drunk. 
Yes, there are always a handful of creepy horny guys here, but don't you dare let them ruin your night. 
Yes, sometimes we just want to dance it out to Katy Perry and sing at the top of our lungs to "Here I go again" and Journey! 
Yes, the hostel in North Beach ends their pub-crawls here, so that always makes for some good craic. Other than that, we don't really notice the crowd much because we tend to make our own entertainment here. Going here with a good group of friends is a must. 

When we take people here who have never been, we warn them of these things. It's a crowded drunk fest. Just go with it or go home. We realize it is not for everyone. 

And for the record.... Sometimes we dance on the benches because it is by the only window in the whole place, so we not only have room to dance, but get some cool air too. It's not to show off our awesomeness. 

I am only giving it four stars to keep with the tradition my friends and I have about loving to hate Kells. We just need to accept it and say, though embarrassing, "We love Kells". Something amazing always happens either here, or in the post Kells debauchery when no one is ready for the party to stop. I just can't quite face the reality of this yet myself, so I can't give it five stars. I am still in denial of my secret love for Kells. 

P.S. Big ups to Dan the bartender
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Wow, the other reviews were really harsh. I guess since I am always out of the city before anything gets crowded or they are huge bar fights then I do not know. 
Anyway they hosted Canada Day and I had a good time. Canada is like Mac and the United States is like Microsoft. This has nothing to do with Kells. 
They have couches downstairs which always scores points.
author: Marcus R.

description:
This is actually one of the few crowded bars that I can stand in SF. If you get here early enough, you can actually see that it's a really kick ass irish bar. Some of you may have already noticed this, but I find it very difficult to see anything but a mob of people squeezing past each other on the way to who the hell knows where. 

The last time we go there, my friend got head butted in the face-- I found out later there was this rugby party there... but the staff took care of the problem swiftly and we started drinking scotch on the rocks shortly after. 

Haven't tried the food and probably will never try the food just for the mere fact that I wouldn't go here to eat. but the music's decent and while I was writing this review I was trying to make it bad, but some way, somehow Kell's-- you won my heart. I heart you.
author: Tim Y.

description: Its more of a college town bar. $5 cover charge for guys and ladies get in for free. small dance floor on 1 st level with ample seating and more seating on the ground floor. ground floor gets really hot and humid. Place gets really busy. decent music
author: Hasham Y.

description: Nice bar, strong drinks.  They had a-mazing music.  Early '90s in the best way possible.  I'm a fan, I'd go back but probably not too soon because parking was horrendous.
author: Elyanna S.

description: I always have an awesome time here, I love the vibe of people wanting to have a fun time, no drama! I feel everyone is super fun and friendly here, rather than stuck-up and snobby. I also enjoy that there is so much room, and dancing! Drinks aren't too expensive. Always good times!
author: Chrissy A.

description: i got here super late so i only caught a GLIMPSE of the general atmosphere before closing time. the drinks were cheep and the bartenders were nice... and thats about all. I will go back and leave a more in depth review after i spend more than 5 min there.
author: Shadi N.

description: I am not a big clubber.
