I hate the stuffy superficial atmosphere, not being able to move without bumping into at least ten people, and hearing the same terrible music remixed in slow motion. However I love Kells. Granted I've only been here twice but both experiences were great. For one thing the music here is fantastic. They play everything from the iconic "Save a Horse, Ride a Cowboy" (which even non-country fans have to love) to the more modern Rihanna and of course Don't Stop Believing. The last time I was here they played 80s music on the downstairs floor for a good hour towards the end of the night. People here are much nicer then at many bars/clubs I've been to. It has a low key, friendly, completely unstuffy vibe and it just seems like everyone wants to have a good time (not like everyone has a 'hidden' hookup agenda). I love that it's light enough to be able to see people's faces and people in general. There are definitely people from all over here, even from places like Brazil. And I love that there are areas to sit down and chillax if you want to take a break and grab a drink. It gets crowded but not so crowded that you can't dance and generally people respect each other's space. I completely agree with what many people said about the 'college' vibe of this place. Basically at this point in my life there are many things I'd rather do with my saturday night then spend it at a club. But if I were to spend it at a club I would absolutely, hands down, choose to spend it at Kells. And end up having a damn good time.
author: Alla B.

description: I was surprised by this little Irish bar - with a lively crowd and good music, a Saturday night at Kells proved to be a great time. Kells has two dance floors, a large bar, and wonderfully CLEAN facilities. The bartenders are attentive and pour strong drinks at good prices. It's CROWDED, so be prepared to get up close and personal with the rest of the bar. The scene feels like a "college frat party" - lots of collared shirts dancing to the Top 40's/pop hits. For a fun and familiar feeling night out (think - large crowd singing Journey at the top of their lungs) this place is the spot. Nothing wrong with a little trip back down memory lane..... I'll definitely be back for more!!
author: Caroline J.

description: I was relieved to find this in San Francisco when I was there for fleetweek. Kells makes a killer Irish Coffee and happy hour was good to go as well. I intend to visit Kells every time I venture up to San Fran.
author: James H.

description:
fix your air conditioning people!

the downstairs was an absolute SAUNA last time i was there . . . . i was dreading that any moment, the condensed perspiration accumulating on the ceiling would succumb to the pull of gravity and drip on me . . . .ew.
author: Vicki Y.

description: Had a good early dinner there on Friday night.  The staff's not remotely Irish, though, which was a downer, but they carry themselves well.  Was disappointed when I stopped by for lunch on Saturday and didn't realize they weren't open until later, but that was my fault for not checking first!  I'll have to spend more time here in the near future. ;)
author: Jay B.

description: Wow...interesting to read the reviews about what happens to Kells later on in the evening.  I've only been here for week day happy hours and it's a great Irish bar with super friendly staff, lots of regulars who stop by for a drink after work, and the french fries are darn good!
author: Kate H.

description: Sausage fest!!!  I've been to Kells a few times and it's like your older sibling forcing you to eat catfood...as many times as you try it, it just never gets any better.  It's typically packed with a slew of sketchy men who give off the air that they have their pockets full of roofies.
author: Allison K.

description: That's funny... I've been here before too...  A workfriend and I snuck out of work to drink Magner's here....  We left our backpacks at work so our boss would think we were coming back...  We weren't fooling anyone except ourselves.  I think everyone knew . . . . that we really were not going back to work, that is.  But that's the beauty of Kells...  It's that nearest faraway place where secrets are kept and drunks tell the most interesting stories.  Just kidding, no they don't.
author: Kenny R.

description: I read all of the bad reviews and everyone says the same thing which is correct but for me if I am going to get wasted with a group of friends who are primarily single and want to dance and have a blast my first suggestion in SF is Kells.  The place plays great music from newer stuff to all your favorites growing up.  Great music while getting drunk and drinks are reasonably priced.  There is an occasional fight to watch which is always some excitement and almost every Friday or Staurday night there will be some cute girls there.  I have not been in awhile now but if you are single and want a good bar that is like a college bar with young people 21 to 30 and cute girls, good music and dont mind being super crowded and having an occasional area of the bar smell like piss then this is definetely a great place for you to go in SF on a Friday or Saturday night.
author: Harry E.

description: Good lawd this place gets crowded, but the last time I was here a nice Brit tried to ply me with drinks and then asked me to join him and his girlfriend in a threesome... always an interesting time at Kells. At least they were both cute.
author: Chum L.

description:
Wow.  

Downstairs: I watched two over 30, fake booblonde women give lap dances and over-the-pants hand jobs to two married men in the not so empty basement.  I tried to determine whether these women were their wives, but it was difficult to see a ring on the left finger since the hand was otherwise involved.  

Upstairs: Much more crowded, making gropage less visible.  Luckily the music (Jump Around!) catered to keep-your-distance dance moves.

My friend spent the night declaring that this was his new favorite bar in the city.  I can't decide whether he was sarcastic, thought the $5 cover was cheap for the basement show, or just loved the Irish jig music that much.  Either way, 1 star for entertainment.
author: Brooke G.

description: I got hammered here once a few years ago.  I only went because i was hanging out with a girl from work that i didn't know too well, and she said it was 'the funnest bar in the city.'  All I can remember is that it was really crowded, hot as hell, the bathrooms were disgusting and it felt like I was at a frat party.  I also seem to recall standing on a chair booing very loudly while everyone else in the place was singing "Sweet Caroline," then stumbling across the street, calling my husband on the payphone, and then puking in front of Clown Alley.  This, my friends, is not my idea of a good time.  I blame it on Kells, and the crappy atmosphere that led me to drinking more Rockstar and vodkas than any one person should.   one star only because i can't give it zero.
author: Eileen H.

description: This is a great place if you want to drink Budlights out of insulated aluminum bottles, meet some 19 year olds from Sacramento and dance to Montell Jordan...all in all, no complaints.
author: Kenny S.

description: Holy crap. Kells, you are the worst bar in the city. Why do I hate thee? Let me count the ways... First, just because I was male, I got charged a $5 cover. Second, it's nice to see all of the high school kids who can't hold their liquor out drinking on a weekend and never failing to step on me. Third, all of the bartenders were all pretentious, power-tripping asshats who did nothing but hassle me the whole night. Fourth, "Cotton-Eyed Joe" on the jukebox. Need I say more? If I never go back here, it will be too soon.
author: Michael E.

description: I've been to Kell's about 3 or 4 times before, and I'd convinced myself that you have to be really drunk to have a good time here because it's so crowded/noisy/lots of younger drunk people.  So I came here mostly sober on Sat night.  I had good time.  It's all about who you're with anyway, but my friends and I danced a lot downstairs, which I liked better than the upstairs scene.  One of the guys I was with puked on himself sitting at a booth, and I don't think anyone cleaned it up, and it was pretty hot downstairs, but other than that I was diggin the scene.  It's actually a good place to go if you want to drink and dance, but not feel like you're in a "clubby" type place, like Ruby Skye/Velvet Lounge, etc.  This is more of a "get drunk and dance if you want" type place.  Some people here are kind of annoying, the 20-24 age range frat/sorority types, but overall I had a good time.
author: Julie F.

description: I work in the same building as Kells so I go here for happy hour pretty frequently... They know my work group and we always have a great time. I've never seen it get crowded but I'm generally gone before 7pm or so. If you want a lowkey Happy Hour spot... Kells is your place!
author: Thel D.

description: I went to Kells recently and from what I saw of it, I thought it was a decent place. I got a drink upstairs and then proceeded to the basement. I never would've known that a downstairs drinking area existed if it weren't for the people that I was meeting there. It was pretty crowded and hot, but the drinks were a fair price and they had some good music; that is what really matters when you are going to a bar to drink, right? Oh, plus the service was fast. No one likes to wait around forever for a drink and here you don't have to! Gotta love it, I'm sure I'll be back.
author: Carly W.

description: Sometimes I need a weekend fix of douchebag, and I come here to get it. Also, when I want to feel better about myself, I come here to mock the big, drunk girls as they defy gravity and dance on the tables. Overall great place for a good, old-fashioned drunken rowdy time, especially if you get the car bombs. It is an Irish pub, ain't it? Um kind of. They play all kinds of music from Irish jig tunes to down and dirrrty-dirtay rap to 80s to classic rock. There's this one unhumanly hot bartender who is there on Friday nights, workin' the bar in the basement. Go find him. Guaranteed good times!
author: Natalie T.

description: I'm dragged here by friends, its packed, there are 100 sketchy guys all wearing the same shirt.  I need a drink immediately but have to wait at least 15 minutes to get one.  Leave this place right away or start pounding shots.
author: Lindsey W.

description: Happy houred here with the co-workers one evening...besides not having enough chairs, it was a nice evening out just chatting and hanging out.
author: meL Z.

description:
simple. good irish liquor, hidden and scandelous. good for an affair from the heart. good booths private and naugahide.
good for a quicke lunch and s-l-o-w conversation.
author: Sasha P.

description:
Wow! This place during happy hour is alright because it is not a frat bar with freshman college peeps. Their bar grub is acceptable and goes great with a harp lager; in fact, any beer. In the weekends it gets crowded, hot and like any Irish bar, rowdy. The music you listen is practically to get drunk and the tracklist jumps around from one genre to another, I was not surprised and the people didn't care (We were all drunk). The point is that this is an Irish bar, not a dance club so you will definitely  get your Irish atmosphere at happy hour but not during the night or maybe you will depends how you take the POV.
As for the afternoon, the place is a good restaurant with good eats at reasonable prices. I would go with my buds here and have some food during my lunch break with some beers (like 3 or 4 drinks) then back to work...
Since I have fond memories of messing around with girls, getting schlitz and being a rascal hey I will give you:

 2.5 Starz
author: Manuel S.

description: I love Kells!  This is my favorite bar in SF.  I adore the owners/managers and staff there.  They are really friendly and treat their repeat customers right.  I had a party organized there once and they really went above and beyond.  Food is great here too.  Sausage Rolls! Mmmm. The bar also coincidentally has my nickname and was established the year I was born lol!   I do recommend partying in the upstairs portion as downstairs can get hot when the place is packed.
author: Kelly L.

description: This my all-time favorite bar in the city. Don't get me wrong, I've been to a lot of bars and clubs around here but for some reason I keep coming back to Kell's. Almost every single one of my friends hates this bar, but I love it. Ok ok. so they play their music from a cd player. There's a 5 second gap between every song. Most of the time it feels like a sauna.  Yes. it's a meat market and there have been many (many) times my friends and I have had to run out of there to escape the creepy ex-frat guys. But where else can you play air guitar in the  middle of the room and sing along to Bon Jovi and ACDC and have the whole room sing with you? And for that reason, I heart Kell's and keep on going back....
author: Grace L.

description: They have beer, irish music, and flat screen TVs. Not much else noteworthy...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
This is not the Portland Kell's I expected.

Turn around and drive north.
author: David B.

description:
Came here as part of a bachelorette party. Got there about 9pm, wasn't very crowded, started picking up about 10 and was packed by 11. Music was a good mix of everything. Drinks were inexpensive and quickly served. 

If you are looking for an upscale bar, this is not it, but if you are looking for a fun place to dance and enjoy the evening this could be it.
author: heather v.

description: If I wanted to smell sweaty dudes and loose women, I would just go to the YMCA.
author: Tabor, S.

description:
Smells like bathroom, cheap perfume and cigarettes...I haven't had a hooker in years but the "aura" reminded me oh so dearly.

I've been here a bunch of times and each follows the same timeline - 
9:30 - No one here, not a single person downstairs and about 10 upstairs
10:00 - A few show up and tinker at the bar upstairs while downstairs remains empty.
10:30 - same
11:00 - alluvasudden line around the block, downstairs upstairs packed with dudes talking to each other.
If you want to imbibe, you gotta swim through an ocean of button shirts and guess jeans to get to the bar.
11:30 - more dudes - like 7 chicks total all with either crows feet or c-section scars
12:00 - more dudes - its a goddamn sword fight meelee
12:30 - more dudes - ratio is honestly about 20:1 (being conservative)
1:00 - one of the only chicks here probably pushing 37 drapes her arm fat arm over you; while she slurs into your ear you see the streaks of gray in her mane while detecting a scent of cats
1:30 - 37 year old, still draped on you, declares national-sing-along-cuz-its-journey day and rips your ear drums apart.
2:00 - you finally leave because you're an idiot for staying so long...you walk by clown alley and see the 37 year old mashing chilli fries into her face.

Bartenders are really cool here tho i guess...
author: Nico M.

description: I came here on Friday with my best friend Autumn R. and we had a great time! I enjoyed this bar, especially because there was dancing. It's hard to find a bar with dancing and no cover charge, at least it is in LA and Long Beach. The night started off kind of lame, but around 11 a ton of people showed up and the dancing began. We met a couple nice guys and a couple shaddy/weird guys. Lol. Overall it was fun to party with Autumn, meet some new people, and get a bit drunk! It was a great way to start of my fabulously fun weekend in SF.
author: Amanda E.

description: I work directly upstairs from Kells and I like Kells.  I like it because it is directly downstairs from where I work.  Also, they have beer.
author: Jay F.

description: When you want to head out on a rainy Saturday night in the city and just don't quite feel like making the effort to go to a super fly club downtown then go here.  Get there a little earlier and you can find a table.  I know I like a place when the bartender pulls out a Costco size bottle of Grey goose like this is the normal thing to do.  The music is not a bad mix and the people seem to be pretty chill (i do recommend bringing your own friends however because it is a little lame to go to  a bar all by your little lonesome on a Saturday night.. OK maybe a little creepy even).  Decor has the OLD SF feel to it with the brick and paintings and the fact that there is an upstairs and a downstairs gives you a couple options (which can be nice every now and then).  Check it out, chill, and just have fun.
author: Kylie L.

description: Do you value the beautiful sounds of parrots sqwaking in the morning or St. Peter and Paul's church bells ringing? Maybe the zip of a freindly Vespa owner carrying home an italian baguette or two? If you're in North Beach for the day and then decide to go down to Kell's then please stay away. I have permanent hearing loss from one evening of partying. Upstairs was SUPER LOUD and the dance floor was SUPER SMALL, an odd juxtaposition in my opinion. Downstairs was no better. Can anyone say sausage fest? If I wanted to party with just dudes, I would go down to the castro. Drinks are expensive, and bad. Music is SUPER LAME, seems like they have a 5 disc CD player on random, because there is like a 10 second pause between every song. Altogether lame. Please stay away, or go back to the Marina guys.
author: Ben R.

description: Kells will eat you alive! This is by far one of the most insane dives in town. I've been here many many times and it's very evident that there are few rules to break. You can get as sloppy as you like here. These days its a bit too much for me, but if you're a sprightly college newbie or you just still cherish those nights that you get to dance drunkenly on tables, flirt your way into too many drinks, down a jager after a carbomb, and sing Journey till your voice cracks, then this is the place for you!!! But don't say I didn't warn ya!!!
author: Chloe D.

description: I give this bar five stars because I've experienced it on many levels. We walked in there at 6PM on a Saturday where people were quietly enjoying conversation over shots of Fernet and Hot Toddies. We left with plans to return later that evening. We arrived at 12:30AM and discovered an entirely new atmosphere. We had a shot (or two) of Jameson and we better equipped to deal with the basement dance party. We moved upstairs and it was anything but the "sausage fest" that others have suggested. I look forward to coming here again.
author: Michael H.

description: Best place I have been in I don't know how long. Great meeting place with  your friends. Sure the $5 cover for guys sucks, but it's worth it. You won't be sorry, boys.
author: C J.

description: woooooooooo woooooooooooo!!!!  Oh my god I am sooo happy to see youuuu!!!  I loveeeee youuuu!!  Again, these are the sounds that you will here as you walk down the block to kell's.  Not so much.  The place has 3 smells, puke, pee, bad booze.  What gives.  Unless u are a letch or 17-20, this is a major skip.
author: Nicole F.

description: This place was cool. The bar tenders are friendly and fun and people are all right here. Maybe because I go with the same friend here every time and she knows everyone everywhere, and their maid. Strong drinks, again possibly because I was with this girl. But who cares, this place is fun.
author: Suzanna G.

description: Despite the girls who was there the girl to guy ratio was off the charts total Sausage fest I was already buzzing from the previous clubs and my friends and I followed a friend of a friend? lol saying it was cracking? lol yeah it was cracking at the bar. once I sobered up and had a good look around LOL errrmm..... yeeeahhhh but its funny because they are playing hip-hop music then bust out with some random rock? WhoA! WHOA! WHOA!  what happened. lol I think this will be a one time experience.
author: John A.

description: Ugh.  It smells like vomit, the people are weird (seriously, there was a cougar who was hitting on a barely-21 year old by telling him about her daughter...so bizarre), there are ALWAYS foreigners (not the sexy kind), and the music is on another planet.  I mean, they'll start playing some good, current music that people can dance to, and then all of sudden, they bust out an Irish jig song.  Seriously.  And the people there LIKE it.  Ugh.  So bottom line, unless you want to meet ugly, annoying foreign people in an establishment that smells like puke, and then do an Irish jig with them, stay the F*** away!
author: Katie J.

description: If you are in the  mood for a re-visit to a college frat party, you can't beat Kell's. For the top 40/hip hop dance club beats, drinks in plastic cups, drunk guys hitting on you, Kells is definitely the place. Now, if  you're not feeling up to that sort of an evening, avoid it, but if you're in the mood, its a fantastic time!
author: Snora E.

description:
i'll take two hefeweizens, pass on the sweaty guy behind me and hold the crowd of disgusting creeps pressing up against eachother.. thanks.

put an f'ing limit on how many sweaty bodies you'll allow in such a confined space, would you? ech. i can't believe i'd rather go to circa than here. oh don't even get me STARTED on them...
author: Nancy P.

description:
Between the disgusting bar downstairs and the equally disgusting restaurant upstairs, I basically would stay away from Kell's unless you are wasted and looking for a dirty time.

Reasons:
1. On a busy night the downstairs is humid with other people's sweat
2. I had the worst Reuben in my entire life there (I thought it was an Irish restaurant)
3. While eating there I experienced what the waitress explained was a twice a day waft of Chinatown's sewage aroma
author: Jackson R.

description:
i don't remember paying a cover, and i don't remember how much drinks were. i do, however, remember thinking the stairs were too narrow and the crowd was full of people i would never want to associate with in the confines of the pub, let alone the real world.

oh! and i will never forget the DJ playing some Scottish jig which caused quite a commotion followed by a Riverdance-esque dance off. if this is your thing, come to Kells! if not- don't.
author: Joelle K.

description: This place blows (for the nightlife...haven't experienced it as an eatery).  Full of scummy guys looking for trouble, very crowded  and the downstairs area always smells like stinky feet.....or some sort of horrid cheese.  If I were you, I'd try and avoid this place at all costs.
author: Jen K.

description: We went there on Sat night with a big group of friends.  Overall, it wasn't bad.  All the girls were dancing up on the stage, which was fun to watch.  The drinks weren't bad and it seemed like a good mix in the crowd.  It does get extremely crowded, however.  This seemed to dampen the experience somewhat, in such tight quarters (the bar/club is tiny).  I'd be bringing my beer from the bar to where my friends are and get bumped into left and right, causing the beer to spill all over my clothes.  Still, its not a bad place to go for a while, and I guess you have to expect the insane crowds when you go out in North Beach on a Saturday night.
author: Aaron M.

description:
it's an ok place, with a big bar and ok insides. meshed with the clientel it's a place where you can get messed up.

but i wasn't really feeling the size of the bar, nor the bartender, nor really anything about it. i could see this place being good with tons and tons of friends, but jsut to go out to with a couple of people - not so much.
author: David D.

description: It's funny how some poeple love this place or hate this place. The music is horrible, not my cup of tea. I had to drink a lot last time I was there, but still wasn't feeling the place. To each his own.
author: Beth W.

description: Before I moved here, I always heard about Kell's in North Beach. Now I know why, annoying underage kids and slick greasy guys...yea, I'll pass. Plus, the music was so loud I couldnt think...and that had nothing to do with the 3 or 4 drinks I had prior. Basically, its nice earlier in the night when theres like, no one there. Leave by 11 and you'll be fine.
author: Erin F.

description:
Kells might be the best establishment in the city. I have probably been to kells about 100 times and not once have i had a bad time. Honestly what is there to complain about??? Theres music and booze. There is an area of the bar for every type of experience. You can go downstairs for a young rowdy crowd, stay up stairs on the dance floor for a little more order, or you stick towards the front of the bar for a more low key environment. The downstairs bartenders (bryan and brian) are pretty much amazing. For some reason whatever they pour me takes me to a great place. Upstairs you've got big dan, lil dan, and sarah. Big dan may have some of the most ridiculous political views ever (dirty liberal) but the man is a good dude. if you feel like having a great night...ill see you there. AOEP. 


Cons-
angry door guy
$5 cover
the way i feel in the morning when i wake up

I am going to quote a great review from below..."This place is good at what it does: gets people to drink, have fun, and hook up with randos.  What more can you ask for on a Saturday night?"
author: John Q.

description: Good on 'em for being such a successful bar, but seriously, at some point, you need to stop letting people in.  It's just science... gross, sweaty, frat boy science.
author: Casey S.

description: This is like a little frat bar in North Beach. It's gets pretty packed on friday/sat. The downstairs sometimes smells like ass. I've never really had a great time here. They usually have a 5-10$ cover. Not my favorite place in NB.
author: Michael S.

description: I had a good time here. You can dance your ass off upstairs, you can dance your ass off downstairs. DJs played pretty good music. Fun crowd. Fun area. Fun times.
author: S. M.

description: Rufie Fest + Frat Tools + Loud = as much fun as being a tuna caught in a fish net.  (This has to be my shortest review to date, but completely justified by the meat fest that I have experienced at this shit hole)
author: Taylor P.

description: We were supposed to go to a bar/restaurant down the street, but because we saw a former co-worker sitting at the bar we decided to turn around and leave.  Hahaha..so mean!  Anyway, it was good that we did, because we ended up at Kells!  I'm now a fan!  I was hungry so I ordered baked brie with fruit to share and a beet salad.  It was superlicious!  Our server was also very nice and kept checking up on us.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Maria J.

description: My husband and I would often walk by this place and always wanted to try it out for dinner so we did. We went there one night after work. We sat upstairs near their big window and had some beers. We ordered the bangers and mash and also fish and chips. The food was very good and the service was attentive. It was an all around good time. Might have to go back soon...
author: Anna H.

description: Went here on a Friday night and had a Smithwicks for $5. This place is decent, the bar was crowded but there were open table seats in the front of the place. It reminded me somewhat of pubs in Ireland, with the fire place (even though it was not real) and the images of Ireland. This is a good place to sit down, chat and drink.
author: kelli d.

description: It's packed with unattractive men that gawk and won't buy you a beer. Or he buys you a beer and if he's european (75% chance) he tries to make out with you after the first sip. "Get used to it" a friend of mine retorts who always has the idea of going here. Yuck. Stay above ground level, they can't grab you when you're dancing on the coffee table because there are 'no boys allowed.' The girls are spastic when they're drunk and I couldn't find a drop of grace or charm. Luckily, they have two bars to provide my amusement for the night-one star for each.
author: Kim G.

description: I'm such a dumbass.  I read like 50 reviews about how much this place sucks, I believe those reviews.  And still I go to this.  My friend's friend had a birthday there for god knows what reason.  It's packed and really hard to get from the entrance to the dance floor because the bar takes up about 75% of the walkspace.  The music is really bad frat house music.  The upstairs is really packed, the downstairs is really hot and muggy and still pretty packed.  The decor is OK, but the crowd is awful.  This would work much better as a bar than a nightclub.  Vile.  I would pay $50 to forget I went there.  If you are a member of the management, I'm sorry, but you probably know what I'm talking about.
author: Cassio P.

description: When I first moved here, I used to go to this bar all the time- and then, like my realization about the cesspool that is Bar None, I grew out of it.  Being completely unable to walk through the place was one reason, waiting in a huge line and paying a cover was another. But let's be honest- I really stopped coming here because the last time I did, my friend Jasmine F. and I fell off a table while dancing on top of it- everyone stopped and stared, the world felt like it moved more slowly and I quickly bowed and left. Never again.
author: Noelle Q.

description: They have been playing the same playlist since I was in college and didn't have a legal id.  Seeing as how I am now 24, that means they've probably been playing the same list for the last 6 years.   It is also hot as hell.  If that's what I was looking for, I would've gone to bikram instead, at least it doesn't leave me smelling like day old beer!
author: Sloane R.

description: I dont see why SO many people go to Kells (esp on weekends). The place is too small, over crowded, and stinky! Not for me, probably will NEVER go back.
author: Will M.

description: Aww come on people! Any place that has the balls to play Cotton Eyed Joe deserves at least 4 stars in my book.
author: Lauren B.

description:
on my visit back home, we randomly ended up here for a little bit has part of one of our bar stops on a saturday night.  suprisingly, the music was great and the drinks were even a better deal.  

there is a downstairs and that bathroom is a little maze to get to.

the best part was seeing a bunch of people irish dancing in a pub.  what a way to end the night. haha.
author: Carli F.

description: The bartender may be dead and nobody has told him yet. Weak bar. Full of wankers during drinking hours but a ghostown during lunch.
author: Krismet C.

description: Having a good time at a bar mostly depends on the people you go with, and my night at Kells was pretty damn good.  My only complaint would be the fact that this place gets way too hot and way too stuffy, to the point of being uncomfortable.  Other than that, good mix of music, good bar staff, decent crowd.
author: Jackee K.

description:
Famous Last Words: "And then we ended up at Kells..."

Many a story begin like that... unfortunately, the story teller doesn't often remember much else.
author: Anjali K.

description: Jingle Kells, Jingle Kells, Jingle all the way, oh what fun it is to ride...ok there is nothing that will make sense if I try to finish the song- I've been going to Kell's for years....make that 7, yes- 7 years I say! I have never had a bad time here- this place is like Christmas everyday- Filled with laughter, joy and cheer! Back in the day, you'd see me and my friends table dancing and bar dancing- the places to dance here were endless....now as I am getting a little older and wiser, the dancing stays on the floor but the fun hasn't changed. Paul is awesome! I love it that males have to pay to get in and if one of those Males gets a little tipsy and tries to table dance next to a female....music stops, flashlight goes on thus males face until he removes himself from the bench/table and back on the ground where he belongs and the party continues!
author: Ricquel N.

description: Hm... I was surprised to see how low Kells was rated. I came for the first time this past weekend and actually had a really good time here. There was a $5 cover for the guys only. Kells has a very cool atmosphere, dark with just enough lighting. There are two levels and both have bars. The bartenders are actually really nice and even held our jackets under the bar for us. The music is decent too (standard top 40) - there were some ppl dancing in the lower level (couldn't tell from the upper). Like others have said, the layout can be a bit annoying at times because it's so narrow that you have to squeeze by people when it gets crowded. Actually, the bar felt very reminiscent of college... everyone around the same age and everyone... the same. You get the picture.  Drink prices = normal for SF. Dress = somewhere between casual and dressy. Overall, I'm a fan and I will probably be back when in I'm north beach again.
author: Corrina S.

description: Raucous happy hour .. great place for after-office retirement, good stiff drinks and cool brews.  Bartender took good care of our group.  Definitely a repeat.
author: Jim W.

description: Had a nice happy hour here with coworkers.  The place was not very busy from 4:30 - 7:00, which seemed odd.  There did not appear to be any happy hour specials, or if there were, they weren't publicized.  I was happy with my $8 glasses of zin.  I staggered to Subway afterwards and then snubbed the sardine-canned #1 bus and walked up the hill.
author: Daryl E.

description: I've never been here for the nightlife. nor would I ever. Happy hour .... MAYBE... if I'm with work people. But their lunch is really good. Not the healthiest choice, but for a good hearty hang over cure, you should go here. I love the shepherd's pie, and their pastys. Service isn't very great, and the smell... stale alcohol .. isn't too pleasant either, but if you want some good pub/irish food, this place is far better than the Royal Exhange.
author: Marina K.

description: Been to this place a half dozen times...  can't say that any of those attempts has been enjoyable.   It is always crowded with more than its fair share of meatheads, it takes forever to get drinks (which are average at best), and the music is all over the place...
author: Robert R.

description: Have been here when it was entirely empty at 10pm on a Tuesday, once for an insanely busy Friday happy hour, and once for a Thursday night with a million kids, which was what you might expect. Found the bar staff to be pretty friendly even when under pressure. Not the worst place I have ever been but I guess you need to time your visit carefully depending on what you are after.
author: Stuart J.

description: The fact that I heard a "Sweet Caroline" by Neil Diamond three times in the span of 1 1/2  - 2 hours is enough to give it one star.  Enough said.
author: Beth G.

description: Cheap drinks, great dive music, what more do you need?  Add about 5 of my favorite friends in the city and what you get is a recipe for a fabulous night out...and stumbling home.  Thank goodness I live down the street. =)
author: Bhumika K.

description: Nice!  I study a block away from this place so it's a really convenient hangout.  The place is quite nice and cozy for a bar and it was easy to get a table.  The food was pretty good too (at least my crab cakes were).
author: Mrs. G.

description:
This Place SUCKS!! I went for my birthday and had the worst experience of my life! The bartender totally assaulted me and backhanded my drink off the bar when I politely asked him for another shot in my drink as it tasted like just cranberry juice. I was willing to pay for it as well. I have never been so offended in my life. If i recall he actually mocked me and then called me an Fing B#$%@ and told me to get the F out of "his" bar.  
DO NOT GO HERE unless you want to rub up against sweaty 21 year olds and leave crying on your birthday!
author: Adriana L.

description:
best music EVER!!!  (top 20 hits + 80's!)

this bar's a great combination of a bar and a club!
also, the crowd is young (recent college grads)!
author: Shintau L.

description: Head straight downstairs. Get your drink on, get your dance on. Great for intimate groups looking for a good time.
author: Erin M.

description: So. I've never been inside of Kells sober. Perhaps that shades my review a bit, and may explain why I have fond memories of a place everyone else seems to love to hate.  Kells has also been the site of several ridiculous birthday celebrations, so I associate it with good friends and idiotic public displays.   I love to dance- and this place has two dance floors. I've also never had trouble getting a drink.  Maybe I just have good bartender karma. So yeah, the downstairs smells like old gym socks, it's always super crowded, and you will get your feet stepped on at least a dozen times.  But dude- take a shot, join the party, and get over yourself.  Or go to the Redwood Room- I hear it's very clean and smells like expensive cologne.
author: Amanda B.

description: Seemed like a good bar to me. Went with a large group of friends tonight. Upstairs was crowded, loud and hopping. We chilled downstairs on the great couches. Had no problems getting booze, a few people were dancing and there was a good female/male mix. Plus downstairs wasn't as loud. Good times.
author: Jack O.

description: You know, Kells catches a lot of flack for its other life as a mainstream college frat party bar/nightclub (its reputation is well-deserved).  But as a PUB (and admittedly, most people do not know it as such), Kells is actually top quality.  The food is excellent, the beers are great.  And on a weekday afternoon, it is actually a very nice place to have Lunch.  It's also great at accommodating large groups for a meal.  It is only on Friday & Saturday nights when it becomes...something else.  And I just stay away on those nights.  There are probably very few of you who will give Kells a try as a PUB, but if you're near there one weekday afternoon, do stop in.  You may be well surprised.
author: Eric H.

description:
So I haven't been back to Kells for years, after one of those nights where you drank WAAYYY to much and you wish you could erase from your and everyone else you may have met's memory...went back last night after my friend fought with the door guy at Bubble Lounge, and as we wanted to go somewhere walking distance, it seemed a good bet.
Girls got in free, but guys paid $5, which was somewhat surprising given I wouldn't exactly call this a club or classy place, but it was a surprisingly decent crowd (although expect to be hit on within seconds of arrival), with your typical britney etc playing. Downstairs was crowded, but not a packed sauna as it can be, although the drunkards knocking into you as they 'dance' was abundant (don't guys feel BAD trying to get on girls too drunk to stand up???)...only major negative i'd say was that the sprite in both my sprite vodkas (one from upstairs, one from downstairs), was beyond flat! They tasted bad enough that were I not totally sober I probably would have trashed them...
Will definitely be back though!
author: Danielle J.

description: Too crowded and they won't turn on the fans even if it's boiling hot and you ask? Weak bro. Cover charge not helping the rating either.
author: Shooter M.

description: 4 stars for happy hour, 1 star for late night.  When I used to work downtown, this was a cool spot to walk to, meet up with some friends/colleagues and have a few pints and bites.  Late night is a disaster, see everyone else's comments below.
author: Max C.

description: Ugh.  Too loud, too crowded, and WAY too many gross, drunk, sweaty, ass-grabbing, horny men.  I've never tried the food, thankfully, and have only been in this dungeon after about 10 or so.  It was fun, maybe, when I was 21 and didn't know any better.
author: Melissa R.

description: This place was a complete frat party when I went on Saturday night, which normally isn't my thing, but it worked. The music they played was fun to dance to (especially the Irish jig randomly thrown in), but the draught selection was kind of uninteresting. And don't go downstairs, because it's HOT HOT HOT and really does smell like vomit.
author: Amy Z.

description: Always fun here!!!  Great drinks and music  (Cotton eyed Joe does always play here!!!) I saw the transformation of this place go from cool irish pub to totally crowded club scene.  I still like it...it's always fun crowded or dead.  Dan and Gerry are my favorite bartenders.
author: Gretchen H.

description: I work above this bar...yes really hard to work with all the temptation. But during the day they have a pretty decent menu with salads, soups, and sandwiches. Their Tomato basil soup is delicious for lunch. After work it gets pretty packed for happy hour with a wide selection of drinks. The owner and staff of this bar are very friendly people. I have never been here on the weekends but during the week it is a good place for lunch and in the later afternoon good for Happy Hour!!!
author: Shirley E.

description: I have had such mixed experiences with this bar!!! Been here on 6 different occassions over the last few years, and my impressions and satisfaction level vary each time, and are divided right down the middle. On 3 of the occassions I had an extremely enjoyable and memorable time....bartenders were polite, music was engaging, and the whole environment just felt energized, sociable, enthusiastic and lively! Now on the other 3 occasions, I had horrible experiences, leaving me wondering if the place had switched owners or some kind of drastic change had taken place....my most recent experience there, several things took me by surprise 1) it wasnt nearly as busy as id remembered it to generally get on a saturday night  2) the music was absolutely horrendous  3) it was probably over 100 degrees downstairs....and it really wasnt that busy!!!  4) the crowd was completely different.... pretentious, pompous and shallow.   I dont get it....guess it just depends on the night you go....sometimes youll get the fun neighbourhood crowd, other times....your outa luck!
author: dorothy g.

description: Walked into the place and it smelled as if they had urinals behind the bar...Very strong bathroom smell coming out of the place!  Drinks were good, but its hard to mess up a rum and coke...
author: Ryan G.

description: Came here for lunch with my work-mates.  I didn't hear anyone say their food was great or even good except for the possible bizarre exception of the enchilada.  I had a Reuben sandwich, which also wasn't great-really there wasn't much between those slices at all).  Oh well, the company was good.
author: Stephen S.

description: I am not sure how the food is here because I came late and just went to the bar. We did not really have to wait to get in and I can live with a 5 dollar cover charge. The bar was ample size and service was good. The music was awesome. They played rap, hip hop, rock, and even some riverdance music. If you are in the area and want a good irish bar to go to and dance or just have a drink this place is for you.
author: Ryan D.

description: Great happy hour place. If you are hungry, i would keep it simple and stick with the burgers.
author: Not M.

description: The best music in the City if you are looking for a night of dancing to hip hop.  There is a DJ upstairs and another one downstairs so you are bound to find songs you like.  It gets pretty crowded on the weekends -- with kind of a younger crowd -- seems like a lot of college students.  If you can brave the young crowd and are just looking for good, solid music to dance to, you will be content at Kell's.
author: Katie P.

description: One of my Favorites in North Beach. It's a Hit or Miss kind of place. I've walked out a few times because it was dead, But when it's Full and Everyone is happy to see you, it's the best place in North Beach for night life. It's a place you end up at after drinking at a few other places. The European Boys are very cute by the way! Girls get in for FREE!!! Go Ahead talk to the cutie next to you, he won't mind :-)
author: Shelley S.

description: The only thing I enjoyed about this place was the fact that they had both a down stairs and an upstairs.  The down stairs is much better to move around and the bathroom are close.  The music for the most part is horrible.  You can't move, let alone dance upstairs.  The down stairs is so dark I think I see people hiding in the shadows doing lines, like in a bad mob movie.  An did I mention there is a cover for guys!!  To top it off, this isn't the best area to be walking around at 2am.
author: Michael N.

description:
I came here for a friends birthday after much anticipation on a saturday night and it was poppin! we got in really quick, but I was confused to see a much older crowd leaving. As we walked in, the music was loud, and the whole room was dancing. We found our friends in the back, then went to the downstairs bar for drinks. CUTE bartender! We started off with large drinks in nice glasses, but as the night wore on, they became smaller and were in plastic glasses. Although the guy was cute, our drinks were super week- a friend and I each had 4, with little more than a buzz to show for it. There was always good music playing, from top 40 to hip hop to oldies to 80's...soo much fun to dance to! If you don't like a song upstairs, check downstairs for one you do like. Even though it was packed, there was plenty of room to dance, and and even more eye candy. And you could even hold a conversation because it wasn't too too loud.

I had the time of my life here! I'll definitely be back again, and I can't wait :)
author: Sarah C.

description: I love this place!  Not a huge fan of 80's music, but somehow this place pulls it off and I always have a blast!  Great place to go dancing with your date or friends, or if you are single to meet a hottie to have a fling with.
author: David N.

description: Maybe I'm just over it, but the music was horrible and loud and dancing didn't even look appealing.  Yes, it's a bar, but when you can't mingle with your friends because you can't hear a thing they're saying--we have a problem.
author: Natalie E.

description:
Okay, I guess this is a typical dive bar, but it actually was pretty interesting. I expected it wouldn't be so crowded or big. Last time I went here it was on a Tuesday night and no one was in this place. On this Saturday night though it was packed and it felt more like a two story club than a Irish bar.

The amazing thing was how many hot girls were in this place. Maybe it's just me - I've been hanging out in the Mission too much and I was drunk, but damn. The scenery here was really good. Of course, where there are cute girls, there are also lots of meatheads. On that note, this place was like a Marina bar, preppy white kids and barely anyone else. I think I saw like three minorities here and most of them were wearing JCrew with the collar up. 

So yeah, I can understand why this place sucks, but it's also sorta in nowadays for whatever reason so it's worth a shot. Oh yeah, one other thing.
author: Hmmm W.

description: I am a bit surprised at the reviews here.  You go to Kells expecting everything people are bitching about.  It is crowded as F* because its a fun place to let lose and dance the Irish jig (literally).
author: Andrew N.

description: Fun spot if you plan to drink a ton and dance the night away.  The songs are old school and the crowd can be pretty sketchy; don't be surprised if you have your buns grabbed 5+ times in one night as you squeeze through the crowd.
author: Kala H.

description: Fun fun and more fun.  Great music upstairs and down.  Sure it's crowded upstairs but who cares.  Makes it easier to mingle that way.  I have been here a couple of times and have no complaints.  Seems like everyone is there to just have a good time and shake that booty.  Extra bonus.....girls dancing on the bar!!!!  What's not to like?
author: Shawn S.

description: I love going to Kells for happy hour.  The bar always serves good drinks at afforable prices.  Appetizers are pretty decent.  Just one of those low-key places to go to for happy hour.  I hear its also pretty busy on the weekend nights.
author: Charles C.

description: They had a decent selection of beer and the beef pasties were great.  The music was really fun as it was mostly 80's to mid 90's (Upstairs).  Note to the ladies:  Don't tell me you want to take your pants off for me later when your HUGE boyfriend is standing right behind you...Thanks!
author: Nate V.

description: Service ok, price ok, brutal scene.  Cover charge is a joke.  Smells like piss and puke most of the time.  Good place if you want to black out and get greasy on the dance floor with some random, wake up and regret it all the next morning.
author: M M.

description: Def. the best music at a bar that I have been to on a Saturday night, lots of 80's which I love, and other good 90's old hip hop and fun stuff...gets pretty packed, but I had a blast and will be back! And it's pretty big, has a downstairs that was playing other music, and it was good too!
author: Rita M.

description: This is another classic example of bad bar food. The portions are very inconsistent, the food is just alright. If and when you find yourself in there, order either the chicken pot pie (which is probably the best thing there), or beef stew or the open face pork sandwich. do not attempt to order anything else. Order at risk.
author: benjamin c.

description: Everytime I come here its predominantly USF students who make it a point to start fights. Not to say I don't have alot of friends who have or do attend the University Of San Francisco, but those at Kells love to act macho and start unnecessary conflict. Props to the bartenders who somehow keep their cool through it all, but waiting outside and being crammed in for shitty drinks and fights just isn't worth it. Find another pub where you don't worry about some drunk asshole trying to fight you over wearing the wrong hat.
author: Craw H.

description: Let's be clear.  Kell's has a target market in mind.  Drunk dancing fools who are either with a group who only wants to dance or sinlge and want to hook up.  If you are not in either of those groups go somewhere else.  Go there after 11.  If you are male be prepared to wait in line, otherwise saunter in and strut your stuff.
author: Adriel L.

description: how funny that everyone elses review agrees with mine. i use to live in North Beach and i would avoid this place at all costs. the crowd is great if you are between 21-24. if you're any older, you'll feel ancient. plus its obnoxiously loud and thats saying something coming from me! the downstairs is like a steambath of sweat and total meat-market. i guess when i was 21 i liked this kind of scene but not now.
author: Michelle I.

description: Omg, people can really whine.  Stop your moaning people - Kells is kells.  I can't imagine people complaining about what you get from kells. It is what it is and it isn't going to apologize for it and it shouldn't.  after a brief wait on a Friday night, you go in, there's a bar on your left, and another one downstairs.  Two dance floors and lots of crowds all over.  It reminds me (quite a lot actually) of these places I used to go when I lived in Salamanca, Spain.  Woody and brick feel.  Loud enough you mostly have to shout to be heard.  They play the cheesy pop music that (half the time) you know the words to.  And at least someone in your group, it's their FAVORITE song EVER!  They don't try to do too much.  They aren't sophisticated.  They want to get you in, get you drunk, get your booty bouncing and hopefully, get you making out and grinding up on a member of the opposite sex (whether or not you came with someone).  [and btw, in my case, mission NOT accomplished in that regard, but I'm not going to have this be a bitter review  ].  I am happy to report Mission-80%-accomplished. in? check. Drunk? Check. booty bouncing? Almost.  And from looking around: Mission-100% accomplished with a large part of the kells population that day.  Lots of grinding and making out, I'm sure a bunch of them were exchanging saliva before exchanging #'s.  yes, I did that once at kells, I'm not proud to report.  So i think kells had a lot of happy customers that night and so i forsee a lot of those folks making return trips. l too will come back again one day.  Someday when I have friends that want to get in, get drunk, get bouncing to cheesy music and get making out.  Average age: 24.  average looks: a respectable 7. average blood alcohol content: over the legal limit.  anything else: who cares!
author: dan h.

description: Kells has a bar area upstairs and dancing downstairs, so it's perfect if you've got a big group of people who want to do different things.
author: Brian S.

description: Kell's is a good spot to go if you are with a small group of friends and want to go someplace that is packed and loud.  I don't know if you'll ever want that, but it's definately "too late" to go there if you don't get there early unless you like waiting in lines that are constantly being passed through.  It's a good spot to dance when you're completely drunk and like to sweat on the dance floor because the downstairs gets jammed pack and doesn't seem to have any ventilation.  Definately not a spot to bring a g/f or a date.  To get a drink is a task in itself but over I'd say it's what you make of it.  Dan the bartender there is a cool guy that will take care of you if you tip well.  As most places you have to know what to expect when coming to places like this, if not good thing you're on here reading. =)  I've always had fun here but then again i haven't been in a very long time so I'd check some of those more recent reviews.
author: Christian W.

description: Full of Chicago-transplant douchebags with buzz cuts or "the messy-head look."  Lots of khakis, polo shirts and North Face vests.  Total sausage fest.  AND MY DAMN JACKET GOT STOLEN!  F this place.
author: Jim F.

description: i came here with the girls on a saturday night to celebrate a couple birthdays.  drinks were $5 each.  i couldn't believe it.  no sissy drinks either.  jack and cokes for 5 bucks in san fran?  i was stoked.  the upstairs bar area was a little boring, but along the way to the bathroom, my ears perked up to some hip hop.  but where was it coming from?  kell's has a downstairs dance area with music and couches.  kind of a dive bar kind of feel to it..and a bit dark and seedy feeling.  but after a few of those $5 jack and cokes, we weren't complaining.  my friend val had a dance off against a 40 year old married guy.  i don't think his wife was too impressed.  my friend mel got some sass from the smarmy brit bartender downstairs.  but it comes with the territory i suppose.  good times were had by all.
author: Jen K.

description: i don't understand the negativity in here ... maybe it's because i've only come here for after-work drinks, as opposed to going here at night (which i probably wouldn't do).  but going here around 6 or 7 is fine.  the servers are really nice and do a good job of walking around, making sure that everyone who wants a drink has one.  and their pub menu is decent to munch on, like their calamari, potato skins and chicken strips.
author: spiff e.

description: Kells is a great place to go for a fun, and a relaxing night of fun.   Saturday's have a mixture of top 40 music, and some 80's classics.   Cover charge is usually $5.00 or less.   Drink costs are reasonable, compared to other major sf hotspots.   Kells being busy on the weekends, has to be a indication of a cool place to hang out in San Francisco.
author: JERRY B.

description: went here from bubble lounge, and had a better time as did the girls. the cover was $5, but that wasnt bad for a saturday night. we bypassed the line, because of the girls! upstairs was kind of small, but then again i was pretty drunk and cant remember much. downstairs was cool although it was really hot. they did have a fan turned on though. the drinks were pretty cheap which is a plus. they played different types of music which is also cool. more of a college crowd, but i wont knock it for that. overall, good experience.
author: Andrew T.

description: anytime my gf needs a reminder of why she left the OC we stop by here...
author: Jared V.

description: sweaty, crowded, LOUD, groping, stomped-on, sailor-boy bar
author: CAKE E.

description: i've been to kells a few times and it was overall an ok time. the music is typically very good and there tends to be a lot of drunk dancing. it can get really crowded and the crowd is typically that of what you'd find in the marina district. the downstairs is pretty gross. every time i've ever been there the downstairs has been slightly flooded... gross! plus there is an interesting smell that goes along with the flood. this isn't a place that i would suggest going to, but that doesn't mean i wouldn't go there every now and then.
author: Kristin Y.

description: This place is horrible.  The fire department needs to shut this place down.  Both times that I have been there it has been packed to the brim and hot as hell.  Downstairs is an ear-shattering nightmare.  It is a great place to take your girlfriend if you want to see her hit on by a bunch of worthless guys.
author: Brooks O.

description: Kells can definately be a fun place to hang at night. The bar has great prices and they serve 'em pretty strong. It's cool upstairs but the den gets a bit too hot and sweaty. Overall a good place just think they need to mix up their music. But I'm sure il be back eventually, can't beat the cover.
author: Mellie D.

description: This place is not a great bar.  It is decent for an after work drink and they have a decent selection of beer.  The reason I hate this place is simple, the weekends.  This might be the biggest bridge and tunnel bar in San Francisco.  Don't believe me?  Go there on a Friday or Saturday night and look at the line of people waiting to get into a Irish Pub??? Then you can find out about a cover to get in..... You look at these poor aimless souls that think this is how it works in the big city and wait like cattle to be let in to have the privilege of being served here.   We were out in the neighborhood and we had some friends that were going out in SF for the night and were at Kells (surprise surprise).  I ask the miniature sized bouncer who was controlling his line to quickly go in and look for them to bring them out so we could go to a real bar only to have him demand $20 from me.  Mind you I was leaving 4 friends outside to try and quickly go grab our friends.   But this toughguy who probably weighed about 170 on a good day wasn't having it.  We ended up leaving or friends to suffer and went out and had a fun time.  Stay away from this place on the weekends.
author: Eli Z.

description: I hate hate hate Kells.  This bar is the best example of how a layout can really screw up a bar.  Both on the upper and lower floors, the bar is about 3 feet from the wall.  It creates quite the bottleneck to get from end to end, especially since this place gets crowded, despite all these  reviews you see on Yelp.  Use the stairs wisely, there's a set in front and back.
author: Nate B.

description: usually good music. most times it's way too loud. the crowd seems to be getting younger and more foreign, which isn't necessarily a bad thing. and don't EVER eat there for lunch unless you are willing to spend at least an hour and a half waiting for your burger. efficient is not an accurate description of the service there.
author: Dean E.

description: nice bar.  on a saturday night it was empty at 10, and packed at midnight.  there's a fun downstairs dance area too.  if i was forced to go out in north beach, this would be my pick.  expensive drinks, but good atmosphere.
author: Greg D.

description: this place is only meant for you if you want to get shit faced and go home with someone...highly recommended for the drunk and horny...otherwise...i can't stomache more than one drink at this joint.
author: Teresa H.

description: This is my favorite bar.  I loooooooooove it.  It has my name and it was established the year I was born.  I love the crowd there and the staff are really nice.  I had a party there in the private room and it was so great.  They decorated it so nicely and I got tons of food that everyone loved.  The decor is lovely.  It feels kinda like someone's house.  I haven't had a bad drink there either!  Go to this place.  You'll love it.  It's a restaurant before 9 and starts hopping with a nice mix of people around 11 for some great top 40 and classic hits.   Kells is awesome!
author: Kelly L.

description: great music for st patty's last wknd and nice bartenders...but they wouldn't let a friend of mine in...hmph...
author: sarah e.
